story:
Short Summary

My Name is Beau and I am a Uni student who understands the pressure and stress of what University brings. From assignment deadlines to trying to pay for food. The common thread that I see throughout University life is those who struggle with issues of mental health. 
charlestea.com
Instagram: charlestea1
Many students don't take time to connect with others and develop the relationships with their peers. CharlesTea is focused on the connection of the health benefits of Tea and connecting Youth population with others. When we share and "break bread" or share Tea, we forge a common understanding that is therapeutic for our mental health. Social Media or the aimless scrolling of Facebook cannot replicate the function of the laugh of two friends sipping on a  hearty cup of English Breakfast.
The contribution you make helps to fund the sourcing of different Teas that have known health qualities. It will also help with the funding of an Online Store that will target a more youthful audience. It will include packaging, label development and webpage development. 
History demonstrates humanity's love-affair with Tea and how it is symbol of cultures globally. 

What We Need & What You Get

I want to source initially around about 10 different teas, these tea will include Black Teas to Green Tea.

  • I need $1000 for my initial shipment of Tea from a local supplier: this includes packaging and logo branding.
  • Web development will cost $500 
  • $300 for Teapots and Tea accessories.
The final $200 will go toward the Headspace National Youth Mental Health Foundation.
I cannot explain how excited I am to share the love of Tea with others. We are all connoisseurs of Tea. Our opinions on the taste and flavour matter. 
If cannot reach the target at the end of the period, I will donate 10% of all money raised to Headspace
The Impact

In the broader scheme of things we all battle with the issues of mental health and therefore this cause is part of who we all are. The CharlesTea Project is forging a belief in the product of Tea with the desire for the masses to share it with another. Analyse it, Taste it and love it. The Project consolidates the belief in a more healthier mental capacity when we engage in raw and genuine human interaction. I know this works, I have seen it. It has helped me through times of struggle. The things I have learned over a cup of Tea with a complete stranger amazes me.

Risks & Challenges

The risks and Challenges that I do face are that I am a university student who lacks a regular income. I only really can own the bigger dollars on summer holidays. Therefore I have trying to divide and prioritize the money between: Rent for 2016 and funding my business ideas. 
This funding would overcome these hurdles, as I wouldn't have to fall short with ideas. I could fully fund them and gain the proper results I need to make CharlesTea successful.

Other Ways You Can Help

The smallest fund helps with not only raising the issue of Youth Mental Health but also developing a strategy to tackle it head on. It creates an interest, a shared connection and in some cases a friendship that could be lifeline. 

If you can't donate, please share and get the word out there about a Project that will promote a healthy lifestyle that invariable helps with maintaining great mental Health.

story:
Corlea needs to replace her old car with a new one.
She has decided to offer some of her paintings in order to reach her goal.


Her Story
Corlea van der Walt has been a paraplegic for the last 36 years. In September 1979 she was a civilian passenger in a government vehicle which overturned and because the relevant department had indemnity from any claims, she received no financial compensation. 

Despite it all Corlea became a true inspiration for many and as music teacher she continued teaching piano and acting as accompanist for Youth Choirs. She has also been church organist for the last 35 years. 

To be active in her community and carry out her daily commitments Corlea uses a special customized car. 

Unfortunately her current car has become unreliable and needs to be replaced.

Corlea has decided to offer some of her paintings as perks in order to reach her goal.

 
The Goal

The goal is USD 35 000 with breakdown as follows:

1.  New wheelchair friendly vehicle - USD 29 500

2.  Driving aids and Installation - USD 2000

3. Wheelchair Lift and Installation - USD 3500


The Perks 

Painting Nr. 1: Seaside

Painted by Corlea - Acrylic on canvas.
Original Size: 40x30cm (16x12inch). 


Painting Nr. 2: Village Girl

Painted by Corlea - Acrylic on canvas.
Original Size: 41x61cm (16x24inch).



Painting Nr. 3: Old Cape Town Street

Painted by Corlea - Acrylic on hard board.
Original Size: 61x45cm (24x18inch).



Painting Nr. 4: African Bushveldt

Painted by Corlea - Acrylic on canvas.
Original Size: 61x45cm (24x18inch).
(The original painting has been sold; only digital
copies still available - see perks on the right).


Painting Nr. 5: Poppies

Painted by Corlea - Oil on canvas.
Original Size:90x70cm (35x27inch). 
(The original painting has been sold; only digital
copies still available - see perks on  the right).


Please take note that all Perks are offered in US dollar.
To find out what the estimated amount would be in your own currency 
you can use the following calculator: http://www.xe.com/currencyconverter

Be kind and tell your family and friends about this campaign.

story:
Dead Drop Service with Server Wipe

*Email software from Roundcube https://roundcube.net/screens/.

*1800 mailboxes are available for 1 year for $5 per mailbox with 250 MB of daily storage which will be erased from mailbox and wiped from server after 24 hrs.

*Dedicated Server will be hosted through VND Hosting of San Antonio USA, www.vndx.com, but there will be no IP logs, no backup of email and email will be erased from mailbox and wiped from server after 24 hours for your security and privacy.

* Get Dead Drop with Server Wipe  with security and privacy in the US for about the price of an App. After the email is deleted daily it's gone from the mailbox and wiped from the server and can't be recovered. Top secret or not, it's like having your own personal server, just like Hilary.

*Lets say all email encrypted or not encrypted is collected or monitored, Dead Drop Service with Server Wipe allows you or persons in your community or social network to log in with your username and password to look at a message or file without emailing it. Worst case scenario is the Dead Drop Service with Server Wipe  server is monitored but the email or draft in the mailbox is deleted from the mailbox and server after 24 hours.
 

* It is my personal goal or mission to provide Dead Drop Service  with Server Wipe as close to free as possible. Support will go to cover startup costs and to keep server and Dead Drop Service with Server Wipe operational. The goal is not to make a profit. It is to provide a service that is secure and helps customers maintain their privacy.

Thanks for your support

Ricardo


Definition:

A dead drop or dead letter box is a method of espionage tradecraft used to pass items or information between two individuals (e.g., a case officer and agent, or two agents) using a secret location, thus not requiring them to meet directly and thereby maintaining operational security.

Dead Drop Service with Server Wipe (Most Secure)

*No IP Logs and Email encrypted on Server which is wiped from server after 24 hrs.

How it works

1. You go to the Dead Drop portal and sign up paying with paypal, credit, debit or bitcoin. (Portal will go live Oct).

2. You will get an account with a master login and password for the account (mailbox).

3. Send username and password via another secure email provider to another person, members in your community or social network.

4.Create a message in the mailbox. Leave it as a draft or send it to self.  (Message does not leave the server).

5. The recipients will use the  username and password to login to  Dead Drop portal to check for messages periodically and compose responses.


6. All messages in the mailbox will be wiped from the server after 24 hours.


"Log in, read message. Compose response. Log out. Mailbox contents are wiped from server after 24 hours".


Safely transfer and look at large files without emailing. (Secure)
1.Attach file to message or draft. Send message to self or leave as a draft.
2.Recipient  views or downloads the file to their personal computer to flash drive.
3.Recipient keeps downloaded copy to flash dive.
4. Original file is deleted from dead drop service with server wipe after 24 hrs.

Conventional Email(included) from Dead Drop Service (Least Secure)
1.Login to Dead Drop Service.
2.Compose email.
3.Send and log out.
4.Email will be wiped from boxes and server after 24 hours.

*Note: If using Dead Drop for security purposes do not use Dead Drop email to send username and password to recipient. Use third party.

____________________________________________________________________________
Perks
$5.00 a year gets you 1 year Dead Drop of service with server wipe.
_____________________________________________________________________________
Referrals

$600 that your friends contribute will get you 1 free subscription to Dead Drop Service with Server Wipe for personal use.

story:
Hello, 

My name is Robin and I am 47 years old.  After having worked in the social services field with marginalized clients for 25 years I decided it was time for a change.  I convinced my life and now business partner Mollie to join me in this new adventure. Mollie had also worked with marginalized clients as an MSW for the past 25 years.

I remembered some of the best times of life being when I worked at 7-Eleven as a cashier from the ages of 18 to 22.  So, I thought it only made complete sense to purchase a tired run-down neighbourhood convenience store that required a lot of TLC.  After several attempts at presenting my business plan to the banks for a small business loan I was finally successful!!  We took possession of J. C Convenience Store May 23, 2014.

Mollie and I worked side by side for the first four months, both working 95 hours plus a week just learning the business.  We continue to work everyday and after 14 months have just started taking Sundays off together.  We tapped all of our savings; including RSPs, cash available from our pensions, credit cards and life insurance policies in order to complete much needed renovations from lighting to flooring and everything in between.  We are very proud of how our community convenience store looks now and everyone in the neighbourhood is supportive and excited to have a place to meet for coffee and pick up those fresh, dust free, well-priced last minute items.

The business continues to grow and the potential for growth is real.  Unfortunately this infrastructure and road project that has been going on for the past five months in our immediate neighbourhood (often just outside our front door) has hit us hard.  We appreciate and understand the project needed to be done, it was just bad timing for us.  The guys involved with this project have been amazing. The City of Hamilton and DeFaveri Construction have worked efficiently and made it a priority to keep us in the know right from the beginning.  Both sets of workers and our City Counsellor Arlene VanderBeek are empathetic to our situation but unfortunately there is no compensation available...(we have researched this extensively).  

We are falling behind very quickly and are asking for a hand up.  Please know that when we are in the position to return the deed we will help as we can. 

This is what we are in arrears with; Lumsden/Sobeys Distribution $3174.44, hydro $2667.90, rent $1695.00, National Leasing Group $928.66, HST $861.50, Payroll remittance $606.52, Bell phone $291.42, Bell internet $176.28 and WSIB $71.19.

This is our last chance.  There are no other resources available.  I do not want to lose this business.  We have worked so hard.

Sincerely, 

Robin and Mollie

story:
Many of you already know the delicious chocolate from Bowlerman Confections. Unfortunately many months ago we were forced to close due to a series of unfortunate events.  Our cocoa bean grinder broke, supplier stopped selling cocoa beans, all other cocoa beans were too high priced, and just no way to catch back up.   Since then many of you have stopped by my wife's hat booth at Hunt & Gather and have asked, begged, even pleaded for more chocolate.  With this crowd funding page we hope to be at the Sept. Hunt & Gather and back in the swing of things.

At this point and time we do not have the funds available to get back off the ground.  With your support and love for our sweets we can get back to making your favorite Bowlerman Confections and chocolate.  


What We Need To Bring Back The Bowlerman

Break It Down Now:

  • $200 for licensing and fees.  Without these we cannot sell our chocolate to the public.
  • $400ish for chocolate, cocoa beans, and other secret ingredients.
  • $150ish packaging supplies.
  • $250 for a new cocoa bean grinder.

Risks & Challenges

While we hope we are able to reach the goal and be at September Hunt & Gather we know that issues can arise.  The funds, regardless of reaching our goal, will be used to bring back Bowlerman at least by December.  Michael (Mr. Bowlerman) has missed doing shows and sharing his chocolate with the people.  He plans on making sure Bowlerman doesn't disappear again.

story:
Mr. Dondup Laida, aged 26 years, from Gelling Village, Upper Siang District of Arunachal Pradesh (Pemakoi), India, is suffering from liver cirrhosis. His family has limited means and cannot pay for the liver transplant advised by his doctors at Apollo Hospital, Chennai. The transplant and treatment is very costly: estimated between Rs.30.00 lacs and Rs.40.00 lacs (USD $60K).  After completing his Master’s degree last year, Dondup Laida has been living in Itanagar and searching for a job. He is a good, hardworking person who is just taking his first steps into the adult world.

This heartfelt appeal is sponsored by many well wishers, led by his cousin, who want to save Dondup Laida’s life. Kindly donate generously to help one of our Pemakoi brothers. We assure you, the money you donate will not be misused. If we receive more than enough money, the remaining amount will be invested in various projects that are progressing in Pemakoi Region.

Please, please donate generously to save my beloved cousin.

Thank you,

Pema Phuntso

Contact: 9862983725


MR. Dondup Laida

https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=6950321...

story:
Imagine a world without play 

In the hospitals we work with in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, some of the children have to stay a long time while they try to recover.  Many well children spend long hours waiting while relatives are cared for.  Imagine being a child in a hospital where the resources are so scarce, there isn't enough to spare for crayons, let alone a place to really play.  

These children long for a place to engage and slowly strengthen their minds and bodies, a place to be free to escape their troubles through imagination, a place to safely pass the time among peers- a place to be kids.  

Through our ArtHeals program, Artists For Charity has formed a partnership with a hospital that sees tens of thousands of children each year who could hugely benefit from a safe place to play and heal.  The hospital has space for a playground, and we have a skilled and dedicated volunteer, Mr. Jim mcComb, to build it.  

 With the help of Kids Around The World, a non-profit dedicated to providing play areas to underserved children across the globe, we have the opportunity to install a safe, extremely durable playground onsite- a project that will serve tens of thousands of children who need it.  

But we can't do it without help.  We need supporters who believe in the power of play and childhood to come forward, to help us raise the funds to get the equipment and tools we need where they are needed.  

Artists for Charity (AFC) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit orga­nization, and all donations towards this project are tax-deductible. You can support in the name of a child that is special to you, or a place that made your childhood magical.  You can be a part of bringing laughter and joy into a place of suffering and sadness.  Together, we can help heal through play.  


Project Details:

What we have:

  • A large, fenced area on the grounds of a major pediatric hospital in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia.
  • Reduced-cost, durable playground equipment available through Kids Around The World.
  • A skilled project leader, Jim McComb, who has volunteered to build the playground equipment and install it.
  • A team of volunteers to help Jim make it happen.
  • Thousands of children in need of a safe place to play.
What we need:
  • $10,000 to pay the remaining cost of the equipment, and the cost of shipping it to Addis Ababa.
  • $1,000 to cover the cost of tools and materials Jim will need to complete the project(mostly concrete to properly anchor the structure in place).
  • $500 to pay for the transportation of supplies and volunteers to the hospital for construction. 
See your contribution in action!
  • In addition to a heartfelt AFC thank you for your tax-deductible donation, AFC will provide photos of the project as it progresses and is complete- so you can see your gift in action!
What if we don't raise enough? 
  • If we are unable to meet our goal, the funds raised so far will serve the children in a smaller scale, impactful way- such as by providing coloring books and crayons to patients, or by funding art therapy programs at the hospitals.  

Why AFC?

In addition to our other programs, AFC has been dedicated to making hospital time less frightening and more healing since our ArtHeals program began several years ago.  

This program was the idea of the kids at the AFC Children’s Home, who have volunteered their own time and effort to make it a reality.  By using art to transform the children’s wings in hospitals and clinics with bright colors and friendly images, we endeavor to make these environments less frightening and more engaging for the children who have to spend their time there. 

The program has been so successful, we have been asked by a growing number of hospitals to uplift more pediatric areas, and to return to expand our project in the places we've already served.  

Health professionals surveyed at these sites state that AFC's efforts have improved their relationships with their patients, created a more friendly environment for children, families, and staff, and even helped the children heal by improving their emotional state.  

Learn more about Artists For Charity, ArtHeals, and ways you can become involved by visiting us at: www.artistsforcharity.org! 

Help by sharing!

No matter how much you are able to give to our campaign, you can support the cause by spreading the word!  Please share!  Thank you for helping us provide a Safe Place To Play.
story_txt:
Imagine a world without play 
In the hospitals we work with in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, some of the children have to stay a long time while they try to recover.  Many well children spend long hours waiting while relatives are cared for.  Imagine being a child in a hospital where the resources are so scarce, there isn't enough to spare for crayons, let alone a place to really play.  
These children long for a place to engage and slowly strengthen their minds and bodies, a place to be free to escape their troubles through imagination, a place to safely pass the time among peers- a place to be kids.  
Through our ArtHeals program, Artists For Charity has formed a partnership with a hospital that sees tens of thousands of children each year who could hugely benefit from a safe place to play and heal.  The hospital has space for a playground, and we have a skilled and dedicated volunteer, Mr. Jim mcComb, to build it.  
 With the help of Kids Around The World, a non-profit dedicated to providing play areas to underserved children across the globe, we have the opportunity to install a safe, extremely durable playground onsite- a project that will serve tens of thousands of children who need it.  
But we can't do it without help.  We need supporters who believe in the power of play and childhood to come forward, to help us raise the funds to get the equipment and tools we need where they are needed.  
Artists for Charity (AFC) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit orga­nization, and all donations towards this project are tax-deductible. You can support in the name of a child that is special to you, or a place that made your childhood magical.  You can be a part of bringing laughter and joy into a place of suffering and sadness.  Together, we can help heal through play.     
Project Details: What we have:  A large, fenced area on the grounds of a major pediatric hospital in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia.
Reduced-cost, durable playground equipment available through Kids Around The World.

A skilled project leader, Jim McComb, who has volunteered to build the playground equipment and install it.
A team of volunteers to help Jim make it happen.
Thousands of children in need of a safe place to play.

What we need:

$10,000 to pay the remaining cost of the equipment, and the cost of shipping it to Addis Ababa.
$1,000 to cover the cost of tools and materials Jim will need to complete the project(mostly concrete to properly anchor the structure in place).
$500 to pay for the transportation of supplies and volunteers to the hospital for construction. 

See your contribution in action!
 In addition to a heartfelt AFC thank you for your tax-deductible donation, AFC will provide photos of the project as it progresses and is complete- so you can see your gift in action!

What if we don't raise enough? 
If we are unable to meet our goal, the funds raised so far will serve the children in a smaller scale, impactful way- such as by providing coloring books and crayons to patients, or by funding art therapy programs at the hospitals.  

Why AFC?
 In addition to our other programs, AFC has been dedicated to making hospital time less frightening and more healing since our ArtHeals program began several years ago.  
This program was the idea of the kids at the AFC Children’s Home, who have volunteered their own time and effort to make it a reality.  By using art to transform the children’s wings in hospitals and clinics with bright colors and friendly images, we endeavor to make these environments less frightening and more engaging for the children who have to spend their time there. 
The program has been so successful, we have been asked by a growing number of hospitals to uplift more pediatric areas, and to return to expand our project in the places we've already served.  
Health professionals surveyed at these sites state that AFC's efforts have improved their relationships with their patients, created a more friendly environment for children, families, and staff, and even helped the children heal by improving their emotional state.  
Learn more about Artists For Charity, ArtHeals, and ways you can become involved by visiting us at: www.artistsforcharity.org! 

    Help by sharing! No matter how much you are able to give to our campaign, you can support the cause by spreading the word!  Please share!  Thank you for helping us provide a Safe Place To Play.

story:
The time has finally come for me to set out on my own. I have been cooking for more than 2 decades, working alongside some of the best cooks in the country. In my years of grinding in southern kitchens I have learned so much about food, but also about time management and how to squeeze every little penny of worth from every morsel of food. Making great food is a huge part of the food business, but the mesh of hospitality and business comes from experience, and learning from my own mistakes as well as those around me is a great advantage. I've been a part of opening a handful of restaurants- high end to casual, all the while learning the art of controlling expenditures.  I have an innate love for southern flavors and culinary traditions but also have a grasp on progessive techniques and trends, and have always enjoyed getting gritty in the kitchen and pulling more than my own weight, but have always had to eventually answer to someone else. The opportunity to own a food truck will make my dreams of being my own boss/landlord a reality. If I feel a dish needs a little more umph? I can just alter it. If I want to bring the food to 2, maybe 3 corners of the city in one day? Boom.. on the move.  

I was lucky enough to grow up in North Carolina and have spent a lot of time cooking here as well. The agriculture in this state is amazing, better than most; The farmers and artisans are uber passionate about their work, and rightfully so.  With this food truck I want to create an opportunity for farmers to showcase what it is that they do from sun-up to sundown. I think helping to create a draw to these farms and emphasizing their importance is imperative to the present and more so for the future. This truck will hopefully become a catalyst for people to go out and meet local growers, or cattlemen, or cheese makers, or fishermen, or brewers and vintners. Hopefully we will spend most of our time on this truck doing pop-ups on farms and other events around the state. We will also be using North Carolina product everyday whenever possible, making people excited about the food grown around them. Having worked in many different styles of restaurants, I am capable of doing high-end dinners and catered banquets, as well as a faster, more casual (and more affordable) lunch, dinner, or late night snack in the street. The menu will rotate according to your likes and dislikes, as well as seasonal availability. You can rest assured that you will always see some soups, salads, sandwiches, and small bowls of awesome that will scratch that itch for something fun or clever or familiar and always delicious. 

I am sure that money is tight for everyone, I know first hand how it seems there are always more dollars going out than coming in. Helping someone else financially can be tough.. it was tough for me to finally ask you for help, but I have to start somewhere. Even if you can't help to fund this dream of mine, please just share this campaign and spread the word. I want to help bring deliciousness to your life and spread the good word about the farmers in our state! The money raised during this campaign will go towards the purchase of a completed food truck that was built last year. It was successfully utilized by a very talented chef who is now working in a brick and mortar restaurant. On top of purchasing the truck, the money will help pay for permits, rent at a commissary kitchen for a month, buy starting inventory, and pay employees' salaries for a couple months as well. I've spent more than 2 decades honing my craft, now I just want to get a dream off the ground.

story:
Who Are We?

Elevated Wellness Center is based in Halifax, NS, Canada owned by Scott Walsh and Ricky Goodall. 

We believe that true wellness is a balance of success, health and happiness through nourishing mind, body and soul. 

We want to offer every aspect of wellness to help individuals find themselves and live a happier, healthier life. 

We started this business with no loans, no savings and no investments; just hard work, great service and faith in our community. 

We believe that when you have a dream and support your community, your community will support you. 

We offer personal training, holistic and sports nutrition coaching, counseling, meditation, yoga, martial arts, dance, psychic services, alternative healing, herbalism and much more. 

What We Need & Why

We're looking to raise funding to renovate our center so we can offer:

  • A group fitness studio
  • A by-donation acupuncture and Chinese medicine clinic
  • A by-donation cafe and smoothie bar
  • Private, executive fitness studios
  • An "Expression" studio for yoga, martial arts, dance and meditation
  • A retail store full of health supplements, natural foods and herbs 
  • Additional services including personal development coaching, stress management counseling and more 
Our renovation project requires:
  • flooring
  • paint
  • new ceiling tiles
  • general construction including tearing down a couple of walls
  • signage outside of our building
  • repairs 
  • electrical work
  • minor plumbing 
  • an interior decorating plan 

The Impact

Every month we host a Come-Unity Karma event to help support a local business and charity by offering all of our services and donating 100% of the proceeds. 

20% of all funds raise in this campaign will also go to Ronald McDonald House for children in Halifax who are facing health challenges 

At Elevated Wellness Center we truly believe in elevating the wellness of our community. As we continue to build our center we will continue to offer affordable and in many cases free services to help make our community a happier, healthier place to live. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We're completely open and interested in any other ways you can help including offering services, donations or barter!

story:
Having been beekeepers since 2005, Peace Bees wants to give struggling honey bees and disadvantaged workers a second chance to thrive. Your contribution will help us expand our sustainable beekeeping practices and provide disadvantaged workers opportunities to learn job and life skills via 1-year training programs.

     

The Impact

The Peace Bees name comes from the misunderstanding that honey bees are mean and want to sting; rather, honey bees are quite peaceful creatures. Honey bees only become aggressive to defend their hive and can sense fear and negative energy. This forces the beekeeper to control their mood and to increase their level of respect for the bees resulting in a therapeutic environment for the keeper. Similar to the honey bee, some people are misunderstood and have difficulty finding gainful employment. Some veterans, the disabled, or parolees all face challenges finding employment. We intend to give these people a second chance by teaching them job and life skills, and provide them employment during a 1-year training program. At the end of their year, the individuals will be ready to transition into the mainstream workforce or even explore opportunities working for commercial beekeepers across the country. To help insure the success of our employees, we partnered with Goodwill Industries of Michiana.

                                                                                                     

Goodwill is providing wraparound support for both us as employers and the clients as employees. Each client will have a case manager that will be in regular communication with Peace Bees. This is a win-win partnership that will set the bar for other programs to achieve.

Through this partnership, we will find candidates committed to embracing their second chance opportunity and the clients will have a proven support system to help insure their success. Regular conversations between Peace Bees, the employees and Goodwill case managers will provide the wraparound support so many people need. Programs like this across the country are successful and we want to bring this success to our area. The national recidivism rate (relapse into crime) is about 65%. Programs similar to Peace Bees Second Chance see rates as low as 4%. Using honey bees to teach job and life skills works! Today, honey bees face a lot of challenges with parasites, climate changes and pesticides. We use methods that mimic the natural environment of the honey bee. We keep larger colonies, do not treat with chemicals, we do not supplemental feed with sugar or high fructose corn syrup. We let our bees be bees. Our methods are so successful we won a USDA SARE grant (Sustainable Agriculture, Research and Education FNC14-957) to study and document our methods. We believe we are giving honey bees a second chance to thrive. Our sustainable, more natural, methods produce the best tasting honey that is free of antibiotics, beekeeping chemicals, sugar syrup or high fructose corn syrup. Our honey is truly natural.


What We Need & What You Get

So why are we looking to you for help? Until now, we have been a family business run from our home. In order to accommodate employees and additional equipment we need to move the business out of our home. This move will cause our operating costs to increase. We need to keep our employees busy and therefore need to purchase more bees and hives. A lot more bees and hives! A hive of bees can cost a few hundred dollars to setup. 

                          

Your contributions will help us setup a proper facility, assist in first year operating expenses like rent, utilities and insurance. Processing equipment doesn't come cheap. A good, not the best, extractor can be $2,000 and you still need other tanks, pumps and tools.  Do not worry; we are not going to squander contributions on the latest greatest gizmos out there; remember, we are about second chances. Our current bee truck, “Beeatrice”, is a 1988 farm truck that is in great shape and serving us well. We have no intention to ever put her out to pasture. 

                

We are also constantly on the lookout for quality used beekeeping equipment and tools to keep our costs in check. We are preparing to buy new but will be frugal if we can find something gently used and a fair price. 

For your generous contribution, we will thank you with one of the many options listed in our campaign. Remember, all perks include FREE shipping to the continental U.S.. Our favorites are our honey and the knowledge that you are helping honey bees and the disadvantaged worker community. 

                                 


Risks & Challenges 

Any business has risks and challenges and beekeeping is no different. It is farming and ranching mixed into one which offer challenges different to most businesses. We are working with livestock and our success is very dependent on the weather. Healthy, well adapted queens are also important and we are working on ways to propagate  our own survivor stock to maintain a sustainable environment. We will need to find a source of quality bees and are looking to California as a source but having our own queens will insure our success. An appropriate facility to work from is extremely important. We need an area to build equipment and store it during off season. We also need a clean, area to meet health requirements for both honey processing and our personal care products. Finding both of these may be challenging but we will make it work. 

All of these are known challenges and items we can work around as needed. The biggest challenge is having adequate funding to cover our project costs for the first year. Current market estimates:

Rent, Fees, Legal and Admin  $  36,000
Bees  $  80,000
Honey Processing Equipment  $  4,500
Hive Equipment  $  55,000
Nucleus Equipment  $  3,000
Glassware  $  3,420
Protective Ware and Tools  $  500
Licensing  $  500
Fuel and Maintenance  $  8,634
Insurance  $  6,000
Wax Processing Equipment  $  2,000
Utilities  $  4,000
Total   $203,554 

Once the project is up and running there will be a financial return to sustain the expansion of the business. We are already lining up income opportunities to keep the project going and eager to provide products and services to our waiting customers.

The Peace Bees team has the years of business, education, community and beekeeping experience to make this project succeed. To insure our success, we have our partners at Goodwill who will provide the wraparound support for us and our employees. This project has been a dream of our for many years and now is the time to make it happen. Nothing will keep us from helping the bees and those challenged to find employment.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone can contribute financially, but you can still help by sharing our project with everyone you know. Indiegogo provides tools to help share to make it even easier. You can also contact us for other opportunities to support our project. Either way, we thank you for taking the time to review our campaign and wish you peace. - Steve, Alex and Jonelle -  Peace Bees, LLC

story:
Short Summary

My name is Reshini Premaratne and I am a rising senior at Maggie L. Walker Governor's School in Richmond, VA. In 2010, I started X-Out Homelessness with the initial objective of raising awareness about this demographic in our community, but it has since grown to a fundraising and advocacy effort that spans over 20 schools throughout Virginia. 

As a youth growing up in the suburbs outside of Richmond city, I was never exposed to the issue of homelessness -- I never realized it even existed in my community. It wasn't until I started attending school in the city that I saw the panhandlers and the poverty that surely exists in Richmond. And even as I began to learn more about the issue, I realized that my peers and classmates were still unaware of those citizens that sleep on the streets right outside our schools. This pushed me to make a change. If students are learning about civics and sex education, then why are they not learning about severe issues that plague their local communities?  

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $3,000 to provide laundry and shower services to the homeless through The Daily Planet, an organization located in Richmond city that provides healthcare services to the homeless. These simple resources that we may take for granted can exponentially change the life of a homeless individual -- not only does a shower help build confidence, but it also immeasurably increases the chance of getting a job and making tangible steps to better one's situation. Your donation will provide these citizen of our community with these basic services that they unfortunately lack.

With a donation of $50, you and your family can receive 4 tickets to the skating show on September 12th from 6:30-8:20pm at IceZone in the southside. More than anything, the personal satisfaction for helping local ice skaters perform their programs and raise money for the homeless in our community is immeasurable.

Even if we don't reach $3,000 (although we hope we do!), the donations will still go towards providing integral services to the homeless -- from dental care to eye care to simple check-ups that can literally change lives. 

The Impact

This organization and this event specifically help youth make a measurable impact in their own community. By hosting a youth-led event, not only are individuals ranging from 5 to 19 years old tangibly helping the lives of the homeless, but they are also making a statement in our community that youth are not and will not neglect this population. As a member of this movement, you, too, can dispel the misconceptions that surround the homeless and give attention to this issue that so desperately needs it. 

Last year, X-Out Homelessness also held a charity skating show that involved 34 skaters from all over the state and raised $3,010. Please help us reach even greater heights this year!

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many other ways to help out, too! If you are or know a skater that would like to participate in the show, please fill out this short form: http://bit.ly/1JoJKAi. We will also be holding a silent auction and bake sale during the intermission of the show; if you would like to help out with that portion of the event or volunteer at the show, please email reshinip@gmail.com. 

Thank you so much for helping us X-OUT HOMELESSNESS!

In 2010, I started X-Out Homelessness with the initial objective of raising awareness about this demographic in our community, but it has since grown to a fundraising and advocacy effort that spans over 20 schools throughout Virginia. 
As a youth growing up in the suburbs outside of Richmond city, I was never exposed to the issue of homelessness -- I never realized it even existed in my community. It wasn't until I started attending school in the city that I saw the panhandlers and the poverty that surely exists in Richmond. And even as I began to learn more about the issue, I realized that my peers and classmates were still unaware of those citizens that sleep on the streets right outside our schools. This pushed me to make a change. If students are learning about civics and sex education, then why are they not learning about severe issues that plague their local communities?     What We Need & What You Get Our goal is to raise $3,000 to provide laundry and shower services to the homeless through The Daily Planet, an organization located in Richmond city that provides healthcare services to the homeless. These simple resources that we may take for granted can exponentially change the life of a homeless individual -- not only does a shower help build confidence, but it also immeasurably increases the chance of getting a job and making tangible steps to better one's situation. Your donation will provide these citizen of our community with these basic services that they unfortunately lack.
With a donation of $50, you and your family can receive 4 tickets to the skating show on September 12th from 6:30-8:20pm at IceZone in the southside. More than anything, the personal satisfaction for helping local ice skaters perform their programs and raise money for the homeless in our community is immeasurable.
Even if we don't reach $3,000 (although we hope we do!), the donations will still go towards providing integral services to the homeless -- from dental care to eye care to simple check-ups that can literally change lives. 
    The Impact This organization and this event specifically help youth make a measurable impact in their own community. By hosting a youth-led event, not only are individuals ranging from 5 to 19 years old tangibly helping the lives of the homeless, but they are also making a statement in our community that youth are not and will not neglect this population. As a member of this movement, you, too, can dispel the misconceptions that surround the homeless and give attention to this issue that so desperately needs it. 
Last year, X-Out Homelessness also held a charity skating show that involved 34 skaters from all over the state and raised $3,010. Please help us reach even greater heights this year!

    Other Ways You Can Help There are so many other ways to help out, too! If you are or know a skater that would like to participate in the show, please fill out this short form: http://bit.ly/1JoJKAi. We will also be holding a silent auction and bake sale during the intermission of the show; if you would like to help out with that portion of the event or volunteer at the show, please email reshinip@gmail.com. 
Thank you so much for helping us X-OUT HOMELESSNESS!

story:
We are a small, local gym in southeast London, which caters for all members of the community. We have tried to provide a range of facilities to our local community and desperately wish to have showers installed for the benefit of every age range that attends the gym. 

We wish to have as much of the local community involved in weightlifting, kickboxing, powerlifting, general fitness and boxing, as possible. We wish to get the local youth population involved to prevent them from embracing gang culture.

We wish to get the local youth population involved to prevent them from embracing gang culture.

story:
Summary

In the face of police brutality, anti-black racism as a global phenomenon, and the fight for positive representation , we have been able to create days where black people can generate visibility and celebrate all that makes us unique.

This all started as a simple Tumblr post. T'von (expect-the-greatest) suggested we have a day where the black users of Tumblr post and reblog only selfies. When Marissa (marissarei.tumblr.com) suggested that the day be called "The Blackout", the movement was officially born. The original post started gaining momentum and the final member of the team,  nukirk. digi.tal (nukirk.tumblr.com),  created promo art for the different social media platforms bearing the hashtag #Blackoutday, and to our pleasant surprise, the movement went viral! Since March 6th, 2015 we've been hard at work and listening to feedback and noticing the needs of black online communities.  

We continue inviting black people of all walks of life to showcase and celebrate all the wonderful ways that their black is beautiful. We also want to go a step further and create networking opportunities for black people across social media platforms. That's where you come in. Once properly funded, our long term goals include promoting black businesses and art, launching a non-profit to give back to black communities,  and organizing meetups where people can make real life connections. We have been an opportunity to do real work and we want to take it.


What We Need & What You Get

In order to get our feet on the ground, we need to trademark all affiliated tags and logos, register as a legitimate business entity (in order to get things like tax ID numbers, business numbers, etc), and do a lot of legal paperwork (with application fees!) so that we can grow.  

All funds raised here will go toward:

  • Labor (We will be commissioning black web developers, graphic designers, artists, etc..)
  • Legal fees (trademarking and registration fees, building a legal team)
  • Cost of Web Operations (website and domain fees)
  • Advertising (We have to buy ad space to get the movement supported!)
  • Merchandise (Preliminary merch includes #BlackoutDay wristbands, stickers, and t-shirts!)

Of course, you as our supporters will get to enjoy 

  • Promotion of your blogs, art, or businesses in return for your donations!
  • Exclusive, first print, and totally awesome #BlackoutDay merch.
  • Being an integral part of the first steps to solidify a movement that has already swept the internet time and time again
Any extra money will not only help us start, but keep us going!
If you want a perk, make sure to select it!

The Impact

We've already been able to do so much in the year since the first #BlackoutDay and with selfies alone. We have seen black folks all over the world connect and bond using our hashtag. From here in the United States, to the UK, to South Africa, the visibility our hashtag continues to generate is immense and we'd like to use that power and visibility for generating real world change. The hashtag has been a top trend every single #BlackoutDay on all major social media platforms with hundreds of thousands of posts. Imagine if we could use that visibility to get black art, businesses, and issues the same traffic we've been able to generate for selfies?

Challenges

We face those who perceive our goal of generating positive representation for black people and creating a unique online space for us to celebrate ourselves, our accomplishments, and our businesses as an attack (or 'reverse racism'). Other Challenges include:

  1. Under-staffing. We are relying completely on a handful of volunteers to keep this project going.
  2. Our official platforms need proper support. We are fighting to get the word out about who we are and what we do.
  3. The process of trademarking is a long and difficult one.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute monetarily, sharing this campaign and following us on our official platforms is a way to help us make some noise and reach our goal! Use the Indiegogo share tools to boost this campaign and get folks involved. 

A Thank you to our Featured Faces

A special thanks to the folks featured in our first promo image. Across from left to right, they are:

1) beyondthesmilingeyes.tumblr.com (Instagram: Erica Baedu)

2) suun-power.tumblr.com (Twitter: @MaroonChild)

3) dennyynned.tumblr.com  (Instagram: dxpedenny Twitter:DENNNYYY)

4) tarons-daydream.tumblr.com (Twitter: @tadriant95)

5) ethiohijabi.tumblr.com (Instagram: blxhijabi_)

6) sweetestcocoa.tumblr.com

7) clitaurusjones.tumblr.com (Instagram and Twitter :Miss_Trapsoul) 

8) king-ly.tumblr.com (Twitter: @FuckICare)

9) theantiquesoul.tumblr.com (Twitter:@theantiquesoul)

10) sophiaslittleblog.tumblr.com (Twitter: @SophiaTheAuthor Project- "Cosmic Callisto Caprica & The Missing Rings Of Saturn" http://www.amazon.com/Cosmic-Callisto-Caprica-Missing-Saturn-ebook/dp/B01CAIOB8G)

story:
Sugar Hill Distillery

 

Welcome to Sugar Hill Distillery of North Georgia Mountain area. My name is JD Liebrock and my other half is Keri Finnell. We, along with a team of friends, are on a new venture to crack into the multi-billion dollar whiskey industry.


Flavored spirits is the fastest growing alcohol market in the world. It is growing faster than microbrewery. In the 1800's the state of Virginia had over 3600 micro distilleries; 200 years later and one prohibition period, we have only four active micro distilleries in the state of Georgia. Thousands of people love moonshine, made popular due to the reality TV show the "Moonshiners." However, most individuals do not want to chance being arrested for buying illegal moonshine. That is where we come in - legal corn whiskey! Made in the same copper stills and with the same great water from Sugar Hill, Georgia. So come join our team of investors and become part owner of a company that is in the forefront of the "Legal Spirits" market.


What is driving us to take on this venture?

I have made some great beer, wine and unaged spirits while living in foreign countries. I returned to the United States and found that I love being a beekeeper. It was just a natural jump to wanting to make some good mead and spirit from the honey but I found out quickly that a person cannot make spirits for home use. This was unfortunate since I had made some great spirits over many years. 

I decided to look into how to make whiskey/spirits legally and finally made it through all the government paperwork. It was all the government paperwork and regulations that made me realize why people never make legal shine. I then started working on a business plan that would allow people to come to a distillery and make their own spirits, flavor the spirits, and then place their own name on the label.  


What We Need & What You Get

Fortunately, we already purchased the land with a great source of water and all the paperwork completed. Our next step is purchasing large enough stills to support all the interest from the local community. The funds will be used to purchase three 100 gallon stills and four mash making containers which will allow us to increase production of small batches of fantastic Spirits.

Go to our webpage at www.sugarhillstills.com and see our incentives for all of our donors and all levels. Follow the link on top of the webpage to the Crowd Funding Plan. We have everything from shot glass to Warrants (future stock options) for the company. YES, you can be an owner of a distillery!


What we have invested and the difference crowd funding will make

  • Please go to our webpage at www.sugarhillstills.com and click on the Newsletter at the top of the page, it will give you the breakdown on how the funding will be used. we have already invested $133,000.00 in property, bonding, trade name, equipment, and have the application completed for our federal distillery license.
  • Funding will determine the level of production. Our newsletter defines what we expect to profit based on start-up funds. Market analysis indicate that micro distilleries clear over 2 - 5 million dollars in profit the first year. Most start with one or two stills and do about two runs (distilled spirits) a day.
   

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest risk is keeping up with all the regulations, labeling, license, and approvals. We have taken the steps to mitigate this by hiring a company called "Whiskey Systems" to keep us on track.

We will be publishing our financial books to all investors so that everyone will be able to track our progress.

We will also send out our business plan per email request to our investors. We will always look for feedback on improving the company.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just cannot afford to contribute but that doesn't mean you can't help. Listed below is some of the things that you can do with a little incentive for spreading the word:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about becoming owners of a micro distillery.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Send them to our Facebook page - Sugar Hill Distillery
  • Send them to our Webpage - www.sugarhillstills.com

Have them send us an email with your name and address after they contribute and we will send you our vehicle magnet, shot glass, tumbler, or t-shirt depending on how many of your friends join our campaign.

story:
The Beginning

Meet Jessica and Lauryn. Two friends who share many of the same passions of a reinvented industry: cloth diapers.  Jessica owns a cloth diaper service which cleans and delivers. Lauryn owns a store that sells cloth diapers, along with other natural parenting accessories.

They recently decided to start looking for a joint commercial space to stop operating out of their home to a more permanent and free standing location together in effort to better serve their communities and families. At one point, a space became available and was to be put under contract for rent to own before the seller backed out last minute and sold to someone else.  Now another opportunity as been presented but more funding than before is needed.

What We Need & What You Get

After an exhausting time going back and forth between a seller to get commercial space, it was sold right out from under us.  There was a bit of fuming, some tears, and even some yelling but we bounced back and started looking again for commercial space again.  While we didn't need something large, we ended up finding a space with 5,500 square feet of it that the owner has been willing to work with us for. Unfortunately, that's almost 5 times the size of space we were first looking at which means a little more funding is needed.  We will have to pay for some of the finishing costs (as part of the building is unfinished, but that's okay because it means we get to pick stuff!) as well as security deposits for the building and utilities, and other licensing fees.


We need approximately $4,800 for a security deposit. This will get us the building.

$1,000 for deposits on our utilities, this may be less depending on where we sit in the end.

$2,000-$3,000 for new products as well as restocking old products.

And the rest of what is raised will go towards fixtures, miscellaneous licensing, and commercial equipment that is needed.

$10,000 is a high amount of money to ask for. Really, we need all the help we can get at this point. Every dollar is one more step toward helping us get something else done. Sometimes you just have to jump in, even if you're not competely ready for the opportunity.

The Impact

Obviously this space would be fantastic for us. It would help us expand to a bigger area which would bring in more customers for us both. For Lauryn, it would be more sustainable for her business by moving from solely online based to also having a store front which would help cut on shipping costs for her. For Jessica, it would mean a bigger clientele and the possibility to run the business with her husband, and enable him to get out of the trucking industry to be home with his family more.

Those aside, it would help with an environmental factors by helping more families choose to cloth diaper. Since it takes up to 500 year, or more, to degrade a disposables diaper, every diaper kept out of the landfill is a big step in helping our planet. It also puts more money back into families' pockets and back into the local community by supporting locally owned small businesses.

Risks & Challenges

Loss? That would be customer base. We are driven by our customers and there is always potential to lose them.  That means lost income and a harder time purchasing retail stock and new product, which continues the cycle of not gaining customer base.

We will be challenging this with aggressive advertisements via social media and local advertising in our service areas to encourage customer growths. We attend yearly Earth Day events as well as other vendor opportunities as they arise.

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, monetary help is not all the help we need. We need your help by sharing this campaign to every social media platform you can, and by telling your friends and family to see if they can help, or if someone they know can help.  A share, a dollar..everything helps us out in the end.

story:
IMPORTANT: You CAN contribute to us without selecting a perk. Just click on the 'Select A Perk' button at the bottom and you WILL be given the option. Thanks!

Who are we?

FixIT Leeds is a social enterprise that finds cheap, innovative ways to get people online and share digital skills. We want to set ourselves up in an inner-city area of Leeds (preferably Armley), so we can prosper and help more people!

We’re Al, Daron and Chris; the three directors of FixIT Leeds.


Since  March 2015, we’ve been helping people get into computers from our premises above Armley Junk-tion Café (Real Junk Food Project) in Armley, Leeds. We’re a not-for-profit social enterprise: we want to get people online as affordably as possible. We take unwanted PCs and - with the help of our volunteers and Linux* - turn them into fast, functional life-changers that we sell for as little as £20 to anyone who wants one.

  • We’re a not-for-profit social enterprise, trying to get people online.

  • We also repair people's laptops and PCs (and sometimes mobile devices) for a fair price.

  • We take on volunteers who learn valuable computer hardware and software skills.

  • We donate computers to organisations who want to set up public internet terminals, or internet cafés

  • Our landlords are going to start major structural work on our crumbling shared premises soon, so we need to relocate quick, and need some money to do it!


What They Said...

FixIT is a unique service in Leeds: honest, affordable IT advice and support for anyone who wants it. They deserve to survive and thrive! -Teresa Milligan, Real Junk Food Project director

My computer froze/broke/gave up so I took it into these guys today. They quickly diagnosed the problem and within a couple of hours I had an upgraded, faster system with a second hard-drive as a back-up for very little money. Great job guys. Thank you. - Chris O, customer.

Just want say how happy I am with the service from the guys at FixIT Leeds. They spent a lot of time and energy helping me with my computer. Really helpful staff and friendly. I would highly recommend them to anybody!! - David R, customer 

Service was fantastic. Staff kept me informed and were clearly knowledgeable. Would definitely use the service again. - Anonymous customer (via customer satisfaction survey) 

They were really friendly, explained my options clearly and then charged me a low price for great work. - Anonymous customer (via customer satisfaction survey)

I believe in their ethos, they are easy-going and give you the time and space to learn...My purpose in joining FixIT was to become more confident in computer repair, this has been accomplished.  - Sev, volunteer

For a small community project like us, having FixIT Leeds to assist and support our technical needs has facilitated the running of our service greatly. We would highly recommend them as a vital and important service in the community. - Stefan Robert, Leeds Unity Centre



What We Need & What You Get

We need a new home, and we need it fast!

Your donation will be used for:

  • Researching potential new properties
  • Paying legal fees and deposits
  • Hiring vehicles and making our new premises fit for purpose
  • Paying our rent through an inevitable 'funding gap' as we re-assess our business plan for our new circumstances, apply for new funding opportunities, and let our customers know about our new location.
  • Letting people know about our new location!
In return, we have some great perks, including mates' rates vouchers for you and your friends, T-shirts to prove you're a true FixIT geek, and computer building sessions with one of our knowledgeable members.
If you just want to donate you can also do it by clicking the 'Select A Perk' button at the bottom (confusingly!)

The Impact

We've been hanging around Armley for a while but we really need a permanent base so we can:

  • Continue to help people get online with re-used computers.
  • Keep on repairing your broken laptops as affordably as possible.
  • Take on more volunteers: we're looking at larger spaces which would allow us to bring in four more volunteers.
  • Support more small, local organisations with their IT issues.
  • Potentially start courses so that people can study computer hardware and networking with us.

What happens if we don't get the full £10,000?

We'll still use the money to move, it's just our choices of premises will be more limited, and we'll really have to hit the ground running in our new place!

What happens if we get more than £10,000?

Like most not-for-profit organisations, there are a lot of things we could use extra cash for. Better equipment, more training for staff and volunteers, and publicising ourselves better are the likely priorities.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're skint, that's fine, we know the feeling! It would still be huge for us if you could share this campaign on social media (or by old-fashioned word-of-mouth.) We're relying on word spreading quickly here! If you're a journalist or blogger, one of us is always available to talk about ourselves. And if you know anyone who's sick of feeling ripped off when it comes to computers, please tell them about us.

*We use Linux to resurrect older PCs: we're big fans of open source software, and believe one of the most practical uses for it is keeping older hardware going. We're not prejudiced against Windows/Mac though!
story_txt:
IMPORTANT: You CAN contribute to us without selecting a perk. Just click on the 'Select A Perk' button at the bottom and you WILL be given the option. Thanks!
Who are we? 
FixIT
Leeds is a social enterprise that finds cheap, innovative ways to get
people online and share digital skills.
We want to set ourselves up in an inner-city area of Leeds (preferably Armley), so we can prosper and help more people!
We’re Al, Daron and Chris; the three directors of FixIT Leeds.




Since  March 2015,
we’ve been helping people get into computers from our premises
above Armley Junk-tion Café (Real Junk Food Project) in Armley, Leeds.
We’re a not-for-profit social enterprise: we want to get people
online as affordably as possible. We take unwanted PCs and - with the
help of our volunteers and Linux* - turn them into fast, functional
life-changers that we sell for as little as £20 to anyone who wants
one.




We’re a
	not-for-profit social enterprise, trying to get people online.

We also repair people's laptops and PCs (and sometimes mobile devices) for a fair price.
We take on
	volunteers who learn valuable computer hardware and software skills.
We donate computers to organisations who want to set up public internet terminals, or internet cafés

Our landlords are going to start major structural work on our crumbling shared premises soon, so we need to
	relocate quick, and need some money to do it!






What They Said...


FixIT is a unique service in Leeds: honest, affordable IT advice and support for anyone who wants it. They deserve to survive and thrive! -Teresa Milligan, Real Junk Food Project director






My computer froze/broke/gave up so I took it into these guys today. They quickly diagnosed the problem and within a couple of hours I had an upgraded, faster system with a second hard-drive as a back-up for very little money. Great job guys. Thank you. - Chris O, customer.






Just want say how happy I am with the service from the guys at FixIT Leeds. They spent a lot of time and energy helping me with my computer. Really helpful staff and friendly. I would highly recommend them to anybody!! - David R, customer 
Service was fantastic. Staff kept me informed and were clearly knowledgeable. Would definitely use the service again. - Anonymous customer (via customer satisfaction survey) 
They were really friendly, explained my options clearly and then charged me a low price for great work. - Anonymous customer (via customer satisfaction survey)
I believe in their ethos, they are easy-going and give you the time and space to learn...My purpose in joining FixIT was to become more confident in computer repair, this has been accomplished.  - Sev, volunteer


For a small
community project like us, having FixIT Leeds to assist and support our technical needs has facilitated the
running of our service greatly. We would highly recommend them as a
vital and important service in the community. - Stefan Robert, Leeds Unity Centre





What We Need & What You Get We need a new home, and we need it fast!
Your donation will be used for:  Researching potential new properties Paying legal fees and deposits Hiring vehicles and making our new premises fit for purpose
Paying our rent through an inevitable 'funding gap' as we re-assess our business plan for our new circumstances, apply for new funding opportunities, and let our customers know about our new location.

story:
Summary

Bradbury-Sullivan LGBT Community Center is preparing to open an LGBT community center in downtown Allentown, PA! We recently purchased a 13,000 square foot building in the heart of Allentown's business district (near 5th and Hamilton Streets) and plan to open in early 2016.

Last year, when we announced our vision for a vibrant LGBT community center in downtown Allentown, it was a vision - now it's close to being a reality. We have a building, owned by our organization. The building has great community space for support groups, book clubs, discussion groups and more. We are planning to include an LGBT library with both fiction and non-fiction materials. The Center will provide space for a free LGBT legal clinic, for HIV/STI testing, for LGBT health fairs, and more. Really - the sky is the limit on programming potential, but we need the funds to open our center. 

Hundreds of donors have contributed since June 2014 to make this dream a reality. We are so close, this campaign is intended to harness the power of community to take us through the finish line and open our center in early 2016!

What We Need & What You Get

We are very close to opening - but in order to get there - we need an additional $20,000 to make the repairs and install finishings to open the center in early 2016. We estimate that this includes $10,000 of roofing repairs, $3,000 of electric and plumbing work, $2,000 for paint, and $5,000 for other finishings. 

We are hoping to raise these funds the grassroots way. Your donation of $5, $10, $25 or $50 goes along way! We, of course, appreciate larger contributions as well! 

Frankly, we are committed to opening the center - that's why we bought the building and are moving forward quickly. But the more we raise, the more we can do to make the Center sparkly and ready to open! EVERY DOLLAR gets us closer, EVERY DONOR makes a difference. 

Here's what you get:

  • A vibrant LGBT community center serving the Lehigh Valley
  • A place for LGBT-affirming support groups to meet
  • A home for the Lehigh Valley LGBT community
  • The knowledge that your contribution helped make this dream a reality!

The Impact

Allentown's LGBT community grew by 55% between 2000 and 2010 (US Census), yet the programs and services available to our community haven't followed that growth. Bradbury-Sullivan LGBT Community Center seeks to revolutionize the programs and services available to our local LGBT community. We've been doing great work without a building - imagine what we can do with one!

Risks & Challenges

If we don't meet our fundraising goal, we still plan to open our center - however we'll need to make strategic decisions about the space and we may not be able to open as soon as we would like to.

If you would like a tax receipt for your donation since we are a 501(c)3 non-profit organization, we encourage you to donate directly on our website (www.bradburysullivancenter.org/donate). We are unable to provide you with a receipt if you donate through Indiegogo. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • In addition to donating, we are also in need of volunteers to help with light tasks in the building (such as painting and cleaning). Please email liz@bradburysullivancenter.org if you (or a team from your organization) would like to volunteer!
  • If you have a relevant professional service related to opening a building and would like to provide pro-bono support, please email adrian@bradburysullivancenter.org
  • For donations of $10,000 or more, we have limited naming opportunities for spaces in the center. Please email adrian@bradburysullivancenter.org to learn more about these naming opportunities.
  • We are able to accept donations of appreciated securities. Email adrian@bradburysullivancenter.org if you would like to discuss stock donations.
  • Finally, we have lots of upcoming events, check them out at www.bradburysullivancenter.org/events

story:
What is DownEast LLC?

Hey everyone! DownEast LLC is a startup that focuses on food and hospitality. DownEast was started in order to share great food with great people and put smiles on everyone's faces! My name is Gina Graveline and I'm 28 years old, originally from Bangor Maine, but I've been living in NYC for over ten years. I've been working in the service industry for seven years now and hospitality and food are my passions in life. I love cooking and love even more to share my food with others. I graduated with a bachelors in business administration, concentration in small business and entreprenuership, in order to pursue my dream of owning my own food truck.  I have launched this campaign in order to raise more funds needed to get my food truck started. I consider myself a foodie and one of the main reasons why I love this city so much is because all of the wonderful diversity in the food options available. I have taken some of my favorite food items that you can find all throughout New York and used them to create my menu. My menu is small but packs a serious punch when it comes to flavor and originality. I want to bring a Maine flare using fresh lobster to the street fare food of New York, such as lobster sliders and lobster tacos. I am very confident in my endeavor and can guarantee that people will enjoy everything that my truck has to offer. I have been working very hard over the past few years and now it's time to share my food with all of you! 

What I Need & What You Get

I am looking to raise $5,000 which is just enough to help out with my start up inventory. I will be initially renting a truck until I make enough revenue to purchase a truck. DownEast will also be applying to food festivals throughout New York City where all perks will be able to be redeemed. 
In order to show my appreciation for the help I recieve there will be a customer loyalty program in which, depending on how much money is donated, will provide many perks such as free food from the truck or even the opportunity to have an item on the menu named after you!

Your Impact

Not only will this food truck fulfill my dreams but I hope that in the future I will be able to expand, resulting in new jobs for my fellow New Yorkers. The food truck industry is no walk in the park and takes a lot of hard work and dedication, however I would love to share this experience with other people who have the same passions as myself. I also know for a fact that food is an amazing way to allow people to connect. My goal is to bring people together through my food concept while also allowing everyone to get a genuine expeirience of the food that I grew up loving so much. If you are a true foodie such as myself then you understand how important food can be for people. Putting a smile on someone's face because they enjoy my food is something that is defintley priceless.

Low on Cash....Don't Worry! 

Even if you can't donate any money, word of mouth can be more powerful than anything and it would be greatly apppreciated if everyone could spread the word about this campaign and about DownEast. Please share this campaign with anyone you know that has an appretiation for food and who would be interested in being a part of my journey. Posting this campaign page link through all the social media outlets that you use would be an enormous aid. The Indiegogo share tools are super easy and make it possible for everyone to share the campaign with the world. Everyone involved in this project should know that they are involved in something that is very special in my heart and my appreciation for your help is beyond what words can express. Thank you everyone and let's get this started!!

story:
What is Impact Hub Santa Barbara?

We bring people together to solve problems.

  • Our shared workspace space helps foster collaboration between local entrepreneurs, startups, change makers, visionaries, and more.
  • Our programs and network can help accelerate your business or organization and  your positive impact on the world! 
  • Like our colleagues around the world, Impact Hub Santa Barbara catalyzes the action our local community wants and needs.
  • Our 11,000 sq. ft. downtown location offers private offices, co-working space, meeting rooms, workshops and classes, a startup accelerator, innovation lab, shared event space, and a public cafe

If you are passionate about the Santa Barbara community's success, keep reading and make a contribution! 

Help Us Build a Community

  • Our goal of $50,000 will help us with the development of our Downtown Santa Barbara State Street location in preparation for a December/January opening! By and for our community.
  • The Santa Barbara area is home to many entrepreneurs, startups, artists, and change makers. Help the startup and creative communities build a place for collaboration and enable the next great locally based but globally conscious venture.
  • Each contribution makes a huge difference by expanding our growing entrepreneurial community and strengthening our local economy.

Take a Look Inside

Step into the Impact Hub Santa Barbara and you'll have access to:
  • 16 Offices
  • 8 Rentable Desks
  • 4 Conference Rooms (each with Santa Barbara themes to inspire creativity)
  • 2 Classrooms
  • Expansive Event Space
  • Member Kitchen
  • The Impact of Things Lab - A place where hardware and physical product makers meet to collaborate on new businesses and impactful missions. Take advantage of 3D printers, tools, workbenches, whiteboard space, and more.
  • Public Cafe and Wine Bar
  • Mailboxes
  • 6 Private Phone Booths
  • Patio Work Space


Main Floor Layout

Mezzanine Layout


Downstairs Layout


Santa Barbara Impact

  • This shared space will redefine the business landscape for Santa Barbara entrepreneurs, allowing them to hone their craft, collaborate and learn.
  • Centrally located at 1117 State Street, the Impact Hub is ready to join our fast-growing entrepreneurial ecosystem of startups, non-profits, students, businesses, and change-makers.

Global Impact


  • We believe a better world evolves through the combined accomplishments of creative, committed, and compassionate individuals focused on a common purpose. 
  • Step into any Impact Hub around the world to join our active online community. We offer the space, the community, and the global platform to support social innovators. 
  • Impact Hubs are located in over 70 cities supporting over 11,000 members, with a shared focus on creating positive impact.
  • Members benefit from a diverse global community, resources and shared opportunities between all Impact Hubs.

Our Team 



Fund Allocation

We are underway on our fundraising campaign, but we need additional funds to finish the build-out of an incredible collaborative work, event, and educational space for our community! 

Your generous contributions will go towards: 
  • State of the art community classrooms
  • Amazing programs such as: Financial Literacy, Grant Writing & Fundraising, Sustainable Business Practices, Non-Profit Leadership
  • Locally built furniture for co-working spaces 

Thanks to Our Supporters

 

                          



                                                        

Join Us Today & Make an Impact! 

Interested in becoming a sponsor? Contact us here info@impacthubsb.com for more information.
Thank you everyone for your generous contributions! Your perks will be delivered after the official launch party for Impact Hub Santa Barbara. Please contact info@impacthubsb.com if you have any questions regarding perks.
