story:
Hello Awesome Entrepreneurs:

Do you remember when Rev Martin Luther King said “I have a dream”?….

Well I have a dream (and I know you do too).

I can’t write or speak as elegantly as the preacher from the south but I will try to share my idea with you.

The business world as we know it is broken, inefficient & hostile to newcomers.

The education system teaches us how to become employees and not independent business owners free from the tyranny of 9 to 5 hours & declining salaries.

The world of business networking, advertising & marketing is a chaotic mess where old fashioned methods of communication are failing and the newer, more effective messaging is foreign to most people.

In other words, with "the old boy network" controlling many networking groups, advertising failing to gain customers and traditional sales  methods receiving poor reception from prospects, most small businesses are struggling to get customers & have to work very hard to survive.


Meeting in Toronto, Canada


We aim to change this…

My dream is to build a network of small business owners, entrepreneurs and freelancers in hundreds of cities who genuinely want to connect with kind, friendly & nice “heart-centered” people for the purposes of building our businesses together.

My dream is to create a community of business networkers that…

  •  Places long term relationships ahead of short term deals.
  •  Gives referrals willingly without expectation in return (Paying it forward)
  • Wants to form strong bonds of friendship with other members.
  • Are trying to build businesses run with the highest level of character such as honesty, competency & respect.
  • Wants to give back to the community by teaching or referring other members.
  • Have  playful & interesting conversations in our fun Mix & Mingle networking parties.


I have a ten-year plan to grow our little Smart Success Business Network from 16,457 members and 300 plus organizers in 95 cities to 1 million members, 2,400 to 5,000 organizers in 800 cities.

We have got an ambitious plan to expand beyond just local Free Meetup groups (which are great for getting started to build connections but don’t give the resources to grow & promote our groups) 

I propose three levels of membership: 

1. Our current live groups which are free and open to the public (SILVER Level). These are Mix and Mingle Parties to build relationships and are affordable to those on a budget or want to try out networking for the first time. I promise we will continue to improve and design better meetings as we grow. 

All courses and training on Facebook, LinkedIn & Sales/Marketing for small business will be optional on a pay per user basis. Organizers can learn at this level how to promote, design & schedule their Meetups for maximum success. Members can stay at the Silver level as long as they like with no salesy pressure tactics to upgrade when they are not ready for it. 

Meeting in Detroit, USA

2. An Private Online Website/App (GOLD Level) where Members can promote their businesses to all other Gold members, whether locally, nationally or globally. It’s kind of having a LinkedIn/Gmail account that allows you to broadcast to hundreds or thousands of fellow business owners at all once. 

Unlike regular emails, all messages will be moderated and screened for appropriate content. Only professional messages for business services or products & requests for help will be allowed. The price point will start at $5/mth and up . This is optional and will be offered in beta form starting in March/April 2016 

3. I am planning a private membership for paying members only who are serious and committed to their networking efforts. (PLATINUM level). Unlike most free Meetups, these Meetings may be in private rooms with experienced speakers, coaches assisting us and bundled training on Facebook & LinkedIn Marketing, CRM (Customer tracking) software training, and soft skills education all included in the membership fee. 

The price point will be approximately $30 to $50/mth and the revenue generated will allow us to hire staff, pay for training & coaching, cover printing costs, supplies, rent & Meetup.com/other online costs. Our more experienced organizers will run these Meetings. 

Meeting in Providence, USA

Growing Revenue will allow us to promote ourselves on social media and more members joining will create bigger groups at all three levels. We can also create an affiliate program to give supporters an opportunity to earn additional income. The estimated launch date is early 2017. 

All qualified and active organizers will automatically receive free access the Platinum or Private Meetings (there are special benefits worth hundreds of dollars to being an organizer!) I don’t know if we will bundle the Gold and Platinum levels under one membership – my business partners and I will discuss that possibility. 

Everyone is free to pick and choose one, two or all three membership levels. Silver membership is free and open to all so Platinum members can attend all live meetings whether free or paid. Gold members can also attend Silver meetings but not Platinum meetings. 

If you would like to join (after contributing) click here & scroll down to find your city.meetup.com/pro/smart-success-revolution/


Meeting in Hamilton, Canada


Only with such growth can we help the millions of new business owners that are leaving the corporate world and are scrambling to find prospective clients & customers.

Yes, it’s going to be difficult (for me & the leadership team) and some cynical people are going to mock or discount this dream but this is what I am aiming for.



Meeting in Leeds, United Kingdom


Of course we can’t do all this without your help.

WOULD YOU LIKE TO HELP US GET STARTED?

Our most pressing need this month is fundraising…

and we require about $100 per city for the spring-summer 2016 period or $9,500 in total. 

So we are accepting donations or contributions to keep the group running, expanding & developing into something special.

Actually your online contributions means we can have Free meetings open to our members and their guests and we will not require cash donations for several months depending on the total amount given.

We will use the funds received to pay Meetup.com fees, webinar training and supplies for our organizers. 

By helping with contributions, you are making our Meetups free and open to all business people regardless of their economic situation or experience level.


Meeting in Greensboro, USA


Why should you donate?

1)  You are thanking our hundreds of organizers for volunteering their time & leading their groups.

2)  You are thanking Meetup.com for giving a platform to meet people with common interests.

3)  You are contributing (or pre-paying) to future events & even more fantastic networking parties. 

4)  You are indirectly supporting local bars & restaurants where we host our Meetups.

5)  You are supporting a movement that aims to make business networking fun, affordable and democratic for millions of new entrepreneurs, freelance and contract workers.

Any support would be appreciated. All supporters may join our Network at no additional cost. Meetups only available in major cities in the USA, Canada, UK, Australia & New Zealand.


Thank you so much (in advance) for all your support.

Sincerely

James Zakaria


About us:

FRIENDS HELPING FRIENDS MAKE BUSINESS CONNECTIONS" - J.Z. 

Calling all Entrepreneurs, Business Owners and those who dream of running their own venture! 

If you desire to expand your business network, make more friends, find new customers and become a leader in your community, we have a fun and informal social networking group that is just right for you. 


We'll have monthly meetings at coffee shops or neighbourhood bars in and around town to connect with others & learn "best practice" sales, marketing, finance and time management tactics and strategies from your city’s top entrepreneurs. 


The Smart Success Business Network is a community run by volunteers with 95 Meetup groups in 95 cities across Australia, Canada, New Zealand, the United Kingdom and United States. 

Meeting in New Mexico, USA


MOST EVENTS ARE FREE AND ALL BUSINESS OWNERS & MANAGERS ARE WELCOME. 

• No attendance commitment required. 
• You can arrive and leave on your schedule. 
• No elevator pitches in front of the group required. 
• Informal bar/restaurant meetings in the evenings. 
• Most meetups are between Tuesdays & Thursdays. 
• No long sit down meals next to strangers. 

Our mission is to encourage business success by recruiting small business owners to give group talks to their peers, potential customers and suppliers and new entrepreneurs to share their expertise and offer words of support and encouragement to their community. 


Meeting in Calgary, Canada

We are also known as a "Pay it Forward" group. You might find your ideal client/customer here in your first meetup but it's more likely you will meet someone who can benefit from goods & services offered by your friends. 

By networking to help other business owners and recommending products or services by other members, the benefits of increased sales accumulate to everyone in the group. 


You will learn how to avoid unprofitable markets, attract the right customers, block negative critical thinking, be both effective and efficient, understand cash flow and much more. 

With the right knowledge and support, you can design a life and business that embodies strength and boldness that you know you are capable of. See you at one of our meetings soon.
My Best Perk Offering:

$25 Sponsorship Advertising Space for six months on your local Meetup Group page - plus 3 Bonuses (Social Media/Time Mgt Video Courses)

You can promote just about any business or cause on our page

Your sponsorship advertisement gets you the following:

  • A square/rectangular photo image with a hyperlink to your website. (your image will shrink to fit the 90x120 approx size)
  • 42 character headline with a link to your website
  • 79 character description underneath
  • Unlimited clicks during the advertising period
  • No changes during the period (but will fix errors in first two weeks)
  • Six months advertising (nine months for members who help organize meetings)
  • Ad runs start in March 2016
  • Example below:


You also get:

1.  How to Brand Yourself, develop a Following and Generate Traffic using Pinterest! This 10 part Video/MP3 course is a downloadable, short and to the point blueprint to getting great results on Pinterest. ($20 Value)


2.  LinkedIn Success – How to Build Expert Status, Brand your Business and Develop Business Leads by gaining trust and building relationships. This is a 7 part Video/MP3 course that takes very little time to learn and implement. ($20 Value)


3.  Productivity Booster & Time Management Video Course. This 10 part Video/MP3 course is designed to help you prioritize tasks, reduce overwhelm, eliminate time wasters and get more done so you can have more free time. ($30 Value)


4.  Meetup Events. We want to run more Free Mix and Mingle Business Parties and by prepaying now we can run Meetups for the time being right into Spring and Summer 2016.


So you will receive a 4 for 1 deal worth $100 for only $25 US and…

 … you can put away your wallet when you attend your Meetups.  All our Free Meetups will be covered by your generous contributions.

And if you don’t like your video course/Meetups for any reason, I will return your contribution no questions asked.

You can promote just about any business or cause on our page
Your sponsorship advertisement gets you the following:

A square/rectangular photo image with a hyperlink to your website. (your image will shrink to fit the 90x120 approx size)
42 character headline with a link to your website
79 character description underneath
Unlimited clicks during the advertising period
No changes during the period (but will fix errors in first two weeks)
Six months advertising (nine months for members who help organize meetings)
Ad runs start in March 2016
Example below:





You also get:

1. 
How to Brand Yourself, develop a Following and
Generate Traffic using Pinterest! This 10 part Video/MP3 course is a
downloadable, short and to the point blueprint to getting great results on
Pinterest. ($20 Value)



2. 
LinkedIn Success – How to Build Expert Status,
Brand your Business and Develop Business Leads by gaining trust and building
relationships. This is a 7 part Video/MP3 course that takes very little time to
learn and implement. ($20 Value)



3. 
Productivity Booster & Time Management Video
Course. This 10 part Video/MP3 course is designed to help you prioritize tasks,
reduce overwhelm, eliminate time wasters and get more done so you can have more
free time. ($30 Value)



4. 
Meetup Events. We want to run more Free Mix and
Mingle Business Parties and by prepaying now we can run Meetups for the time
being right into Spring and Summer 2016. 



So you will receive a 4 for 1 deal worth $100 for only $25 US
and…
 … you can put away
your wallet when you attend your Meetups. 
All our Free Meetups will be covered by your generous contributions.
And if you don’t like your video course/Meetups for any
reason, I will return your contribution no questions asked.

story: Porque estoy segura que vendras a mi parcela en Puerto Varas, solicito tu colaboracion para ayudar a implementar este pequeño proyecto, tengo que Limpiar, aplanar, cercar construir y se que me ayudaras con una pequeña donacion

story:
Short Summary

Hello!  This is Dalton & Patrice and we are a dynamic duo, husband and wife team dedicated to serving up quality specialty coffee to coffee lovers in our community and beyond.  Our coffee is locally roasted by Carrboro Coffee Roasters and our manual brewing methods ensure consistent quality in each cup.  

Both of us are Army Veterans and in particular Dalton served in Iraq where he picked up the name "Hollywood" from a Command Sergeant Major that saw him all geared up from the sandstorms and wearing sunglasses.  Years later, Dalton became a filmmaker and we knew that would be the name for our coffee business.  

We picked the coffee business because we not only love coffee but as filmmakers we're always looking for the next film gig and we all know that "Films Equals Jobs".  So between film jobs we make coffee and build community!  Because we have to travel to find film work, we also needed a business that could travel with us.  This is why we need to make Hollywood Java mobile with a coffee trailer.  By backing our campaign you will help us buy a trailer which will take our business to the next level.  

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal for this campaign is to raise $8000.  We plan to have several phases to our campaign in which we target other areas of the business.  For now we're focusing on the trailer and all funds raised will go towards the cost of the trailer, workspace design, signage, permits and other start-up costs.  

We even included a few perks for early backers to take advantage of.  Just take a look at the right side of this page for more details about our perks.  This is of course is in addition to the satisfaction of knowing you're helping out two awesome individuals

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

In addition to your contribution, other ways you can help us is by spreading the word about our campaign and about Hollywood Java.  Please share this link with all of the coffee lovers that you know around the world.  Follow our social media pages in Instagram, Twitter and Facebook at HollywoodJavaNC.  Lastly, whenever you see us setting up at an event come see us and grab a Cup of Hollywood!  God Bless you all and thank you for your continued support!

story:
ABOUT DI LUSSO GOURMET

Di Lusso Gourmet is a family with two young children who have been living locally in Landsdale for the past 7 years.  The idea to open up a Gourmet Delicatessen at Landsdale Forum came from a dream of opportunity and a love for good food.

Matt’s passion for cooking and his ability to create excellent dishes is well known amongst his family and friends.  His part Italian heritage has meant that he has the knowledge and emphasis on Italian food that will prove invaluable to our success.

Winnie has spent the past five years developing her talents as a cake maker, often being asked to cater for family and friends.  Her dedication to creating an edible artpiece has guided her to want to share her love of cake to the world.

Cooking gourmet style foods with a particular attention to the use of top-quality fresh produce has long been a passion of ours.  Di Lusso is the Italian word for “Luxury” and that is exactly the type of food they sell.

SANDWICH BAR SLB1800

The way you cook food is as important as the way we prepare and store it.  At the moment Di Lusso Gourmet have a free-standing fridge containing all the fresh produce to make all rolls as ordered.  It means that they are continually going backwards and forwards to the fridge each time.   

The ability to own a commercial grade sandwich bar will assist in making the most of kitchen space, food preparation a breeze, and all the ingredients organised in a clean chilled environment.  The sandwich bar will also continue to prevent any food contamination during food preparation.  The sandwich bar has 9 deep pans, cross-flow pan cooling, under bench fridge with shelves and much more.

RUNNING A SMALL BUSINESS

Di Lusso Gourmet is a small family business in it’s second year of trading.  It doesn’t come without its hardships.  The rise of overheads including utilities, rent and insurances sometimes makes it harder to invest in large capital equipment.  With banks tightening their borrowing capacity and business loan interest rates range from 4.5% to 12% and above; we are asking the local community to help invest in a small family business grow and continue to serve delicious, fresh, wholesome and affordable food.

People love what Di Lusso Gourmet have offered at their Delicatessen and continue to return time and time again.  Matt & Winnie believe in giving their customers a personal and fun experience in a relaxed manner.  Most of their customers are greeted on a first name basis.

Assisting Matt & Winnie complete this project will be forever appreciated and allow them to give back to the community and clients, the ability to pass on their passion and enjoyment of providing high end gourmet deli foods, sweets and coffee each day.  It also gives you the opportunity to also choose from a range of wonderful one-off rewards only available for 30 days.  There are many opportunities and rewards to enjoy so look at the full range, or if you just want to donate then go to the "BACK IT" button at the top of the page.

If you are unable to assist us financially, that’s ok too... but please, can you help by sharing this with your friends? Indiegogo makes this easy with their sharing tools above.

Thank you for reading and watching the accompanying video.

story:
Help Mareg building his own trekking tourism company!

Thousands of tourist visit Lalibela in Ethiopia each year and use the area as a gateway to the surrounding region. Lalibela is the heart of the Amhara Region where you can find the source of the Blue Nile river and the highest point in Ethiopia, Ras Dashan (4 543 meters) in the Semien Mountains.  The project aims to give a stable source of income to Mareg and his family creating an alternative option to visit Ethiopia. Mareg is a local tourist guide and he will be happy to show the beauties of his wonderful land.
 

What We Need & What You Get

A fixed asset of £7 500 is required to have legally registered license from the government. Total start-up expenses are £12 000. If you will contribute to this crowd-funding, we will give to Mareg to have a very solid income. Together with Mareg, we could support as well the young student of the elementary school of "Duhalika". The difficulties are many even because it is remotely located, 65 km far from Lalibela in the mount Abuna Yosef. Part of the funding of this campaign is dedicated to economically help the school in the education of its students. The visit of the mount Abuna Yosef and the school are part of trekking tours. During the visit, Mareg will carry goods for the school, such as books, pens, clothes and, if we collect enough money, we can buy chairs and desks for these little students.

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I totally understand if you can't contribute financially. There are lots of ways to help that don't cost a penny! Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.

  • Please spread the word - Share the link to this Indiegogo campaign with your friends, fans, and followers on social media. You can use the "share" buttons right below the video at the top of this page.  
  • Send me a personal message of encouragement - I'd love to hear from you! 

 

LALIBELA

Lalibela has history and mystery engraved in its stones, it has a deep soul with the rites and awe of Christianity at its most ancient and unbending. It is well-known not only as a UNESCO World Heritage site but also as a true world wonder. 
In Lalibela, you will find some of the most famous Ethiopians Rock Hewn churches, mostly referred to as "the living wonders of the world". These churches, built at least 900 years, are an active Christian shrine, the spiritual center of religious life. The monolithic churches were carved out of 2 600 square meters of natural rock during the 12th century by King Lalibela. The churches' landscape and religious sites have been wisely designed to recreate Jerusalem. The churches are clustered in two major groups, one representing the earthly Jerusalem, and the other representing the heavenly Jerusalem.

 

BER METEBEKIYA

One of the outstanding panoramic views of the area is from Ber Metebekiya (3 600 meters). The Ber Metebekia gives you an astounding  360° degree views over the surrounding countryside. Gelada baboons are prevalent in this region. You can walk to one of the villages close to the Wedebye and learn about the life of the local people including farming practices, cattle rearing, and local traditions or walk to the children’s school to teach any subject you would like. Spend the rest of the afternoon enjoying the silence of Ber Metebekiya and overlooking the sunset.

 

ABUNE YOSEF PARK

Abuna Yosef is a prominent mountain near the eastern escarpment of the Ethiopian Highlands. It is the 6th tallest mountain (4 260 meters) in Ethiopia and the 19th highest of Africa. It is located in the Lasta massif in the Semien Wollo Zone of the Amhara Region. A notable landmark on this mountain is the Church of Gennete Maryam, a monolithic church which tradition reports was excavated during the reign of Yekuno Amlak. Another remarkable site is the four free-standing churches build inside caves in the mountain, the oldest and most famous being Yemrehana Krestos Church, built by the Zagwe king. 

 

GONDAR

When traveling in Gondar – it almost seems like being in Medieval Europe. It is also said that J.R.R. Tolkien drew inspiration from Gondar in Ethiopia for his city of Minas Tirith in his Lord of the Rings masterpiece. Gondar previously served as the capital of both the Ethiopian Empire and the subsequent Begemder Province. The city holds the ruins of several royal castles, including those in Fasil Ghebbi (the Royal Enclosure), for which Gondar has been called the "Camelot of Africa".
Not too far away from the main complex, you will encounter Fasilidas’ Bath. This large rectangular pool is overlooked by a charming historical building, thought by some to be a simple vacation home. It is a beautiful and peaceful spot, where snakelike tree roots digest sections of the stone walls.

 

SIMIEN MOUNTAINS

The Siemen Mountain National Park, 120 km from the city of Gondar, is constituted by the spectacular African Massifs (average altitude 3 500 meters). The park is the Ethiopian natural world heritage site and it is the last refuge for the rarest and exclusive Walia Ibex, Gelada Baboon, Ethiopian wolves, and endemic birds. It is one of the natural paradises that Ethiopia has to offer! The tallest peak is Ras Dejen (4 550 meters); other famous peaks include Mounts Biuat (4 437 meters) and Kidis Yared (4 453 meters).

 

AXUM

The original capital of the Kingdom of Aksum, it is one of the oldest constantly inhabited places in Africa. Axum was a naval and trading power that ruled the region from about 400 BC into the 10th century. In 1980, UNESCO added Axum's archaeological sites to its list of World Heritage Sites due to their historic value.

 

HIKING TO THE ANCIENT ROCK CHURCHES OF TIGRAY

With over 130 rock-hewn churches to choose, you are spoiled for choice! To appreciate these churches you have to hike up into the mountains, where you will find hidden 1600 year-old churches that have been preserved uninterruptedly by the monks and priests. Most of the churches were carved deep into the rock to protect them, as well as their histories, from invaders.

 

EXPLORE DANAKIL DEPRESSION AND VOLCANO

Danakil Depression is one of the most inhospitable regions of the world but is nonetheless spectacular and full of stunning colors. You pass through Berhale, a small town, where the camel caravan stop before they proceed to the northern highlands. En route you will see many camel caravans coming to the salt mine and others going out of the Danakil with their salt loaded camels.

 

Mursi tribe

The Mursi are a Nilotic pastoralist ethnic group in Ethiopia. They principally reside in the Debub Omo Zone of the Southern Nations, Nationalities, and People's Region, close to the border with South Sudan. Surrounded by mountains between the Omo River and its tributary the Mago, the home of the Mursi is one of the most isolated regions of the country. The Mursi undergo various rites of passage, educational or disciplinary processes. Lip plates are a well-known aspect of the Mursi and Surma, who are probably the last groups in Africa amongst whom it is still the norm for women to wear large pottery, wooden discs, or ‘plates,’ in their lower lips. Girls' lips are pierced at the age of 15 or 16. 

 

TRAVEL PACKAGES


Basic Travel Package - 3 Days/2 Nights

A little taste of Ethiopia.

  • Day 1: Trek from Lalibela to Ber Metebekiya
  • Day 2: Trek to Abune Yousef Park. After breakfast, trek to the 3rd highest peak in Ethiopia called Rim Gedel (4 300 meters). You will enjoy the spectacular view of Abune Yousef park and different fauna and flora. You will visit a swarm of Ghalada baboons, red fox, and you will see a lot of birds and lots 
  • Day 3: visit Lalibela 


Great Travel Package - 4 Days/3 Nights

A deeper immersion in wonderful Ethiopia.

  • Day 1: Early breakfast to trek from Lalibela to Ber Metebekiya. After lunch, you will learn about the life of the local people including farming practices, cattle rearing and local traditions or walk to the children's school. Spend the rest of the afternoon enjoying the silence of Ber Metebekiya and look at the sunset.
  • Day 2: Trek from Ber Metebekiya to Dewalka Village. Pass through different villages and see the spectacular view of Dewalka. Learn how to milk a cow and to prepare and bake Injera (Ethiopian Traditional meal) and visit the school. You can teach them or you run out with the youngsters helping them to herd the animals.
  • Day 3: Trek to Abune Yousef Park. After breakfast, trek to the 3rd highest peak in Ethiopia called Rim Gedel (4 300 meters). You will enjoy the stunning view of Abune Yousef and the different fauna and flora 
  • Day 4: visit Lalibela 

For more information, contact us via email. Write to tkcaccia@gmail.com

story:
Hello,

My name is Zsofia Balla, I live in the heart of Transylvania.

Family is very important for me, just like nature and our heritage. That is why I wish to fill with life our grandparents house and farm.

I have an old house and farm buildings earned as a heritage from our grandparents which I would like to restore and to transform into a traditional guesthouse to host visitors who want to know local traditions, people, farming. If somebody would like to spend their time in a peaceful clean environment, or to discover the surrounding natural treasures, they could find accomodation at us in nice conditions with high standards.

For the investment we need 50.000 Euro for the following activities:

  • building reconstruction
  • procurement of furniture and equipment
  • guesthouse licensing
  • livestock expansion

We need your help to reach our goal so do not waste the time please make the donation, in return we will place our Contribuitor's names and photos in a visible space, in the wall of our new Guesthouse.

The opportunities for visitors:

  • quite peaceful resting
  • activities on our lavenderfarm (gardening)
  • activities in the orchard
  • taking care of farm animals (sheep, birds, ducks, rabbits)
  • guided tour to the surrounding area or to discover Transylvania
  • preparing and eating bio food

Other Ways You Can Help:

We appreciate that some of you won't be able to help me out with a contribution, that's not a problem, we still really appreciate if you help us in the following ways:

  • Share our campaign on social media (using the buttons on the top, right).
  • Email your friends, family and work colleagues with the link to this page! - https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/farm-guesthouse-in-transylvania-beauty#/
  • 'LIKE' our Facebook page and posts about the campaign! - FACEBOOK
  • Talk to people about it! Word of mouth is the most powerful form of marketing.

Hopefully with your help, we'll be able to make this a reality and you'll always be welcome to  visit the miraculous Transylvania.

If You have any question feel free to contact me: ballazsofia4@gmail.com

You can make the donation directly to paypal.me/ballazsofia too.

Thank You.
story_txt:
Hello,
My name is Zsofia Balla, I live in the heart of Transylvania.

Family is very important for me, just like nature and our heritage. That is why I wish to fill with life our grandparents house and farm.
I have an old house and farm buildings earned as a heritage from our grandparents which I would like to restore and to transform into a traditional guesthouse to host visitors who want to know local traditions, people, farming. If somebody would like to spend their time in a peaceful clean environment, or to discover the surrounding natural treasures, they could find accomodation at us in nice conditions with high standards.

For the investment we need 50.000 Euro for the following activities:

building reconstruction
procurement of furniture and equipment
guesthouse licensing
livestock expansion

We need your help to reach our goal so do not waste the time please make the donation, in return we will place our Contribuitor's names and photos in a visible space, in the wall of our new Guesthouse.
The opportunities for visitors:

quite peaceful resting
activities on our lavenderfarm (gardening)
activities in the orchard
taking care of farm animals (sheep, birds, ducks, rabbits)
guided tour to the surrounding area or to discover Transylvania
preparing and eating bio food


Other Ways You Can Help:
We appreciate that some of you won't be able to help me out with a contribution, that's not a problem, we still really appreciate if you help us in the following ways:

Share our campaign on social media (using the buttons on the top, right).

Email your friends, family and work colleagues with the link to this page! - https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/farm-guesthouse-in-transylvania-beauty#/



'LIKE' our Facebook page and posts about the campaign! - FACEBOOK


Talk to people about it! Word of mouth is the most powerful form of marketing.

Hopefully with your help, we'll be able to make this a reality and you'll always be welcome to  visit the miraculous Transylvania.
If You have any question feel free to contact me: ballazsofia4@gmail.com
You can make the donation directly to paypal.me/ballazsofia too.
Thank You.

story:
THEY VS WE 


They

  • Think social media is too confusing for you to understand
  • Think that big names equal success

We

  • Know that we can teach you WHILE we deliver results
  • Know that results equal success



WHO ARE WE?

The Plutocrats Club is an holistic advertising agency run by millennials. 

Can we agree that advertising is expensive? Trust us, we know. That's why we have been working multiple jobs, so you don't have to.

Did you know?

Creating a comprehensive strategy for social media marketing and outsourcing all work for all channels (with a minimum of two social networks) costs anywhere from $3,000-$20,000 per month, with the industry average settling between $4,000-$7,000?

We deliver results longer, better and for lower prices. 

For some, advertising stops after the last dollar is spent on a billboard ad. For Plutocrats, it never stops. 

Once we place you in one of our curated communities or select you for an experience, exposure and promotion become limitless. Our consulting services are just icing on the cake.

It is no coincidence that our CEO is named David, because we compete against advertising Goliaths everyday. You can trust that we have the stones to prevail. 

This campaign is a culmination of the innovative strides we have taken for over 3 years to create more value than ever before. 




OUR PERK BREAKDOWN

You can tell by the perks that we are offering, that this is no ordinary campaign. We even used our crowdfunding campaign to support our growing network. That's how committed we are. 

Each of the perks we provided are partnerships with real members of our communities, real organizations that we belong to, and real Millennials looking to take their services to the next level. When we say next level connections we mean it.


WHERE WILL THE MONEY GO?

We know what you are thinking. $70,000 who, what, and where is that money going to, and why do they need it? Don't worry, we've got you covered.

47% Plutocrats Experiences


Plutocrats Experiences are meticulously curated getaways designed to connect outstanding individuals with the elite of a high interest location. These three to five day experiences focus on:

  • Community service
  • Recreation
  • Professional development
  • Nightlife
  • Dining

Last year, we rented out 7,000 square ft Mansion in Atlanta, GA for our best experience to date, and we want to take things to the next level this year. 

Funds will be allocated for venues, equipment, talent and services at this years experience on July 4th weekend in Denver, CO and on New Years weekend in Los Angeles, CA.


22% Magazine Re-launch

We are re-designing our magazine and dedicating it soley to the creative content of our communties. Same dedication to "affluent thoughts for everyday life," just a different look. This upgrate requires funds to complete and maintain these changes.

31% Partnership Investments


We know what it's like to work for peanuts or nothing at all just to develop your portfolio, name and/or client list, so anytime we have the opportunity to support those in the same boat, we make it happen. We carved out enough capital in our campaign to support the products, services and people you see in our perks with more than a thank you. With real money.

THE IMPACT

When you hear Millennial, questions of experience are usually followed. We think anyone over the age 36 should be mindful of this when we speaking on social media. We know it, we study it, and we actually grew up with it. That is the difference between us. Our staff has worked with, for and alongside some of the biggest names in industry such as:

  • The World Summit of Innovation & Entreprenuership
  • Omnicom Media Group
  • Subway
  • Cinemark USA
  • Google
  • Mercedes
  • eWomen's Network
  • United States Department of Defense Management Contracts Agency
  • Marriott International
  • Chick-fil-a
  • Morehouse College
  • Dallas Independent School District
  • YMCA
  • Habitat For Humanity
  • St. John Missionary Baptist Church
so we understand corporate structure. Our job is to spread the ideas of those who are redefining it. 
Some say that our generation is lost and too ambitious for their own good, but we say we are found and only need support to show the world what we can really do. Help us use our story to illuminate the stories of the countless others like us!


Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute, doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Spread the word and tell your friends about the new things The Plutocrats Club is doing!
  • Like us, follow us and watch us as we disrupt the advertising world!

Marriott International

Morehouse College

so we understand corporate structure. Our job is to spread the ideas of those who are redefining it.

story:
Hello and welcome. My name is Larz. I’m an actor and musician from Oklahoma City… and I need YOUR help to save and renew The Hippie Store. Uptown OKC’s best kept secret in Thrift, Vintage and Oddities. Located at 2412 N. Shartel Avenue.

Lisa G. has owned and operated the store in various incarnations for over a decade in the southwest corner of The Paseo Arts District. Early in 2016, she decided it was the time to close up shop. Rather than lose an interesting and loved local spot, myself and a group of artists have worked with Lisa to take over management and reimagine the store to its full potential. We’re keeping the LOVE going by transforming it into:

-That Hippie Spot-

By day, we will still provide beautiful fashion, knick knacks and all your Hippie needs (excluding those not yet legal in the State of Oklahoma). By night, we will host gatherings that showcase the outrageous and ranging talents of local artists of every type. We aim to make this a community gathering point; A place where positivity and light will be shown to all. 

This is where your contributions come in. Before our magnificent re-opening, we are in need of resources to revitalize our location. These are the three areas of priority that YOUR contributions will directly influence:

Priority 1) The initial costs of operating the first month. 

Priority 2) Key tools that will be necessary to operate business 

Priority 3) MUCH cleaning, repair and reorganizing will be in order for the space to be presented as we wish. 

And now we come to the number.  

Our goal for contributions by mid-June is $5,000. 

What follows is an approximate breakdown of how those funds would be used in order of priority:

  1. 1st Month’s Rent and Utilities- ≈$1500
  2. REPAIRS- (Lumber/Hardware/Cleaning supplies) ≈2000
  3. POS System (Square Stand w/Ipad)- $600
  4. Accounting Software (Intuit Quickbooks)- $384 (1 Year)
  5. Business Cards (also to be used as tags)- $280 (for 10,000)
  6. Advertising and Marketing- $200-$500

Any amount of contribution is welcome and we intend to give back a portion of these contributions by providing perks to those who donate. Discounts to the store for certain items or your entire purchase or even for LIFE will be given to those who donate, matching the amount contributed. Even if you are unable to contribute to this campaign, we would love if you would please share it far and wide with whomever you believe would support our cause! And if you still feel compelled to help in some way, your hands and time would CERTAINLY be welcome in the process of transforming the building.

If you DO decide to give to this cause, we want to personally extend our love and thanks. Please join us on July 9th for our Grand Re-Opening and that evening for a celebration of music. 

THANK YOU. 

Peace and Love, Brothers and Sisters.

story:
What's TUBO ?

An old fashioned and traditional dessert recipe from Northern Italy. This is TUBO the “Chocolate Salami”. It gets its name from its resemblance to Italian cured sausage without meat inside, only delicious chocolate and Italian Amaretti biscotti.



Why the people love TUBO ?

I only use the best ingredients, and every TUBO is handmade just like the Italian traditional recipe. TUBO needs to to stay in refrigerator and be served cold, so when you cut it into slices, the cold chocolate starts to melt in your mouth. The amaretto cookies crumble give you a crunchy feel with its unique aroma.


My BIO

My name is Elena and I'm 51. I moved to U.S. from Northern Italy on September 2014, with my husband Davide and  two cats. I really love cooking and I always cooked.. Mom gave me the first cooking lesson when I was 11. That day I learnt to  prepare a dessert. Since then, I never stopped. In Italy I cooked for my family and friends, and I have been working in a restaurant for many years. When I arrived in U.S., I started cookingf for my husband and my new American friends. So, in September 2015 I decided to open the Italian Catering Company "Elena's Italian Cuisine" and I started selling my food on Farmers Markets.


The TUBO idea

I decided to produce this "chocolate  salami" as a dessert for my menu. In just one month, the demand for this incredible dessert has tripled !! Customers really enjoiyed TUBO ! And as a matter of fact in October 2015, I've decided to create the brand "TUBO Italian Chocolate Salami".

Step by Step

October 2015 - I've started selling  TUBO  in a few Farmers Markets in South Florida. After 3 months, TUBO started to become popular.  During the Florida's winter season a lot of tourists shop at the local Farmers markets. TUBO Chocolate Salami was selling very well among customers visiting from many different States. Customers bought TUBO to bring back home, asking us if there was a reseller in their city ! From this we came up with the idea.....why not selling it at grocery stores in the U.S. ?

By the end of January 2016, we started to sell TUBO in some of the grocery stores in Florida located between Tampa and Naples and in the Miami area. At the end of March 2016, TUBO started to sell in a grocery store in Dallas, TX.

 

My husband and I have started this project by ourselves. At this moment we can only produce 800 TUBO per month but we are having a lot of requests ! Not only that, every week we add new resellers! With your help this is what we can do:

  • rent a bigger laboratory, to hire more help
  • buy some new work equipment (refrigerators, new molds for chocolate, new equipment)
  • increase our commercial area
  • open our TUBO e-commerce

    Risks & Challenges

    Before we started to produce TUBO, we spent three months in the South Florida Farmers Markets to test it with potential customers. About 800 people of different ages tasted TUBO. 90% of them said "Amazing!" or "Really delicious !". 98% of customers said "Chocolate Salami ? I never heard it before.." After they tested, 70% of customers was ready to buy TUBO immediately.
    That means that TUBO is a product really good and new for U.S. market.
    The only risk could be to get thousands of orders in short time. In this case, a few friends will help us. As soon as possible we'll hire the needed human resource.

story:
I've been a skateboarder for 18 years, and have long dreamed of opening a park.

In May of 2015 I visited Seattle’s “All Together Skatepark” and was reminded of the fantastic opportunities an indoor park provides for the community and I've been working hard to bring a similar facility to Portland.

Artists drawing of Stronger Skatepark:

 

Stronger Skatepark will provide:

  • A consistent place to ride year round, no matter what the weather 
  • A safe space for local youth to ride and socialize
  • A comfortable place for families to try out skateboarding
  • Programs for kids including camps, classes, and after-school care
  • Affordable, healthy food options
  • A skate shop with knowledgeable staff and great products
  • A venue for parties, contests, all ages concerts, and other events

   The park design will include:

  • Street inspired ledges, rails, and hips
  • Transitioned quarter pipes
  • A mini ramp or a bowl
  • Banked ramps of all sizes
  • Moveable small street elements
  • Small to medium sized ramps that are fun for all abilities

 

Early Park Design:

 

The business itself is already partially funded by private loans, this campaign is to fund the ramps themselves. A basic street course and mini ramp will cost $25,000. If we are able to reach our stretch goal of $50,000 it will allow us to build a small bowl instead of a mini ramp! 
 

To learn more about the work we've done so far, visit our website,www.StrongerSkatepark.com. There you can find links to our social media pages, sign up for our newsletter, and read more about the mission of the park. 

 

 

The name Stronger Skatepark was inspired by the Gungor Song “We are Stronger.” The song describes the strength that is inherent when different people band together. My goal with Stronger Skatepark is to create a place where anyone can get involved in skateboarding and the community. Kids, parents, teens, adults, people who have skated for 30 years, and people who are stepping on a board for the very first time will all be welcome. We will also other types of riders including, scooters, bikes, roller blades, and roller skates.
 

 

I've been working on this project for over a year, starting with dreaming up ideas, then researching feasibility. Last year I created a very detailed business plan and shared it with a few trusted individuals who gave helpful feedback. 

Early this year I started searching for funding. Funding is a very real challenge for a business with no history, and I was very fortunate to find an investor who believes in the vision I had. I am also investing thousands of my own dollars, but its still not enough to cover the entire cost. Thats why I've come to the community to seek out funding for the ramps. I've received positive feedback from both within and outside of the skate community, and believe I can minimize the risks associated with starting a new skatepark by planning well, and creating a high quality experience with attention to details.

 

Standard Membership

Members are the backbone of the private skatepark, they are the people who are riding the park regularly. We will sell annual memberships for $100.($80 for our Early Bird Reward in this campaign).


Membership benefits include: 

  • Reduced fees at all Sessions
  • 10% Discount on all food and goods in the shop
  • Discounts on camps, classes, and parties
  • First access to events 

Unlimited Membership

Unlimited membership means you pay once per year or month to ride the park as much as you want! Unlimited memberships  includes all the benefits of the Standard Membership plus unlimited riding. Unlimited Membership will be available both as a yearly membership as a monthly plan if you are riding seasonly. During our campaign Unlimited Memberships will cost $600 for one year. There will never be a lower price for an unlimited yearly membership than this Campaign!

 

 

Rewards are what you get in return for backing our campaign. 

Each reward has a minimum amount you must support us at to receive that reward. You can always give more than the minimum if you desire! 

Our first reward is a sticker pack sent to your home. The other rewards include sessions at the park, and memberships. Back us today, and then come ride when we're open! Come experience the ramps you helped build! 
 


If you aren't a rider there will be an option in your post-campaign survey to gift you session(s) to someone else (we will track it all digitally) or to donate your sessions to our "Pay it Forward" program. 

The "Pay it Forward" program will be a wall in the skate shop with certificates for pre-paid sessions. Its our way of making the park accessible to all income levels. Anyone who can't afford a session may take a certificate and use it to ride! If you want to help kick off our "Pay it Forward" program then you can choose the option to donate sessions or "Pay it Forward" so someone else can have a chance to ride! 

We also have an early bird reward for One Month of our Unlimited Membership for only $60! Only 25 of our very early backers will receive this killer deal! 

We also have a $30 reward that is designed for non-riders, if you donate at this level or higher, your name will be added to our tree of supporters. We will be painting a beautiful mural on the wall of the park of a tree with supporters names on the inside of the tree. In addition to the mural, a percentage of this reward tier will be used to plant real trees here in the Portland area through local not-for-profit, Friends of Trees. As skaters we all need to be Friends of Trees! We wouldn't have our boards or our ramps without them! Thats why we've chosen to give back in this way.

 

 

For $100 you can skate the park before we are open to the general public! Get a full-day of access for yourself and one friend during our invite-only soft opening! This will be limited and the park will be very quiet during this first week! Its a great chance to film! You'll also be gifted some snacks and beverages during your visit to keep you fueled while you shred!

We also have T-shirts and hoodies available as rewards! Both will be black cotton with our logo on the left chest!

T-Shirt Design:

Hoodie Design: 

 

 

Allison Waters - Owner and Founder

Stronger Skatepark is the Vision of Allison Waters, a 30 year old Mother, living in Southeast Portland alongside her husband Ace, their 5 year old son, and their four rescue dogs. She's been skateboarding for 18 years. Allison worked in a large indoor skatepark as a teen. After high school she earned a bachelors degree while also running a local non-for-profit children's program. Since moving to Portland four years ago, she's worked as a nanny, and as a coach with Skate Like a Girl Portland. Allison is passionate about making skateboarding accessible for all people. 

Scott Everly - Lead Ramp Designer and Builder


Scott resides in Portland, Or with his wife and 2 boys. A transplant from the east coast he has been a skateboarder for 32 years and a ramp builder 28. As one of the premiere wood builders in the country his skills have been used by discriminating clientele such as Vans, Dew Tour, Hot Wheels, Adidas, Red Bull, and USSA. In addition to building he has experience in all phases of production from consulting to designing to logistics. Scott prides himself in meeting the needs of all his clients as well as providing riders with progressive terrain no matter what skill level or discipline. 

Graphic Design by Aubree Hollman

Video Editing and Music by Ace Waters

Logo Design by Satchell Drakes 

Artists Rendering of Skatepark by Rachel E.S.

Thanks 

Thanks to everyone has supported me so far in this endeavor! Those who have given me free feedback and advice, those supporting financially, and my friends and family for having patience while I work all the time! -Allison Waters

What will Sessions cost when you open?
Regular sessions will cost $15 for non-members and $10 for Members. Special sessions will cost $10 for non-members and $5 for Members. 

Will you allow scooters?
We will allow scooters! We will have a few sessions that are sport specific, so no scooters at Skateboard or BMX sessions. 

What will the ramp surface be?
We are currently planning on a birch riding surface.

Where will the park be?
We are looking at locations in NE Portland along Columbia Blvd. 

Will you have beginners sessions?
Yes! Every Saturday morning will be for all-ages beginners and Sunday mornings will be for 12 and under only!
story_txt:
I've been a skateboarder for 18 years, and have long dreamed of opening a park.In May of 2015 I visited Seattle’s “All Together Skatepark” and was reminded of the fantastic opportunities an indoor park provides for the community and I've been working hard to bring a similar facility to Portland.Artists drawing of Stronger Skatepark: Stronger Skatepark will provide:
A consistent place to ride year round, no matter what the weather 
A safe space for local youth to ride and socialize
A comfortable place for families to try out skateboarding
Programs for kids including camps, classes, and after-school care
Affordable, healthy food options
A skate shop with knowledgeable staff and great products
A venue for parties, contests, all ages concerts, and other events
   The park design will include:
Street inspired ledges, rails, and hips
Transitioned quarter pipes
A mini ramp or a bowl
Banked ramps of all sizes
Moveable small street elements
Small to medium sized ramps that are fun for all abilities
 Early Park Design: The business itself is already partially funded by private loans, this campaign is to fund the ramps themselves. A basic street course and mini ramp will cost $25,000. If we are able to reach our stretch goal of $50,000 it will allow us to build a small bowl instead of a mini ramp!  To learn more about the work we've done so far, visit our website,www.StrongerSkatepark.com. There you can find links to our social media pages, sign up for our newsletter, and read more about the mission of the park.   The name Stronger Skatepark was inspired by the Gungor Song “We are Stronger.” The song describes the strength that is inherent when different people band together. My goal with Stronger Skatepark is to create a place where anyone can get involved in skateboarding and the community. Kids, parents, teens, adults, people who have skated for 30 years, and people who are stepping on a board for the very first time will all be welcome. We will also other types of riders including, scooters, bikes, roller blades, and roller skates.  I've been working on this project for over a year, starting with dreaming up ideas, then researching feasibility. Last year I created a very detailed business plan and shared it with a few trusted individuals who gave helpful feedback. Early this year I started searching for funding. Funding is a very real challenge for a business with no history, and I was very fortunate to find an investor who believes in the vision I had. I am also investing thousands of my own dollars, but its still not enough to cover the entire cost. Thats why I've come to the community to seek out funding for the ramps. I've received positive feedback from both within and outside of the skate community, and believe I can minimize the risks associated with starting a new skatepark by planning well, and creating a high quality experience with attention to details. Standard MembershipMembers are the backbone of the private skatepark, they are the people who are riding the park regularly. We will sell annual memberships for $100.($80 for our Early Bird Reward in this campaign).Membership benefits include: 
Reduced fees at all Sessions
10% Discount on all food and goods in the shop
Discounts on camps, classes, and parties
First access to events 
Unlimited MembershipUnlimited membership means you pay once per year or month to ride the park as much as you want! Unlimited memberships  includes all the benefits of the Standard Membership plus unlimited riding. Unlimited Membership will be available both as a yearly membership as a monthly plan if you are riding seasonly. During our campaign Unlimited Memberships will cost $600 for one year. There will never be a lower price for an unlimited yearly membership than this Campaign!  Rewards are what you get in return for backing our campaign. Each reward has a minimum amount you must support us at to receive that reward. You can always give more than the minimum if you desire! Our first reward is a sticker pack sent to your home. The other rewards include sessions at the park, and memberships. Back us today, and then come ride when we're open! Come experience the ramps you helped build!  If you aren't a rider there will be an option in your post-campaign survey to gift you session(s) to someone else (we will track it all digitally) or to donate your sessions to our "Pay it Forward" program. The "Pay it Forward" program will be a wall in the skate shop with certificates for pre-paid sessions. Its our way of making the park accessible to all income levels. Anyone who can't afford a session may take a certificate and use it to ride! If you want to help kick off our "Pay it Forward" program then you can choose the option to donate sessions or "Pay it Forward" so someone else can have a chance to ride! We also have an early bird reward for One Month of our Unlimited Membership for only $60! Only 25 of our very early backers will receive this killer deal! We also have a $30 reward that is designed for non-riders, if you donate at this level or higher, your name will be added to our tree of supporters. We will be painting a beautiful mural on the wall of the park of a tree with supporters names on the inside of the tree. In addition to the mural, a percentage of this reward tier will be used to plant real trees here in the Portland area through local not-for-profit, Friends of Trees. As skaters we all need to be Friends of Trees! We wouldn't have our boards or our ramps without them! Thats why we've chosen to give back in this way.  For $100 you can skate the park before we are open to the general public! Get a full-day of access for yourself and one friend during our invite-only soft opening! This will be limited and the park will be very quiet during this first week! Its a great chance to film! You'll also be gifted some snacks and beverages during your visit to keep you fueled while you shred!We also have T-shirts and hoodies available as rewards! Both will be black cotton with our logo on the left chest!T-Shirt Design:Hoodie Design:   Allison Waters - Owner and FounderStronger Skatepark is the Vision of Allison Waters, a 30 year old Mother, living in Southeast Portland alongside her husband Ace, their 5 year old son, and their four rescue dogs. She's been skateboarding for 18 years. Allison worked in a large indoor skatepark as a teen. After high school she earned a bachelors degree while also running a local non-for-profit children's program. Since moving to Portland four years ago, she's worked as a nanny, and as a coach with Skate Like a Girl Portland. Allison is passionate about making skateboarding accessible for all people. Scott Everly - Lead Ramp Designer and BuilderScott resides in Portland, Or with his wife and 2 boys. A transplant from the east coast he has been a skateboarder for 32 years and a ramp builder 28. As one of the premiere wood builders in the country his skills have been used by discriminating clientele such as Vans, Dew Tour, Hot Wheels, Adidas, Red Bull, and USSA. In addition to building he has experience in all phases of production from consulting to designing to logistics. Scott prides himself in meeting the needs of all his clients as well as providing riders with progressive terrain no matter what skill level or discipline. Graphic Design by Aubree HollmanVideo Editing and Music by Ace WatersLogo Design by Satchell Drakes Artists Rendering of Skatepark by Rachel E.S.Thanks Thanks to everyone has supported me so far in this endeavor! Those who have given me free feedback and advice, those supporting financially, and my friends and family for having patience while I work all the time! -Allison WatersWhat will Sessions cost when you open?Regular sessions will cost $15 for non-members and $10 for Members. Special sessions will cost $10 for non-members and $5 for Members. Will you allow scooters?We will allow scooters! We will have a few sessions that are sport specific, so no scooters at Skateboard or BMX sessions. What will the ramp surface be?We are currently planning on a birch riding surface.Where will the park be?We are looking at locations in NE Portland along Columbia Blvd. Will you have beginners sessions?Yes! Every Saturday morning will be for all-ages beginners and Sunday mornings will be for 12 and under only!

story:
What is Serek Basses?
I am on a quest to build basses that feel exactly right in the hands, sound exactly right in the brain, and look good doing it.

I am a working bass player and that is what I will always consider to be my greatest passion and talent. However, after several years of building basses, I am beginning to see that this is my true calling. This is what all of my experiences as a musician and gear junkie have prepared me for!

My experience began at Lakland, a very successful and well-respected bass manufacturer here in Chicago. I learned everything there is to know about the bass at Lakland. I later sharpened my skills working for Third Coast Guitar Repair. It was at the repair shop that I refined my craft and perfected the details that make an instrument truly special.

My Mission:

I started building as a way of furthering my understanding of the instrument. With what I have learned I strive to make improvements in design and functionality. I am making basses that are comfortable and playable by professional standards, as well as cool by the coolest standards.

I believe in using simple, quality building materials and top-notch hardware and electronics. Companies such as Hipshot, TV Jones, DR Strings, Aguilar, Mono Creators, and more have hopped on board with Serek Basses. These represent some of the best in the bass biz. Chicago Music Exchange, a national musical equipment powerhouse, is an official Serek Basses dealer.

I don't believe expensive-looking, exotic woods are the key to a bass that is a true "player." My instruments are built to be displayed on a stage, not on a wall. They are built to give back what the player puts in. Quality materials, solid build quality, and professional grade hardware and electronics are my secret ingredients.

How can you help?

The Serek Basses family is expanding quickly! I need your help to keep it up.

Half of the donations will be used primarily to purchase better tooling and equipment in my new shop. Specifically, an improved dust collection system, edge sander, and CNC upgrades. By improving my shop, I can better serve my clients in both quantity and quality.

I will use the other half of funding to build up a bigger inventory of building materials, quality woods, and top-notch pickups and parts. This will allow me to complete orders in a timely fashion, to offer a wider range of options for custom builds, and to build up inventory for dealers.

Why Serek Basses?

Good question. These days, more than ever, there is an over-saturation in the electric stringed instrument market of mass-produced, indistinguishable guitars and basses. Such instruments are created with one goal in mind: making the numbers.

I offer an instrument that you can form a relationship with. Like a cowboy and his faithful steed, a carpenter with his favorite hammer, a chef with his finest knife; A bass is a tool, but it can also have a life and personality all its own.

Alternative Medicine

Can't donate? That's okay, money really ISN'T everything. If you've made it all the way down here, I really appreciate you taking time out of your day for me!

Please spread the word and if you know someone who may want to help, or plays bass, or just likes cool guitars, let 'em know what's up!

Many thanks,

Jake Serek

story:
The Sun Diner

In the township of Langa lies incredible potential for social change. Ikhaya le Langa, meaning House of the Sun in isiXhosa, is a not-for-profit social enterprise working to turn this hidden cultural gem into a must-see spot for local Capetonians and tourists alike. Aiming to combat the historic community’s deep poverty by highlighting and celebrating the vibrant heritage of Cape Town’s oldest township, Ikhaya le Langa is creating jobs, fostering sustainable business and development, and engaging in socially responsible tourism. Founded in 2013 by Social Enterprise Practitioner Tony Elvin, Ikhaya le Langa is helping to transition the Langa Quarter into a clean, green, and safe neighborhood. 

And into this foray comes the Sun Diner. Four years in the making, the Sun Diner will soon be a hot spot for a quick breakfast meeting or a causal social lunch. With a sustainable business model, the Sun Diner will employ and teach local members of the Langa community, while offering a social hub and incredible dining experience to both tourists and locals. Boosting the community’s economy, the Sun Diner will allow Langa’s historical neighbourhood the opportunity to thrive. Conveniently located seconds off Cape Town’s main highway, the Sun Diner is designed to attract the majority of white Capetonians who have never been into a predominantly black township such as Langa. The Sun Diner is the place to be, closing the gap between racial communities and stereotypes with great food and better people.

The Sun Diner will not only serve as a community brunch hot spot; it is a three-branch sustainable social enterprise created for the collective people, planet, and profit.

People:

  • Ambassador Social Inclusion Program: supporting the long term unemployed and giving them skills and schedules to encourage work 
  • Hospitality Training: Training baristas, waiters, and chefs to be fit for the workforce
  • Community development: breaking down the racial by crafting a space for white Capetonians to engage in a black area

Planet:

  • Foodbank SA partnership: transforming surplus supermarket foods into free, nutritious meals for resident volunteers in need of food
  • Reducing food waste: allocating safe surplus food to ambassadors within the Langa Quarter through Foodbank SA partnership
  • Minimizing footprint: increasing community volunteering leading to a cleaner, greener environment

Profit:

  • Sustainable business model: as a social enterprise and a non-for-profit, the Sun Diner brings business into the community, for the community
  • Platform for partners: the Sun Diner's partnership with the major grocery chain, Pic N Pay, will allow for us to feed community, overseas local and resident volunteers for free. 

The Big Picture

Milestone 1: $60,000

To make this dream a reality we need your help! Through our networks of former volunteers, visitors to the center, and friends of Ikhaya le Langa, we plan to spread this campaign as far as possible to show the people of Langa that together we can overcome the structural barriers of apartheid that have remained entrenched for over two decades. Each contribution brings us one step closer to sharing the dream of the free South Africa with the people of Langa.

Milestone 2: $100,000

As a social enterprise and not-for-profit, Ikhaya le Langa as an organization needs a helping hand with  future infrastructure projects. If we can surpass our original goal and make it to $100,000, Tony and the rest of the team can work to refurbish the historic site through an architectural competition, allowing us to embrace the heritage of this site while simultaneously bringing in new, fresh architecture. This will help us to further engage our work with the greater Langa community and to take our mission even farther.

story:
OUR STORY...

DONATE TODAY TO HELP US MAKE THIS PROJECT A REALITY!!

As  licensed Occupational Therapy(OT) service providers for children with disabilities the owners  of Chasing Jax have witnessed, first hand, the hardships many parents encounter. Parents desperately search for OT providers and are being placed on wait lists for intervention that  would promote their child´s overall  growth, physical  development, and ultimate life success.  Due to the extreme shortage of OT practitioners, children with disabilities are being deprived of crucial intervention which contributes to successful functioning and engagement in their environments.    Your contribution will allow children with disabilities  access to a sensory gym with life changing Occupational Therapy intervention. 

As health professionals the owners of Chasing Jax also recognize the significance of play for all  children in preventing the risk of obesity, strengthening the immune system,  increasing balance and coordination.  Research shows that children who incorporate  play into their routines become more social, alert, energetic, and motivated which leads to healthier lifestyles and trends. 

      
 

 

DONATE TODAY TO HELP US MAKE THIS PROJECT A REALITY!!

By establishing this dual service center,the owners are actively seeking a larger role in their community by increasing the accessibility of OT  providers, facilitating healthy play habits and empowering children to help them overcome disabilities.  

 

   

  DONATE TODAY TO HELP US MAKE  OUR PROJECT A REALITY !!

WHERE YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS WILL GO ....

THE IMPACT

OT for Children with Disabilities in a Sensory Gym. 

OTs play a significant role in intervention for children with disabilities.  Many children with special needs experience sensory processing disorder (SPD).

What is SPD?  

  •  It can be described as a  ẗraffic jam¨ that prevents part of the brain from adequately receiving and interpreting sensory information. It causes children to respond inappropriately to sensory input  
  • A child with SPD may be  over responsive- the child may attack a friend or relative, cry, in response to a  sensory experience such as light touch, movement(vestibular input) hearing certain sounds or any other sensory input.
  • A child may  be under-responsive  where sensory information does not arouse their nervous systems- and they crave intense stimulation. They may spin excessively, crash into walls, climb onto furniture ,jump on couches, etc.

Untreated SPD may result in clumsiness, anxiety, depression, social behavioral issues, school failure, and other impacts.  

OT  Intervention for SPD

OTs are skilled and licensed professionals who can ​customize play in a separate space(sensory gym) to “rewire” the brain so that children with special needs can appropriately integrate and respond to sensory input.  For instance, a child who is over-responsive  to movement (vestibular input) would gradually be exposed to swinging on a swing , rolling on a scooter etc.  in order to retrain the brain and produce an appropriate response .

Overtime an appropriate response to sensory information will be generalized to participation in  normal activities within other environments( i.e. home, school, and community).  

Open Play at Chasing Jax

Play allows for sensory experiences that are vital to all children´s growth and development. Open play equipment at Chasing Jax will stimulate the senses of children,  increase muscle strength, joint flexibility, endurance,  gross/fine motor skills and much more.  

 

Who Are We? 

Krystelle Hosein and Tamara Smith are registered and licensed Occupational Therapists (OT) of New York State. Krystelle Hosein has always had a desire to learn, a willingness to help others, and a keen interest in health care-physical rehabilitation and pediatrics. Along the way, she has developed a sense of entrepreneurship as she has always been exposed to family businesses.

 

Tamara Smith  is a fun and energetic mom who is passionate about working with children.  As a parent of a child who receives OT she is a strong advocate for acquiring OT services for children who are mandated.  Both Krystelle and Tamara  have extensive experience in providing treatment for children with varying disabilities including autism, down syndrome, Cerebral Palsy, intellectual disabilities, ADHD and more.

If you're not in a position to contribute monetarily, that's totally okay! We only ask, then, if you could do us the favor of sharing this link.
