story:
Why open a floor-malting facility?

Malted barley is the primary ingredient in craft beer. Before any barley, wheat, or other grain makes its way into a brewery, it is steeped in water, germinated, and kilned- a process known as malting. Malt is the backbone and soul of beer and much of a beer's quality, flavor and aroma is created during the malting process.  Only a handful of malting companies around the world still practice the art of floor-malting, wherein the grain is allowed to germinate in a thin layer and is gently turned, rather than piled deep in a mechanical vessel. Floor-malted grain is revered by brewers and distillers for its flavor and character. Admiral Maltings will combine these traditional methods with modern quality control technology to produce consistently distinctive malt.

Much of the malt used in the US is imported and craft breweries often look to Germany and England for premium quality malt. Admiral Maltings is part of a growing nationwide movement to diversify and improve the domestic malt supply for craft breweries and distilleries.  Before Prohibition, malt houses were common all over the US, sourcing locally grown barley, and selling to local and regional breweries. The current malt supply, however, primarily reflects the needs of the largest, non-craft breweries.  It is now necessary, as the Brewers Association states, “that the barley malt supply chain should . . . evolve rapidly to meet the very different needs of all-malt [craft] beer brewers.” 

Outside of California, there are already a growing number of craft malting businesses. The Craft Maltsters Guild lists 32 companies currently in production in North America, and at least another 30 in planning. As the first major craft malting facility in California, Admiral Maltings will offer craft brewers and distillers premium malt with the following advantages:

Improved flavor: Our malt is made using traditional floor-malting methods and delivered fresh from the kiln, providing optimum flavor. Our small- scale allows us to offer custom-kilned malts made with new, unique, and experimental grain varieties.

Locally sourced: Brewers strengthen their ties to the community and reduce their carbon footprint by supporting local farmers.

Sustainably grown: All of Admiral’s grains are grown using organic or no-till practices which promote soil health. Barley and other grains require little to no irrigation. By using locally grown grains, brewers provide a new market for crops that are well suited to California’s arid climate.

 

Sounds cool, but I'm not a brewer...

In addition to producing malt, we will also open an onsite restaurant and pub to serve beer and spirits that are made with Admiral malt. So while most of you reading this may not want to geek out with us over the protein content and kilning profile of our newest pilsner malt, you will be able to enjoy a pint of your favorite local beer and know that you had a part in changing the way it was made.

 

Who is behind Admiral Maltings?

Ron Silberstein, owner and founding brewmaster of ThirstyBear Organic Brewery. ThirstyBear opened in 1996, is San Francisco’s longest operating brewery-restaurant and its only certified organic brewery. He is a founding board member of the SF Brewers Guild, a graduate of the inaugural class of the American Brewers Guild and a graduate of the Canadian Malting Barley Technical Centre’s (CMBTC) Malt Academy – the only such course in North America.

Dave McLean founder, brewmaster of Magnolia Brewing Company. He is a founding board member of the SF Brewers Guild, a member of the original team that started SF Beer Week, and has helped organize programing at Slow Food Nation, Eat Real Festival and Outside Lands Music Festival. He has a diploma from the UC Davis Master Brewers Program and is a diploma member of the London based Institute for Brewing and Distilling.

Curtis Davenport has a background in organic farming and for the past several years has helped develop supplies of unique, high quality California grown grains for brewers and artisan bakers. Curtis has grown malting barley and wheat and in 2013 designed and operated a trial malting system to produce malt for breweries in Southern California. Curtis has completed malting courses at the Canadian Malt Barley Technical Center and North Dakota State University. As the Head Maltster of Admiral Maltings, Curtis will oversee the day-to- day malting operations. 

 

Our progress so far and how you can help:

For the past few years, our team has laid the groundwork to open a successful malting business. We have contracted with a handful of California farmers who have already produced two harvests of top quality barley. We have worked closely with the UC Davis barley breeding program to develop new varieties of malting barley with superior malting quality and desirable agronomic traits. Our malting equipment and facility have been completely designed and engineered, and construction is underway. We have raised sufficient capital to build the malting facility and are now raising the final funds required to build out our onsite pub.

With your help, the contributions of this campaign will go towards transforming a 1940’s warehouse into a one-of-a-kind restaurant and pub. Specifically, the money will be used to install traditional beer engines for serving cask ales and to employ local craftsmen to finish the space with custom millwork.

We plan to complete construction on the malting facility by the end of April. The pub will open during the summer of 2017 after many breweries have made beer with Admiral malt.

We hope you will join us in our effort to bring malting back to California, and are very grateful for your generous support! Cheers!
story_txt: Why open a floor-malting facility?Malted barley is the primary ingredient in craft beer. Before any barley, wheat, or other grain makes its way into a brewery, it is steeped in water, germinated, and kilned- a process known as malting. Malt is the backbone and soul of beer and much of a beer's quality, flavor and aroma is created during the malting process.  Only a handful of malting companies around the world still practice the art of floor-malting, wherein the grain is allowed to germinate in a thin layer and is gently turned, rather than piled deep in a mechanical vessel. Floor-malted grain is revered by brewers and distillers for its flavor and character. Admiral Maltings will combine these traditional methods with modern quality control technology to produce consistently distinctive malt.Much of the malt used in the US is imported and craft breweries often look to Germany and England for premium quality malt. Admiral Maltings is part of a growing nationwide movement to diversify and improve the domestic malt supply for craft breweries and distilleries.  Before Prohibition, malt houses were common all over the US, sourcing locally grown barley, and selling to local and regional breweries. The current malt supply, however, primarily reflects the needs of the largest, non-craft breweries.  It is now necessary, as the Brewers Association states, “that the barley malt supply chain should . . . evolve rapidly to meet the very different needs of all-malt [craft] beer brewers.” Outside of California, there are already a growing number of craft malting businesses. The Craft Maltsters Guild lists 32 companies currently in production in North America, and at least another 30 in planning. As the first major craft malting facility in California, Admiral Maltings will offer craft brewers and distillers premium malt with the following advantages:Improved flavor: Our malt is made using traditional floor-malting methods and delivered fresh from the kiln, providing optimum flavor. Our small- scale allows us to offer custom-kilned malts made with new, unique, and experimental grain varieties.Locally sourced: Brewers strengthen their ties to the community and reduce their carbon footprint by supporting local farmers.Sustainably grown: All of Admiral’s grains are grown using organic or no-till practices which promote soil health. Barley and other grains require little to no irrigation. By using locally grown grains, brewers provide a new market for crops that are well suited to California’s arid climate. Sounds cool, but I'm not a brewer...In addition to producing malt, we will also open an onsite restaurant and pub to serve beer and spirits that are made with Admiral malt. So while most of you reading this may not want to geek out with us over the protein content and kilning profile of our newest pilsner malt, you will be able to enjoy a pint of your favorite local beer and know that you had a part in changing the way it was made. Who is behind Admiral Maltings?Ron Silberstein, owner and founding brewmaster of ThirstyBear Organic Brewery. ThirstyBear opened in 1996, is San Francisco’s longest operating brewery-restaurant and its only certified organic brewery. He is a founding board member of the SF Brewers Guild, a graduate of the inaugural class of the American Brewers Guild and a graduate of the Canadian Malting Barley Technical Centre’s (CMBTC) Malt Academy – the only such course in North America.Dave McLean founder, brewmaster of Magnolia Brewing Company. He is a founding board member of the SF Brewers Guild, a member of the original team that started SF Beer Week, and has helped organize programing at Slow Food Nation, Eat Real Festival and Outside Lands Music Festival. He has a diploma from the UC Davis Master Brewers Program and is a diploma member of the London based Institute for Brewing and Distilling.Curtis Davenport has a background in organic farming and for the past several years has helped develop supplies of unique, high quality California grown grains for brewers and artisan bakers. Curtis has grown malting barley and wheat and in 2013 designed and operated a trial malting system to produce malt for breweries in Southern California. Curtis has completed malting courses at the Canadian Malt Barley Technical Center and North Dakota State University. As the Head Maltster of Admiral Maltings, Curtis will oversee the day-to- day malting operations.  Our progress so far and how you can help:For the past few years, our team has laid the groundwork to open a successful malting business. We have contracted with a handful of California farmers who have already produced two harvests of top quality barley. We have worked closely with the UC Davis barley breeding program to develop new varieties of malting barley with superior malting quality and desirable agronomic traits. Our malting equipment and facility have been completely designed and engineered, and construction is underway. We have raised sufficient capital to build the malting facility and are now raising the final funds required to build out our onsite pub.With your help, the contributions of this campaign will go towards transforming a 1940’s warehouse into a one-of-a-kind restaurant and pub. Specifically, the money will be used to install traditional beer engines for serving cask ales and to employ local craftsmen to finish the space with custom millwork.We plan to complete construction on the malting facility by the end of April. The pub will open during the summer of 2017 after many breweries have made beer with Admiral malt.We hope you will join us in our effort to bring malting back to California, and are very grateful for your generous support! Cheers!

story:
What is the project? GATHER & MILL... imagine a space where community, creative workshops, retreats, art & design and well-curated "goods" come together. GATHER & MILL was born out of two friend's desires to establish a beautiful space where community could gather and inspire together. We will have a retail space highlighting local artists, vintage pieces and socially, ethically and sustainably sourced products. We will have a unique space for creative workshops of all kinds led by talented and charismatic teachers, artists and professionals. We will also provide our space for special events and celebrations, fundraising dinners, pop-up shops, photoshoots, a space for brides to get ready for their wedding day and... anything else that might spark a sense of fun, charity or kinship! Please take a peek at our (work in-progress) website (www.gatherandmill.com) to get a feel for what we are creating.

Who are we? Erica of Tin Roof Farmhouse and Katie of Katie White Photography aim to provide a comfortable and accepting place for locals and tourists to meet, inspire and shop. We have been working in the creative field and wedding industry for over 20 years collectively, and are excited to take off on a new business adventure together, beginning with a soft launch in April 2017 & grand opening in May of 2017. Find our bio’s on our (work-in-progress) website (https://www.gatherandmill.com/about/).

Where is it? Our brick & mortar shop and workshop space is located in the Sierra Nevada foothills between the Bay Area & Tahoe in the historic town of Grass Valley (where artistically and musically-inclined spirits seem to flock, due to the stunning surroundings and peaceful environment). We’re located a few blocks out of town at 603 Mill St, Grass Valley, CA 95945 at the intersection of hwy 20 & 49. We also have an online space (www.gatherandmill.com) to sign up for classes, purchase unique goods and to be inspired.

Why this project? Over the years, we have both dreamed of having a retail space that could be shared with a community of like-minded people. The perfect unique space became available and we jumped at the opportunity. We’ve worked together on numerous styled wedding shoots and mini sessions in the past and have found that we work together seamlessly. We have been blown away by the similarity of our visions with the shop and workshop classes. And we’re truly thrilled to bring this project to the community.

What do we need? Well, we need funding to get our vision off the ground! We will use this funding for our start up costs and the first months operating expenses. The majority of the funds will be put towards the rent, deposit and improvements to the building such as lighting, paint and a flower box redo. We will also need to purchase pieces for the retail shop and workshop space such as shelving, signage, collateral and workshop tables. Then there’s all the behind the scenes pieces like websites, fonts, printers, software & licenses. And if there are any funds leftover, we will invest this in inventory for the retail shop or for surprise expenses, because we expect there will be some even though we have diligently gone through our start up costs & operating expenses.

There will be 3 main channels for our business structure: a retail shop, workshops and a venue space. We’ll start with monthly “pop-up” shops (stay tuned on Facebook & Instagram) while we curate the product mix for our shop. Then after 3-6 months we’ll grow into a retail shop that is open daily. We plan to highlight local creatives as instructors for the workshops as well as their products in the shop when applicable. We are currently taking applications for workshop instructors, pop-up shop bookings and consignment vendors. Our consignment vendors will be hand selected by us to reflect our aesthetic and vision. If you're interested in selling consignment in our shop, please fill out the form on our contact page. The venue space will be developed more after we launch the business. We’d also love to hear what events and workshops you would like to see here and how we can help make your affair a successful experience. Send us an email at hello@gatherandmill.com - we can’t wait to hear from you!

Cheers! Katie & Erica

story:
SoWhat

Hi there, we're SoWhat, and no, we aren't selling hats for female pigs....


We're a team of 11 graduates and as part of our professional development we've been tasked with setting up and running our own business for 12 months. We're bringing a world of exotic herbs and adventurous cooking into your home and revolutionising the meals you prepare in the kitchen!


Our Story


So how did we come up with the idea of SoWhat Seeds? Well, it all stemmed from the teams passions for travelling and trying new things. Our managing director, Vicky McIvor, was busy telling the team about her latest travelling adventures when she stopped mid-sentence and uttered the words "exotic herbs" and from that point on, our lives were changed.

We threw ourselves into seed trials and were chuffed when we saw the little green shoots peeping over the top of the plant pot. After that we went and pitched our idea to 4 terrifying business men and women and managed to secure a £2000 investment!

SoWhat did we do with the money? We created our first three seed boxes of course! From our current range you can pick yourselves up the electrifying Buzz Buttons, the scrumptious Shiso or the chefs favourite, Culantro! All three of our seed boxes contain the following:

  • A sachet of exotic seeds

  • 7 coir discs

  • 10g of Neem mixed in with a bag of Perlite

  • A postcard giving you information about your herb and planting instructions

  • And a nice fabric pot for you to put it all in

We've been in business just over 3 months and have already sold over 100 boxes! Not to mention gathered a whopper of a following on our social media. If you're on Facebook or twitter check us out using the links below, don't forget to check out our website too!

One of the best bits about our product is that all of the profit (that's right 100%) goes to our partner charity Rainforest Trust! 

SoWhat do we need your money for?

Well it turns out that setting up a business in exotic herbs is realllllly expensive, especially when you're trying to bring some pretty cool and exotic herbs into the U.K. Although we've already got three products on the shelf we're busy putting the finishing touches to a further two exciting herb boxes.

We're trying to raise £500 and here's what we're planning on spending it on:

  • £150 on R&D to make our products the best they can be for our customers

  • £100 on developing new recipe's (check out our recipe maker, Gumblossom, she's amazing www.sowhatseeds.com/gumblossom).

  • £150 on marketing, we're going to hire the best graphic designer we can find to help develop our website and marketing campaigns (any takers?)

  • £100 to help us establish a presence at stalls over the U.K this year (we'll hopefully meet some of you face to face!)

SoWhat do you get?

We don't expect people to help out for nothing, so we've got some fantastic perks lined up in return for helping us out.

These Include:

How will your contribution help us?

Firstly, your investment will mean the world to us, it will revolutionise our business, but hopefully all our customers lives too.

We've all invested an extraordinary amount of time into SoWhat Seeds, your investment will let us know we're onto a good thing and give us the support we need to carry us into the next stage of our company. Your contributions will allow us to perfect our product and develop a unique growing and cooking experience in the U.K.

Wait a minute.... You mentioned a Charity?

Yep, that's right. When we close up shop in October 2016 all of our proceeds will go to Rainforest Trust, a truly amazing charity with a variety of valuable conservation projects worldwide.

They are a world leader in the protection of ecosystems and have protected acres of tropical rainforest from destruction. We highly recommend you check out their website here: https://www.rainforesttrust.org/

Other Ways You Can Help

We know what it's like, sometimes you're just not able to contribute... and that's fine!

But if you really really believe in our idea and still want to help us, well, I suppose there are few little things you could do for us:

  • SHARE OUR PAGE. And once you've finished that, SHARE THE PAGE again! We really want to reach as many people as possible with our campaign so if you're not able to help fund us then please share our page... you might reach out to someone who can.

  • We've got a helllll of a lot going on with our social media and we're always keeping ourselves busy and updating our various outlets. So please, by all means give us a follow/like/telegram/use smoke signals and engage with us :).

  • As has been mentioned, all of the profits that SoWhat Seeds earns will be going straight to Rainforest Trust who we will be working in close collaboration with. We would be so so so grateful if you would check out them out, check out the work that they do and get involved (big or small, every little counts). You might even meet us at some point down the line during volunteering duties... we'll be sure to have a chat over a cuppa (or something stronger).

story:
Coterie offers an environment like no other, with a dynamic, supportive membership of like-minded freelancers, artists and entrepreneurs. a space that boasts a design-savvy, curated interior, a secure digital environment with a unique user fingerprint for each member, + countless professional services,  we provide each member with connections to business experts, access to educational workshops, and exposure within their chosen market. Discover how working as part of the community can help everyone thrive. 

Small businesses + entrepreneurs in the U.S. currently provide 50% of existing jobs, and 60% to 80% of new jobs. Remarkably, this is accomplished against almost insurmountable odds. Noisy coffee shops, sketchy internet access, isolation from like-minded individuals, expensive equipment, and ridiculously priced studio rentals are just some of the frustrations and hurdles to overcome when trying to build a successful business. 

Lake Norman is fast becoming a hotbed of innovation, entrepreneurship and meaningful communion. Whether you are a small business owner, freelancer, designer, writer, artist, or any other kind of entrepreneur, we are certain that you and your business will thrive in the nurturing, inspiring, collaborative world of Coterie Lake Norman. Located just off the 77 freeway, and tucked into the heart of the corridor between Huntersville + Mooresville, we are thrilled to bring together the talented and dynamic women of Lake Norman!

Working from home is isolating, leading to slower business growth and a slew of distractions. Coterie provides a supportive community for entrepreneurs and freelancers who want a space to work, connect with peers and collaborate. Members will enjoy our fun, relaxed atmosphere with perks that include beautiful spaces, drop in work stations, a lounge area for collaboration, state of the art conference suite and a fully stocked kitchen to gather + snack on healthy treats, fair trade coffee and oodles more. 

The Power of Community:

What happens in Lake Norman is important. We have the privilege of living in one of the most resource rich areas of our beautiful state. Developing relationships with our local and regional assets, in an effort to benefit each member, is one of our biggest focuses here at Coterie. Growing our local economy through small business is not only good for our members, it’s good for the community. To that end, we will host a monthly event that highlights local assets, with opportunities for each member to plug in and move their business forward. 

Designed to create a marriage of peaceful + creative opportunity for community, our co-working space will offer a mix of independent space for closing deals, community space that encourage classroom style presentations, a kitchen that serves as the heart of our Coterie home, and an outdoor space that allows for fresh air + a little Vitamin D therapy.

Why Female Focused?

Women empowering women is more than just a theory. In a Kaufman Foundation study (“Are Successful Women Entrepreneurs Different from Men?” May 2010), women rated their professional and business networks as important contributors to success more highly than men did. It was also found that women especially benefit from other types of social support and encouragement beyond business.

Several of the identified gender differences in the study indicate that support and encouragement from key people can especially benefit women in their efforts to found successful companies. Many women feel more comfortable in an all-woman environment and typically get to a point of trust much quicker, especially in a safe, supportive environment like Coterie. 

Women helping women should not be a revolutionary event. We will demonstrate how working together, supporting each other and actively advancing the vision of the women of this community will contribute to the culture and economy of Charlotte.

For more on the benefits of co-working, please enjoy this video: https://youtu.be/le0dfcG_jVw

Our Standard of Giving®:

What happens to one of us affects all of us. When you become a member of Coterie, we invest a portion of the proceeds in initiatives that combat the global water crisis, help in the fight against hunger, aide our local women + children and help end human trafficking. For years, Women Who RISE + Joanna Bailey Designs {the parent company of this endeavor} have worked tirelessly to support organizations that make a difference in the lives of others. We believe that it is our responsibility to play a role in advancing the lives of others and to amplify the great work of as many innovators and disruptors as we can. After all, that’s how we make things happen. Bold moves + brave choices. 10% of our net profits go to either Water.org, Free The Girls, Feeding America or a local organization working to keep Charlotte women + children safe. {we will cycle quarterly}

In addition, we give 10% of our memberships to local women who are ready to launch their vision, but unable to purchase a membership. If you would like to nominate a new member based on need, please email us at give@coterielkn.com.

Perks! Here's the Skinny...

$75   Coterie Fan

  • Thank You letter from Katie + Joanna
  • Coterie Bumper Magnet
  • 1 day pass

$175  Coterie Friend

  • all of the above plus:
  • 2 day passes
  • 45 Min Virtual Coterie Coaching of your choice

$375   Coterie Insider

  • all of the above plus:
  • 3 day passes
  • 45 minute Business Consult

$575   Coterie Community

  • all of the above plus:
  • 1 month PT Membership
  • 1 month of Preferred Member Opportunities
  • 4 day passes
  • 30 minute mini photo session for lifestyle or professional headshots
  • 1 Grand Opening Invitation

$775   Coterie Founder

  • all of the above plus:
  • 1 month FT Membership {instead of PT}
  • 45 minute Business Coaching
  • Custom Logo Design {see details}
  • 5 day passes
  • 2 Grand Opening Invitations
  • A Private Party at Coterie for Member’s Brand! {see details}

Details: Custom logo design will offer 3 options, with 2 revisions of your chosen option. Private Party will be custom designed based on 30 guests.

Where's the Money Going?

@$4,000     Indiegogo Fees: Their 5% + cc processing fees

$25,500      First 90 days of overhead: Utilities + Tech + Security + the best Concierges around... this gets us off the ground as we establish our Member base.

$10,000      Upfitting the space {walls, bathroom, electrical} While we'd like to think we're crafty enough to do it all, we need a few good men + women to make this space all it's designed to be.

$5,000        Furnishings {desks, chairs, tables, couches, etc.} We are currently working with a handful of brands to supply the primary pieces of furniture, but will have supplemental needs to address.

$3,000        Secure technology, internal security measures, etc. We want our Members to feel confident + safe at Coterie. The fastest + most secure internet connection around, an internal security system to compliment our Honor Code, and the peace of mind of knowing that our various tech services are offered in a secure manner.

$2,500        Grand Opening Party! You have to know that we are going to open doors to a marching band + lots of bubbly. Because that's how we do it. We cannot wait to celebrate with our new Members, Community Leaders + local media just dying to get to know the women of Coterie!  

Stretch Goals:

·  If we raise $55,000 the additional $5,000 (less fees) will buy Fixtures and Supplies for the Coterie Patio Build-out.

·  If we raise $60,000 the additional $5,000 (less fees) will buy the tech for our state of the art conference suite. Ladies control these remotes.

·  If we raise $65,000, the additional $5,000 (less fees) will pay for supplies for our Coterie Leadership Library.

·  If we raise $65,000, the additional $5,000 (less fees) will allow us to tuck away a nest egg for future needs + giving opportunities.

·  If we raise $70,000, the additional $5,000 (less fees) will put the first 5k in the kitty for our next location. Oh yes... there are 3 more locations slated for 2016 alone. Stay tuned!

·  Any additional funds will go towards funding the development of future Coterie locations.
story_txt:
Coterie offers an environment like no other, with a dynamic, supportive membership of like-minded freelancers, artists and entrepreneurs. a space that boasts a design-savvy, curated interior, a secure digital environment with a unique user fingerprint for each member, + countless professional services,  we provide each member with connections to business experts, access to educational workshops, and exposure within their chosen market. Discover how working as part of the community can help everyone thrive. 
Small businesses + entrepreneurs in the U.S. currently provide 50% of existing jobs, and 60% to 80% of new jobs. Remarkably, this is accomplished against almost insurmountable odds. Noisy coffee shops, sketchy internet access, isolation from like-minded individuals, expensive equipment, and ridiculously priced studio rentals are just some of the frustrations and hurdles to overcome when trying to build a successful business. Lake Norman is fast becoming a hotbed of innovation, entrepreneurship and meaningful communion. Whether you are a small business owner, freelancer, designer, writer, artist, or any other kind of entrepreneur, we are certain that you and your business will thrive in the nurturing, inspiring, collaborative world of Coterie Lake Norman. Located just off the 77 freeway, and tucked into the heart of the corridor between Huntersville + Mooresville, we are thrilled to bring together the talented and dynamic women of Lake Norman!Working from home is isolating, leading to slower business growth and a slew of distractions. Coterie provides a supportive community for entrepreneurs and freelancers who want a space to work, connect with peers and collaborate. Members will enjoy our fun, relaxed atmosphere with perks that include beautiful spaces, drop in work stations, a lounge area for collaboration, state of the art conference suite and a fully stocked kitchen to gather + snack on healthy treats, fair trade coffee and oodles more. The Power of Community:What happens in Lake Norman is important. We have the privilege of living in one of the most resource rich areas of our beautiful state. Developing relationships with our local and regional assets, in an effort to benefit each member, is one of our biggest focuses here at Coterie. Growing our local economy through small business is not only good for our members, it’s good for the community. To that end, we will host a monthly event that highlights local assets, with opportunities for each member to plug in and move their business forward. Designed to create a marriage of peaceful + creative opportunity for community, our co-working space will offer a mix of independent space for closing deals, community space that encourage classroom style presentations, a kitchen that serves as the heart of our Coterie home, and an outdoor space that allows for fresh air + a little Vitamin D therapy.Why Female Focused?Women empowering women is more than just a theory. In a Kaufman Foundation study (“Are Successful Women Entrepreneurs Different from Men?” May 2010), women rated their professional and business networks as important contributors to success more highly than men did. It was also found that women especially benefit from other types of social support and encouragement beyond business.Several of the identified gender differences in the study indicate that support and encouragement from key people can especially benefit women in their efforts to found successful companies. Many women feel more comfortable in an all-woman environment and typically get to a point of trust much quicker, especially in a safe, supportive environment like Coterie. Women helping women should not be a revolutionary event. We will demonstrate how working together, supporting each other and actively advancing the vision of the women of this community will contribute to the culture and economy of Charlotte.For more on the benefits of co-working, please enjoy this video: https://youtu.be/le0dfcG_jVwOur Standard of Giving®:What happens to one of us affects all of us. When you become a member of Coterie, we invest a portion of the proceeds in initiatives that combat the global water crisis, help in the fight against hunger, aide our local women + children and help end human trafficking. For years, Women Who RISE + Joanna Bailey Designs {the parent company of this endeavor} have worked tirelessly to support organizations that make a difference in the lives of others. We believe that it is our responsibility to play a role in advancing the lives of others and to amplify the great work of as many innovators and disruptors as we can. After all, that’s how we make things happen. Bold moves + brave choices. 10% of our net profits go to either Water.org, Free The Girls, Feeding America or a local organization working to keep Charlotte women + children safe. {we will cycle quarterly}In addition, we give 10% of our memberships to local women who are ready to launch their vision, but unable to purchase a membership. If you would like to nominate a new member based on need, please email us at give@coterielkn.com.Perks! Here's the Skinny...$75   Coterie Fan
Thank You letter from Katie + Joanna
Coterie Bumper Magnet
1 day pass
$175  Coterie Friend
all of the above plus:
2 day passes
45 Min Virtual Coterie Coaching of your choice
$375   Coterie Insider
all of the above plus:
3 day passes
45 minute Business Consult
$575   Coterie Community
all of the above plus:
1 month PT Membership
1 month of Preferred Member Opportunities
4 day passes
30 minute mini photo session for lifestyle or professional headshots
1 Grand Opening Invitation
$775   Coterie Founder
all of the above plus:
1 month FT Membership {instead of PT}
45 minute Business Coaching
Custom Logo Design {see details}
5 day passes
2 Grand Opening Invitations
A Private Party at Coterie for Member’s Brand! {see details}
Details: Custom logo design will offer 3 options, with 2 revisions of your chosen option. Private Party will be custom designed based on 30 guests.Where's the Money Going?@$4,000     Indiegogo Fees: Their 5% + cc processing fees$25,500      First 90 days of overhead: Utilities + Tech + Security + the best Concierges around... this gets us off the ground as we establish our Member base.$10,000      Upfitting the space {walls, bathroom, electrical} While we'd like to think we're crafty enough to do it all, we need a few good men + women to make this space all it's designed to be.$5,000        Furnishings {desks, chairs, tables, couches, etc.} We are currently working with a handful of brands to supply the primary pieces of furniture, but will have supplemental needs to address.$3,000        Secure technology, internal security measures, etc. We want our Members to feel confident + safe at Coterie. The fastest + most secure internet connection around, an internal security system to compliment our Honor Code, and the peace of mind of knowing that our various tech services are offered in a secure manner.$2,500        Grand Opening Party! You have to know that we are going to open doors to a marching band + lots of bubbly. Because that's how we do it. We cannot wait to celebrate with our new Members, Community Leaders + local media just dying to get to know the women of Coterie!

for supplies for our Coterie Leadership Library.

allow us to tuck away a nest egg for future needs + giving opportunities.

story:
Our friend fled from Africa and found his refuge in Slovenia. In his country he was an activist in a political party, where he fought for human rights. For that, he almost lost his life. He is now safe in Slovenia but his family is still in danger. He  got approval from Slovenian state to reunite with his four young children and a wife, so they can legally join him. But travel and administrative costs for their journey from Africa to Slovenia are very high. We help him collect the money for his children and wife could come to Slovenia and to be able to live and grow up in a save environment.



Društvo Odnos is NGO based in Ljubljana. We help refugees and thair families to integrate in Slovenian society. We offer them help with learning slovenian language, solving everyday life situations, social inclusion, children to include in school or kindergarden and we are also helping them to find work or get vocational trainings.



Unfortunately there are no state or other funding available to help refugee families to join their member in his country of asylum, so we are turning to you for help.

Thank you!

For all information about us please visit  www.odnos.si

story:
Puisque la plateforme de financement participatif Indiegogo est anglophone, vous pouvez demander une copie (PDF) de la version française de cette campagne en nous envoyant votre demande par courriel : info@ateliermyworks.com  

Merci de votre compréhension! 

L’équipe de L’ATELIER M.Y.


M.Y. WORK-SHOP:  LEARN, GROW and SUCCEED!

OUR STORY

M.Y. WORK-SHOP provides professional and organizational development training and coaching to both individuals and small to medium size organizations. Our focus is geared towards developing:

o  outstanding leadership

o  cohesive and productive teams 

o  effective and thriving organizations

Our services, delivered in a creative and dynamic manner, allow each participant to learn at his or her own pace while reaching new heights. Our human systems approach, favours small group learning, personalized services and sustainable results: we are the TOOL that allows our clients to achieve their full potential!

Since our launch in 2012, M.Y. WORK-SHOP has worked with clients in diverse sectors: non-profit, fashion and retail, arts, entertainment and recreation, food services, private care, event planning, etc. We have developed a specialty in working with young organizations (5 years or less) by providing them with a strong foundation. Given M.Y. WORK-SHOP’s values, particularly our belief in service leadership*, we have and will continue to provide pro-bono or low cost services to youth, women and senior’s groups in need.   

As 2016 unfolds, our new team will bring forward competitive services, which will be announced upon the unveiling of our new website. To learn more, contact the Founder, Yasmina Jimenez, by phone 438-877-4797 or email info@ateliermyworks.com.

*The service leadership concept is based on the philosophy of “servant leadership,” a term coined by Robert K. Greenleaf (1970’s)to define a leader who is first and foremost, a good servant. “It begins with the natural feeling that one wants to serve, to serve first,” Greenleaf wrote. “Then a conscious choice brings one to aspire to lead.” Servant leadership is a philosophy and set of practices that enriches the lives of individuals, builds better organizations and ultimately creates a more just and caring world.


OUR NEW TEAM

Yasmina Jimenez

Founder, Coach and Speaker

o  Professional development training design and facilitation

o  Organizational development evaluation and strategy

o  Specialization: coaching and project development

Sherley Joseph

Online Marketing Director

o  Social media and digital content strategy

o  Podcast and video development

o  Specialization: radio production, Word Press, B2B sales


OUR CAMPAIGN PARTNERS

COMPTOIR URBAIN offers cruelty-free products as an alternative to your everyday personal care items. Our mission is to educate the community about cruelty-free alternatives. CU aims to raise awareness and encourage conscious consumerism while playing an active role in promoting environmental sustainability.  Visit our shop and website today:

COMPTOIR URBAIN/ESPACE VÉGANE

6-5003 Earnscliffe
Montreal, QC, H3X 2P4 

www.comptoirurbain.ca


DEBRAH’S HOUSE is a non-profit organization that seeks to shelter and socially reintegrate young women between the ages of 16 and 25. During their stay at DEBRAH’S HOUSE, these young women will receive the necessary tools to thrive despite their difficult past: violence, sexual abuse or substance abuse. We will also welcome and support young mothers.

These young women will be referred to us by youth centres located in and around Montreal, but will also come from the community at large. Through various workshops and individual meetings with professionals, such as nurses, social workers, psychologists and coaches, these women will be brought to heal internally, discover their identity and grow on a personal, academic and/or professional level. The message that the team wishes to convey is that it is possible for them to regain hope and regain possession of their lives.

For further information on how to support DEBRAH’S HOUSE (donate, volunteer, partnership), please contact the Founder, Jessey Charles, by email: 

info@lamaisondebora.com


OUR OBJECTIVE

The Indiegogo campaign objective is two-fold: raise 6000$ to revamp M.Y.WORK-SHOP’ website and extend our services on-line through:

o  Improve Customized branding (allow our company to stand out among     competitors);

o  Feature mains services (coaching packages, professional development training programs, booking for speaking engagements and public events);

o  Feature sale on the Website will be professional development eBooks and pod-casts;

o  Feature short videos with tips on a variety of topics;

o  A scalable E-Commerce solution will be integrated into the Website and will have a 'multichannel' implementation allowing for the promotion and purchase or payments of products (e.g.: eBooks or pod-cast series) and services (e.g: Skype coaching packages) directly on the website and simultaneously on third party suppliers;

o  Social media integration, email marketing integration, mobile-compliant technology, and modern web design techniques;

o  Content Management, Client Relationship Management, Email Marketing, Social Media Marketing, and E-Commerce functionality will all be centralized and managed through the Website’s “The Back-end”, including a Content Management System for website administration functionality as well as Customer Relationship Management system, allowing for complete control over the website content and advanced integration into all other key systems the creation and tracking of client accounts and automated client email communications;

o  An option to register and subscribe to various features and allowing clients to choose their preferred language of communication and favourite topics;

In addition, the new website will be more attractive and user friendly, therefore becoming a great platform for future subscribers, clients, collaborators, sponsors and employees.


YOUR IMPACT

By supporting this campaign, you will not only bring M.Y. WORK-SHOP to another level, but also build a business worthy of offering employment opportunities to other coaches, speakers and administrators.

In addition, you will benefit from the many services we currently offer our clients at exceptional rates through the various perks we have created for this campaign.


OUR PERKS

You are not simply donating money to further M.Y. WORK-SHOP's development; you are also getting some fantastic deals! 

Coaching fees can easily range from $300 an hour to $2000 a month for 2-4 sessions. It can also range from $6k to $30K for 6 months to one year, depending on the individual or business's needs and mandate focus (e.g.: leadership, sales, customer service, strategic planning, etc.).

We mention these costs in order to highlight the value of the perks you will find within this campaign, in addition to the value of the services and information we will be offering the public through the new website.


YOUR SUPPORT

You may not be able to contribute to this campaign or need the perks presented to you, but word of mouth is essential to grow any business!

Please share this campaign as well as M.Y. WORK-SHOP’ services with your friends, family and professional network by using the sharing tools provided on this page.

o  Talk about us to your peers and encourage them to donate or choose the right perk to meet their needs - every little bit helps!

o  Follow M.Y. WORK-SHOP on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn!

o  Visit our old website!

o  Do you have other fundraising or partnership ideas? We would love to hear from you!  

Write to us at: info@ateliermyworks.com         


OUR APPRECIATION

We would like to thank all of you in advance for your support. We would also like to thank all those who have supported M.Y. WORK-SHOP’s development (family, friends and collaborators) and have extended their generosity to our clients and partners. You are all examples of true leaders:

“The growth and development of people is the highest calling of leadership.”     By Harvey S. Firestone

We are honoured to have you all in our lives, including our new Indiegogo friends, and hope to inspire others as much as you inspire us.

story:
Our name is Cassidy and Hanny with Paws All In The City and we are a startup company that is looking to voice the health issues and risks that many pet lovers are not aware of for dogs. We want to raise awareness since not too many people are aware of the risks our dogs go through and it hurts us to see them in pain. This is something we are very passionate about and we hope to make it successful. Our main goal is to create Denver’s (and hopefully the nation’s) first ever doggie fun-run/parade. We want to create something that will be fun yet educational. Think of it like the Color Run, Ugly Sweater Run and other fun races such as those. Not only will it be a fun walk, we are also planning on having a couple veterinarians present to help answer any questions that people may have. Each event will be dedicated towards a certain breed so that we can have the information more focused towards those breeds with a brochure to help educate people on what they may need to look out for.

Our first event will be Corgis Take Over Denver set on May 14, 2016 at Cheesman Park in Denver, Colorado. Even though the event is called Corgis Take Over Denver, that doesn’t mean that only Corgis will be welcome. All walks of dog will be able to join in the parade! The concept of the event is for people to bring their dogs and we will walk around a designated route in the park, afterwards there will be a costume contest for the dogs!  

What can you do? While we like to think that we are liked by a good many people, but we still need help in many different ways. From getting the word out about the event and to help getting funding to be able to put on our big dream event. 

We have created this campaign to help raise the money needed to launch this event and a portion of those proceeds will go to no-kill shelters, independent adoption centers and non-profit organizations that cater to the specific dog breeds depending on the event. We want this to be more of a cause and to be able to give back. Almost every household now has a pet of some sort and for people to not know or be prepared of the things they need to will hurt them in the end. We have seen friends and family go through so much pain when it’s too late to help their little fur buddies. Getting the wrong diagnosis, not knowing what is going on, and more.

story:
"What I say is, a town isn't a town without a bookstore.  It may call itself a town, but unless its got a bookstore it knows it's not fooling a soul."  ~N. Gaiman

That’s why it was so exciting when Paulina Springs Books opened up in the heart of downtown Redmond 8 years ago.  Since opening, the bookstore has become a valuable asset to the Redmond community, providing support to dozens of organizations and events with donations, resources and time commitments.

Paulina Springs Books in Redmond is in need of a new owner and that’s where you and I come in.  I’ve decided to take over the reins at the bookstore to breathe new life into it for many years to come. The new venture will be named Herringbone Books, and will carry on the important role Paulina Springs started. Due to circumstances beyond the control of Paulina Springs and myself, I can’t do it alone! Only with your assistance will I be able to keep this community service alive and start the new chapter called Herringbone Books, a literary and cultural spot to:

>read
<<browse
>>>linger
<<<<relax
>>>>>talk
<<<<<<learn
 >>>>>>>and explore.

We will continue to host author events and support local writers. We also want to continue supporting community book clubs, perhaps sponsor literary workshops, and provide fun events such as parties and more!  Herringbone Books will continue growing our Redmond clientele, adding value to our community much the same as Paulina Springs has done so over the years.

Independent bookstores have been experiencing a comeback as people realize how important they are to society as a whole and especially to a community. We strongly believe that the community of Redmond, Oregon deserves and wants to have a bookstore of its own.  You have shopped in and supported Paulina Springs Books in Redmond over the past several years and we hope you will be there to support it now.

With the addition of $25,000 in added funding we can ensure a long and fruitful life to Redmond's bookstore -- Paulina Springs reborn as Herringbone Books. 

For your contribution you will receive a "thank you" gift!  Check out our long list of cool rewards at every level including books, gift cards, store discounts, art, swag and more! (click on the Gallery tab to see pics)

Selling the Redmond location of Paulina Springs Books will achieve numerous things for you and your neighbors.  First and foremost it will continue this valuable asset.  It will also bring new vitality and ideas to the store that will make it an even better place for the community.  Our goal with Herringbone Books is to continue to be the local bookstore you love while also evolving it into something even better.


We know this is a big ask of a small community, and that not everyone can afford to give, but you can still help!  You can support this campaign by simply sharing it wherever you can, here in Central Oregon and elsewhere.  Get the message into the hands and hearts of people who care about Independent Bookstores.  

  • Give what you can.  We'll remember you forever!  (Check out the perks, you can get some cool swag and discounts on books!)
  • Please share this campaign via email with those who may be able to help. Share it even if someone cannot help ~ they may pass it along to someone who is able to.
  • Post it ALL OVER your social media.  People have passion for Indie Bookstores! 

    Here's a sample Facebook post and Tweet to get you started:

Facebook: Books. Books. Books.  Need I say more?  Join me in supporting  Herringbone Books: http://igg.me/at/herringbonebooks #Herringbonebooks

Twitter: Join me in supporting @Herringbonebx, Redmond's independent  bookstore! http://igg.me/at/herringbonebooks #Herringbonebooks

  • Check out our great rewards and spread the word that a little money will go a long way!  
  • We will accept more than money! Feel free to come visit us in the store and share your thoughts on what you love about it or what you believe would improve its services to you.
  • Lastly, but very importantly, consider ditching the amazon "buy now" button and have a real experience with people who love books!  If you're an e-reader, you are always able to buy your e-books through our website!

story:
Adde parvum parvo magnus acervus erit!* -Ovid

*Add a little to a little and there will be a great heap. 

If you’ve been to the Creek Monkey you know who we are.  We’re just a bunch of crazy kids that run around naked and scream punk rock lyrics at the top of our lungs.  Well not so much on the outside, but that’s what’s happening on the inside.  However, with the help of the community, we have created something outwardly visible, that we are proud of and want to expand.  We love the community that’s risen around the Monkey, and we make good beer, but we want to take it to the next level and make even better beer, and more of it!  To do so we need a larger facility.

What We Want To Do

If we hit our funding goals we can take out the loans necessary to put a full production facility in Martinez but it’s a million dollar play and we can’t do it alone.  The money you contribute will be used as part of the down payment on loans from the Small Business Administration.  We will use the funds from those loans to purchase approximately $500,000 in equipment and use the rest to build out the brewery space and install all of the equipment we purchase, as well as, a tap room (seen below). There will also be a small amount held back for operating expenses until the brewery becomes self-sufficient. This larger facility will allow us to produce enough beer to supply our needs and the needs of the surrounding community so we can really get the Rocksteady name out.  Even if we don’t hit our funding goal for the campaign we will still apply the funds we do get to our down payment fund and it will just take us a while longer to get there.  We are fully committed to the community of Martinez because you’ve already committed to us.


What You Get

In exchange for helping us out we have a load of really cool swag that Sarah’s been designing to give to you. Check out the merch gallery at https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/beer-in-the-... . In addition, we have events planned that should be fun for everyone.  Want to brew your own beer and roll it out like a big beer CEO?  You can do that.  Want to party with 50 of your closest friends in your own brewery for the day?  You can do that.  Want to make Brayden your personal slave for a day?  You can do that (keep it quiet until we let Brayden know.)  If you don’t see anything that tickles your fancy, send us an email and we can create something custom.  It’s sort of like a PBS pledge drive, but for the cool kids.

Becoming a Part of the Community

At Creek Monkey we’ve been able to successfully continue to grow despite the pitfalls that all restaurants face. We know that the brewery will only solidify our placement in the community and we want you to be a part of it.  With your help we can become a true institution known throughout the Diablo Valley.

This is obviously not without risk. There is competition growing in the brewing world.  We’re fortunate to be a part of a much larger artisan movement that is sweeping the United States.  We know we can continue to improve on what we’ve done with Creek Monkey and truly create a product in the Rocksteady space that will hold its own with any brewery out there.  We certainly expect to see Rocksteady on tap throughout the east bay but our real goal is to expand on our hospitality offerings throughout the Diablo Valley. We will be able to offer equity positions to people to join us on those expansions, thanks to the passage of the Jobs Act. However, the lynchpin of the company will always be the brewery and that brewery, the company flagship, will be rightfully located in the County Seat of Martinez, California. The combination of Creek Monkey Tap House and the Rocksteady Brewery will solidify Martinez’s place in the Craft Beer world.

Help Spread the Word!

We know that not everyone can assist us with a donation at this time but you can still help! Please share this campaign with as many people as you can. Help us get the word out about what we’re trying to do. Post it to your social media sites, mention it to a coworker and don’t forget to call your crazy Aunt Betty (we know she likes a tall cold one). Together we can make this happen and create a viable business that continues to employ local people to create a thriving community of beer lovers.

Here's a sample Facebook post and Tweet to get you started:
  • Facebook: Craft beer in the exotic East Bay? What could be better! Join me in supporting @rocksteadybrewing ! #rocksteadybrewing
  • Twitter: I found out about this cool new #brewery opening up in Martinez! Join me in supporting @rocksteadybrew at  http://igg.me/at/rocksteadybrewing 

Follow us on Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter!


Thank you so much for all of your support.


Community through the magic elixir of Beer!


*Please note that we are currently unable to ship overseas*

story:
Have you ever worried that the chemicals in cosmetics that you are using might not be that good for you?I have always been very careful about what I put into and onto my body. While I can control what food I put in my body, controlling what I put on my skin is a bit harder. If you pick up any bottle of shampoo, conditioner, soap, makeup or toothpaste at your local store you will see a whole slew of chemicals. Finding chemical free products is hard. Imagine having a website that you could go to find all of your organic, ethically made cosmetics in one place. 


Research shows that over 60% of what we put on our body is absorbed into our bloodstream. I believe that being responsible with what we put onto our bodies is a crucial element of good health. 


The money raised through this campaign will allow me to dedicate the time and energy necessary to get this project off of the ground. Your donations will not only help create a small company but they will help create a company that helps others. I plan to source products from non-profits and local farms. What does this mean? It means that your donation not only supports this company but it supports women in developing countries and local, small farmers. 


Even if I do not reach my specific goal, I am going to start this company. It will just take a while longer for me to get to a place where I can make this long time dream a reality. 


I know that starting this company will be a lot of work but I am passionate about and committed to this project. With a background in business management and marketing I am confident I have the skills to start this company and to make it a success. 


I appreciate you taking the time to read this. Any donation helps and if a donation is not financially feasible for you that is perfectly okay! Spreading the word about 6Oh! on social media and to your friends and family will make a huge impact as well.

story:
A Little Bit About MadCity Bazaar

MadCity Bazaar (MCB) is Madison's urban pop-up flea market, started in 2014 by Meghan Blake-Horst and Joe Mingle.  Consciously developed as a precursor to the planned Madison Public Market, MCB is already working to organize vendors and community partners to ensure the vitality and success of the Market's future.

With your help, MadCity Bazaar will expand our mentoring work with prospective vendors.  Targeting low income neighbors and those needing new opportunities, MCB provides clients the technical assistance they need to start their dream business in the Market District.  Many of these potential vending and business opportunities are in the prepared food and agricultural sectors.   

Mentoring Positives Off the Block Salsa Booth, MCB 2015

Additionally, we are actively seeking artists and performers to help shape the cultural life of the Market.  With adequate time and planning, we can create a diverse pool of Madisonians to weave together a culture that accurately reflects the full diversity of our community.

WORT live broadcast at MadCity Bazaar 2015 season kick-off!

Our 2016 goals:

  • To mentor no fewer than 10 aspiring entrepreneurs and help them be ready to vend during MadCity Bazaar's 2016 season.  
  • Schedule at least one local performer during each market day.  
  • One large scale community art project at the Bazaar during the 2016 season (for example: a wall or intersection mural, mosaic, bench building and painting, Little Free Library build, found object sculpture...).

Your support will provide new career paths for those who otherwise might not have the opportunity and begin to build a vibrant culture of vendors and performers around the Madison Public Market.

What We Need

Our goal is to raise $5,000!  As with any start-up, we operated at a loss our first season and received little compensation for our efforts.  Unable to raise additional revues through vendor fees during the off season, we simply don't have the resources to continue our work.  

Nevertheless, our passion keeps pushing us forward toward.  We have ongoing business expenses that we struggle to cover, including even little things like paying for parking or buying a potential future vendor a cup of coffee when we meet.  With no income during the off season, we are reaching out to our community to help us reach our goals and supplement what little this project provides.

Beyond staffing and organizing expenses, we need your donation to be able to pay pre-season expenses such as permits, insurance, and promotional materials. Capital and operational funds for tents, sound equipment and our favorite, the Port-o-potties, need to be secured well before the season begins.  

Below are some of our estimated expenses leading up to the 2016 MCB season (You will notice our expenses far exceed our goal.  Once our applications are live we will begin to bring in vendor fees to cover some of our expenses that will not be due until closer to the kick off of our season):

$3000 Vendor recruitment, mentoring and business planning

$600 Sound equipment

$200 Permits

$700 General Liability Insurance (annual policy)

$1000 Tents (last year we blew through (literally 20 mph winds are hard on cheep tents).  This year we plan on upgrading to tents with warranties and maybe our logo!)

$2500 Musicians and performers 

$500 Community Art Project

$500 Graphic Design Work (poster, flyers, ads, signage...)

$1000 Printing (posters, flyers, signage...)

$1000 Advertising and promotion 

Rent and utilities TBD

What You Get

Now that you have an idea of what out what our costs are, check out the variety of perks we have to thank you for your generous contribution and what you will help us achieve! All funds raised from this effort will go directly toward our 2016 goals. Thanks in advance for your consideration and support!

            

The Impact

Many people in our community are concerned about issues such as racial disparities and poverty.  MadCity Bazaar and the Madison Public Market present an opportunity to create new career paths and wealth building jobs for low income neighbors especially people of color.  

Deirdre Thompson, of DatzGirlie, first day of vending, hosted by MadCity Bazaar.

This is an important goal, and one that's shared by many in our community.  But, it won't happen on its own!  It takes a conscious effort and dedicated resources. We have a system to identify, recruit and mentor these up-and-coming entrepreneurs in our community.  MadCity Bazaar and the Madison Public Market can provide a unique and affordable way to get their ideas and products before the buying public.

During the 2015 MadCity Bazaar season, we hosted 8 first time vendors and offered them support in a variety of ways.  For example, assisted with set-up, provided tents, weights and tables free of charge, stored supplies, and offered feedback on best practices.  Partnering with the Downtown Madison, Inc. on Top of State programming, gave us valuable experience working with local homeless and underemployed residents.

In order to create a welcoming environment and robust programming at future market events, we also need to have a focused effort and dedicated resources. Through careful planning for cultural and artistic activities, we can connect Madison to the World and the World to Madison.

Not only will your support help cultivate and strengthen the local food system infrastructure while address racial disparities.   It will also help grow a stronger more resilient community.

Risks & Challenges

Of the 10 new businesses we hope to help create, we anticipate at least 6 will actually be successful vendors at the Bazaar and continue beyond the first season. Likely one or two will develop something that doesn't fit the flea market format and at least a couple will just never get off the ground. 

This is hard stuff, folks, and the reality is that  some of the prospective vendors we connect with will not reach their goals or grow successful businesses.  For example, despite everyone's best efforts, some potential businesses just won't be able to secure start-up financing.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Do you have experience working with or owning a small business and might be interested in mentoring?  Are you a musician, poet, cultural group, dance troupe or performer?  Contact us at info@madcitybazaar.com to get involved in the Bazaar in 2016.  

Looking for a fun event to volunteer with in the summer of 2016?  Please contact us at info@madcitybazaar.com to learn more about all the fun we're going to have that you won't want to miss.

Please, please help us spread the word!  Share the link and info about our campaign with all of your friends and family directly as well as on social media.  Click on the social media "share" buttons for a quick and easy way to get the word out.  Help us make it go viral, please share it with everyone now!

Follow us on Social Media:

MadCity Bazaar on Facebook

@MadCityBazaar on Twitter 

@MadCityBazaar on Instagram

On the web: www.madcitybazaar.com 

Join our MadCity Bazaar mailing list

Youth working with "Farmer Joe" separating veggies from the Darbo Community Gardens at MadCity Bazaar.

This is an important goal, and one that's shared by many in our community.  But, it won't happen on its own!  It takes a conscious effort and dedicated resources. We have a system to identify, recruit and mentor these up-and-coming entrepreneurs in our community.  MadCity Bazaar and the Madison Public Market can provide a unique and affordable way to get their ideas and products before the buying public.
During the 2015 MadCity Bazaar season, we hosted 8 first time vendors and offered them support in a variety of ways.  For example, assisted with set-up, provided tents, weights and tables free of charge, stored supplies, and offered feedback on best practices.  Partnering with the Downtown Madison, Inc. on Top of State programming, gave us valuable experience working with local homeless and underemployed residents.
In order to create a welcoming environment and robust programming at future market events, we also need to have a focused effort and dedicated resources. Through careful planning for cultural and artistic activities, we can connect Madison to the World and the World to Madison.
Not only will your support help cultivate and strengthen the local food system infrastructure while address racial disparities.   It will also help grow a stronger more resilient community.

Risks & Challenges
Of the 10 new businesses we hope to help create, we anticipate at least 6 will actually be successful vendors at the Bazaar and continue beyond the first season. Likely one or two will develop something that doesn't fit the flea market format and at least a couple will just never get off the ground. 
This is hard stuff, folks, and the reality is that  some of the prospective vendors we connect with will not reach their goals or grow successful businesses.  For example, despite everyone's best efforts, some potential businesses just won't be able to secure start-up financing.  

Other Ways You Can Help
Do you have experience working with or owning a small business and might be interested in mentoring?  Are you a musician, poet, cultural group, dance troupe or performer?  Contact us at info@madcitybazaar.com to get involved in the Bazaar in 2016.  
Looking for a fun event to volunteer with in the summer of 2016?  Please contact us at info@madcitybazaar.com to learn more about all the fun we're going to have that you won't want to miss.
Please, please help us spread the word!  Share the link and info about our campaign with all of your friends and family directly as well as on social media.  Click on the social media "share" buttons for a quick and easy way to get the word out.  Help us make it go viral, please share it with everyone now!
Follow us on Social Media:
MadCity Bazaar on Facebook
@MadCityBazaar on Twitter 
@MadCityBazaar on Instagram
On the web: www.madcitybazaar.com 
Join our MadCity Bazaar mailing list


Youth working with "Farmer Joe" separating veggies from the Darbo Community Gardens at MadCity Bazaar.

story:
I, Michael Wayne Maris, was born in Los Angeles California on July 4th 1977. I am an independent artist with a passion for drawing, painting, airbrushing, sculpting, and graphic design.  I also have a passion for writing stories, books, poetry and lyrics. I have an AA Degree from Brooks College in Long Beach, California for Graphic Design. I have over thirteen years of experience in graphics, designing business cards, logos, flyers, websites, postcards, clothing, and more. I have over twenty years of airbrushing experience painting murals, clothing, and youth sports banners.

     I learned the hard way how artists are treated and taken advantage of, which forced me to take a step back and focus on the business side of being an artist. Seeing the state of our economy also contributed to me forming many ideas and different ways to do business as an artist.  I figured in these hard times small business and community need to thrive more then ever and in figuring this out i had a vision. It's a big vision… A MONSTA VIZION. 

     Up to this point i have done things mostly on my own, but to expand and grow the vision i have I need help. That is where contributions will play a big factor in moving to the next level. Helping with promotional items, materials, and acquiring a team of fellow artists and personnel. 

    In a business sense, THE MONSTA VIZION is the corporation that many smaller ideas/companies can call it home. I am only asking for funding in the amount of $3,000 to help grow the first three ideas within my vision. Evenly divided that would make the funding for each idea $1,000. 

Monsta Designs:…has been designing every idea within The Monsta Vizion as well as doing graphics for individuals and small businesses. I have made some great customers and keep things simple when it comes to the amount of business Monsta Designs can handle, but now it is time to evolve from the state of 'Monsta,' and if funding is met, Monsta Designs will grow into The Fenix Design Firm. Funding will help with bringing in part time and intern graphic designers, part time office personnel, and promotional materials geared to reaching out into the community and expanding business. (MONSTA DESIGNS ONLINE PORTFOLIO)

Monsta Banners:…provides custom airbrushed sports banners for youth teams in soccer, baseball, and softball. I have over fifteen years experience airbrushing sports banners and one of the greatest things is watching the face of a team seeing their banner for the first time. The compliments are great and I have always tried to be creative when painting but what sets my banners from the next guy is pricing. Parents have to fork out alot of money to sign kids up, get equipment, and even travel sometimes. I know from experience how stressful getting a banner can be for a parent when all they want is to give the kids something cool to represent their team. I only charge five dollars per player on a team so if the team has nine players the price is forty-five dollars. This makes the price fluxuate from team to team but I make up for it all with volume. If funding is reached it will get me the materials i need as well as the marketing and promotional items needed to expand outside my community and comfort zone. Monsta Banners will expand, leaving the 'Monsta' behind and it will grow into Active Creations Sports Banners. (MONSTA BANNERS ONLINE PORTFOLIO)

Monsta Artists:…I am the original Monsta Artist, creating murals, drawings, paintings, t-shirts, and sculptors. I want to build this into a community of independent artists with a common creative goal. Not one of fame but one of free expression. That is all artists ever really want is the freedom to express themselves thru their desired medium and make some kind of living doing so. If funding is reached, it will give me the means to acquire art supplies and promotional materials so i am able to create work for myself as an artist and find others to join this community. To be a Monsta Artist is to be creative…inspirational…progressive… (MONSTA ARTISTS ONLINE PORTFOLIO)

     If my funding needs are not met, then progressing to the next level will not happen for all of these ideas, but if the minimum funding of $3,000 is met then i will be able to push each idea to the next level so it may continue to grow.

     However the three ideas are only a small glimpse of a bigger vision and if the funding exceeds the $3,000, anything up to $99,999 will still be allocated to these three ideas, but if funding were to reach $100,000 or more then that funding will be evenly spread throughout the entire vision:

    There are a total of fourteen ideas within this vision. Check out the video i have created to get a better glimpse of this vision.

The next best thing to contributing is to spread the word about The Monsta Vizion.

Thank you,

Michael Wayne Maris
