story:
• Hello prospective patrons. This is an opportunity to introduce to you the culinary wonders of the Country of Jamaica. Most of the people around the Globe are very aware by now, of the musical talents of the Jamaican people, through the music of our very popular rap artists and singers. We also boast of the beauty of the Island through tourism, with some of the most marvelous hotels, beaches rain forests, very scenic and mountainous terrain, and art galleries with some of the finest painters and sculptors of the world. 


  • We also have witnessed the "lightening" speed of our athletes at Olympics and World Championship events, but not enough is known of the Culinary talents of the Jamaican People and some of the delicious dishes, unless you were already a visitor to the Island or have eaten at a Jamaican Restaurant. Usually Caribbean Restaurants in America are usually limited to a few dishes they serve. Being born in the Island of Jamaica and migrating here to the United States 18 years ago, I not only took my knowledge in fine Arts here with me but also my knowledge of the Culinary dishes, their history and tastes. Jamaica a Caribbean Island is blessed with one of the widest variety of fruits and more than twenty different type of mangoes.
  •  Much of my cooking and baking talents are learned from my Mother and Grandmother, and I would like to share most of this knowledge by making available, Jamaican snacks, pastries and dishes available for you to taste. I am sure you will enjoy another of the hidden beauties of the Island of Jamaica, because we are not only blessed with our most popular dish Jerk Chicken. There is so much more for you to enjoy of Jamaican Culinary Cuisine. I will be sharing some of these snacks and dishes with you as you contribute, so you will be able to taste just more that regular Jamaican food if you have been there as a tourist or to introduce you to some of our snacks and delicacies.


My contributors to this project will make it possible for me to set up a place where these products can be cooked, baked and packaged, and also for a diner who would like to come and dine at a place where Jamaican and Caribbean dishes are served. However the initial stage of this business enterprise is to make and package Tropical snacks using spices from Jamaica and the Caribbean to flavor them and to have them shipped to our clients through express shipping to reach them in a couple of days. These products will be available soon and can be purchased on an online store. We will reward you generously with products and gifts for your contributions to make this great dream come through.
I am asking you to please spread the word around regarding this campaign if you cannot contribute immediately with cash. Please share my campaign on facebook and all other social networking sites. Your help will be highly appreciated. As soon as our website is completed you will be informed so you will be able to make direct purchases from there.
We would like to give gifts of products, but we would also like to award trips and vacations to the most generous donors. This is also an opportunity for me to meet great friends and to share my culinary talents and recipes with them and I hope they will do the same for me. Tank you very much for your interest and support for this cause as I see this as one of the most important points in my life, as I have not only already shared my Visual Artistic skills already with the World, but see this as a great opportunity to share the Jamaican and Caribbean Culinary Culture also.
Please Contribute today and let be begin to bless you with some of my most favorite culinary delicacies like the snack bars which are available in some of the most popular flavors like Cinnamon, Nutmeg, Almond and Vanilla and consist of nuts like peanuts, cashews, almond, oatmeal, pistachio, mixed nuts and a variety of flavors and tastes. I will also be shipping the delicious Jamaican Easter Bun, and Spiced Buns, coming in 2 pound, 1 pound and 1/2 pound sizes seasoned with Jamaican raisin, fruits and currents and combined deliciously with cheddar or any of your favorite cheeses.

What We Need & What You Get

You will be awarded several different snacks and gifts for your contributions. The more bountiful you are in giving, the more perks you will be sent. All of you will be fans forever and should join us on facebook to share your thoughts about our products and perks.
I need $16,000 to implement this project. If the total goal is not reached within 60 days your gifts will still be sent and we will endeavor to seek other ways such as parties and promotional events to raise the additional funds that is needed to make this dream a reality.
$2000 of this total amount will go towards the purchase of a baking oven for our products.
$2000 will be used to purchase baking and cooking equipment and electronic food processing equipment.
$2,500 will go to purchase refrigeration equipment, which includes a freezer for ingredients and a refrigerator  for items that requires a lower temperature.
$4000 will be used to purchase food ingredients.
$2,500 will be used for website construction and maintenance and advertising leaflets and business promotional events.
$3000 will be used for the first two months of rental and utility cost of location, Business Licensing and Permits.

The Impact


  • You are by your contribution helping to spread the Jamaican and Caribbean Culinary taste and experience far and wide. I dream of spreading this dream to more than one location if possible.
  • I have successfully published two books of the Jamaican Culture and History Called "Musical Lyrics in Art and Poetry" and another that tells of the landing in the remote Jamaican village of Moore Town, extra terrestrial creatures that intended to control and rule over the Island of Jamaica.
  • This is the beginning of a 'food revolution'. Your contribution will popularize the Jamaican Culinary culture to America and the World and you will be an important part of it by making your mark to make this lifelong dream a reality.
Before coming to the United States in 1998 I've had the the opportunity to visit many of the other Caribbean Island both in the Dutch and British Caribbean, like Trinidad, Barbados, Curacao, Bonaire, Aruba, and Caracas Venezuela, South America, and have enjoyed their Cuisine. I have appreciated and enjoyed those flavors and would like to share some of those wonderful ingredients in the snacks I will send you for your contribution. I have made my first dreams come through with my publication of Jamaican Art History, Poetry and a Novel. Now it is time to share with you the rich cultural traditions in the Jamaican Culinary traditions.

story:
(English version)
"My mom always does so much for us", states Lorenzo, 8 years-old child, staring at us with his big blue eyes "It's not a problem for me to help her doing her job". Lorenzo is actually sometimes helping his mother, Dolores, in doing the cleaning in a camp nearby their village, Cittanova (Novigrad), Istria, Croatia. She's a strong single mom, with the same blue eyes of her little child, and a warm smile on her face. Some years ago she decided to start to build a B&B with the money she got from selling her father inheritance. Unfortunately, the money was not enough, and she couldn't finish her project.
The structure is almost ready, a cozy house in the very center of this little istrian town, 2 minutes’ walk from the seaside. Dolores is a great cook and house keeper, and having her own B&B would be a dream come true. She would be able to welcome her guests and at the same time look after her little child. 
The money we need to collect isn't much. Here's how we mean to spend it:
- 3000 € to furnish the rooms
- 3000 € to finish the bathrooms restoration
- 5000 € for the AC
- 7000 € for electrical and water furniture supply
- 5000 € for solar panels for hot water
- 1000 € for bureaucracy
- 1000 € for contingencies 
The vision of the B&B would be to be faithful to the tradition of Istria as far as food and hospitality is concerned, but in a sustainability perspective: solar panels, no-ironing policy if required, home grown fruit and vegetables, homemade marmalade and bred. 
Your contribution to this project would be a blessing for an entire family. And, which is more, you could always have your place in this cozy, friendly and sustainable environment. 
We promise a lot of perks! 

If you can not help us with a contribution please spread the word to all your friends :)



(Italian version)
“La mamma fa sempre così tanto per noi”, afferma Lorenzo, bimbo di 8 anni, fissandoci con i suoi enormi occhi azzurri, “non è un problema per me aiutarla sul lavoro”. Lorenzo in effetti ogni tanto aiuta sua madre, Dolores, a fare le pulizie in un campeggio vicino alla sua cittadina, Cittanova (Novigrad), Istria, Croazia. Lei è una mamma single con una grande forza d’animo e gli stessi occhi azzurri del suo bambino, un caldo sorriso sul suo volto. 
Qualche anno fa, ha deciso di iniziare a costruire un B&B con i soldi ottenuti dalla vendita di un piccolo lotto di terreno eredità di suo padre. Purtroppo, i soldi non sono bastati e non ha potuto finire il suo progetto. 
La struttura è quasi pronta, una accogliente casa nel centro di questa piccola città istriana, a due minuti a piedi dal lungo mare. Dolores è una cuoca eccezionale e un’accogliente padrona di casa. Avere un suo B&B sarebbe il suo sogno che diventa realtà. Potrebbe dare il benvenuto ai suoi ospiti e allo stesso tempo passare del tempo con suo figlio. 
I soldi di cui abbiamo bisogno non sono molti, e questo è come intendiamo spenderli:
- 3000 € per arredare le stanze
- 3000 € per finire i bagni
- 5000 € per installare l’aria condizionata
- 7000 € per gli allacciamenti di acqua e luce
- 5000 € per i pannelli solari per l’acqua
- 1000 € per gli adempimenti burocratici
- 1000 € per eventuali imprevisti
La visione del B&B sarà quello di essere fedele alla tradizione istriana per quanto riguarda la cucina e l’ospitalità, ma con una prospettiva di sostenibilità: pannelli solari, politica dell’evitare la stiratura se richiesto, frutta e verdura coltivate in campo a qualche centinaio di metri di distanza, marmellate e pane fatto in casa.
Il vostro contributo al progetto sarebbe una benedizione per un’intera famiglia. E, per di più, avrete sempre un posto in questo ambiente accogliente, amichevole e sostenibile.
Per ringraziarvi promettiamo molti vantaggi (si veda "perks") 
E se proprio non puoi aiutarci, spargi la voce a tutti i tuoi amici :)

Potrebbe dare il benvenuto ai suoi ospiti e allo stesso tempo passare del tempo con suo figlio. I soldi di cui abbiamo bisogno non sono molti, e questo è come intendiamo spenderli:- 3000 € per arredare le stanze- 3000 € per finire i bagni- 5000 € per installare l’aria condizionata- 7000 € per gli allacciamenti di acqua e luce- 5000 € per i pannelli solari per l’acqua- 1000 € per gli adempimenti burocratici- 1000 € per eventuali imprevistiLa visione del B&B sarà quello di essere fedele alla tradizione istriana per quanto riguarda la cucina e l’ospitalità, ma con una prospettiva di sostenibilità: pannelli solari, politica dell’evitare la stiratura se richiesto, frutta e verdura coltivate in campo a qualche centinaio di metri di distanza, marmellate e pane fatto in casa.Il vostro contributo al progetto sarebbe una benedizione per un’intera famiglia. E, per di più, avrete sempre un posto in questo ambiente accogliente, amichevole e sostenibile.Per ringraziarvi promettiamo molti vantaggi (si veda "perks") E se proprio non puoi aiutarci, spargi la voce a tutti i tuoi amici :)

story:
Overall Summary

Boiling Bugs is a cajun and creole family owned restaurant. Family and friends is what started this whole thing. Family, friends and supporters like you is what we need to finish it.

My vision for Boiling Bugs to open our commercial kitchen  so that we can serve the lunch crowds in our area and prepare our packaged goods for local food and farmers markets. In the next 2-5 years we want to expand to 5 restaurants and offer our packaged goods in your favorite grocery chain. In order to do so we must have a certified kitchen to prepare these meals in. 

For those who have experienced our food can testify, we use the freshest foods, local and higher quality ingredients.  Our meats and produce are brought from farms here in Texas across to Louisiana. Which brings about the best tasting food you can find.

So far, we have leased land, purchased buildings, done the construction in the buildings and passed one inspection. We have just one more inspection to pass. However during this process the county requirements have changed from when we first begin. We have funded the total project on our own. In the middle of funding this project my husband lost his job. So we have totally depended on my teacher salary to finish out this project and pay for our home expenses as well. 

You Can Help

We come so far and so close to finish our goal. Your donations will help us address the changes the fire marshall needs us to make so that we will pass inspection when they come out. It will also help us purchase the supplies needed to get started quickly.

Our Challenges

One of the major challenges we face once we open is being properly staffed to support the huge amount of business that flood the area for lunch. Once we pass our final inspection we plan to open immediately.

One way we plan on addressing this issue is by visiting local ministries and group homes to offer employment opportunities.

The second way will be to reach out to the local community colleges so that students can utilize their work study programs for culinary students or business students who want to learn how to run a small business.

The goal of our company is just not to create financial opportunities, we want to find ways to give back to those who surround us in all the ways this company can be beneficial to them.

Future Endeavors 

Once we open our kitchen we also plan to open a "country store" next door that offers our packaged meals along with creole and cajun items that may not be offered in this area. There will be also have our t-shirts and paraphernalia.

In our next phase we will work on the distribution of our pre-packaged meals to local and regional grocery food chains.

story:
The Entrepreneur in Brief

Recently, Harvard Business School released a study that shows that 75 percent of all start-ups fail. That's alarming right?

As business coach, trusted advisor, and startup evangelist, I have seen businesses fail, and have experienced one myself. The biggest challenge I see associated with business failure is the huge prints of setback that it leaves on its victims years after it event occurred. Believe me, its aftermath of deep psychological, social, and financial turmoil can be terribly devastating if no managed properly.

What if there was a better way to start, manage, and grow a business profitably and more sustainably?

What if we told you that the process of becoming an entrepreneur has been made less complicated, and many startup founders are already turning their ideas into businesses of their dreams?



Imagine for a moment...


Imagine having an idea you have fallen in love with. But you are afraid of stepping out to take the risk of becoming an entrepreneur and living your dream. What if you could find a way to eliminate your fear of failure, start your own business, and become a successful entrepreneur?

The Entrepreneur - A Lean Startup Culture for the Smart Entrepreneur to Build a Sustainable Business is an easy-to-read book written by Nkem Mpamah, founder of Cognition Global Concepts Limited to show you the proven steps you can take to raise your odds of success, and start your business of choice.

Here's the key... It doesn't matter how many times you got it all wrong before... knowing the right things to do when starting your business makes all the difference. This book will give you the step-by-step guidance and tools for you to turn your ideas into a profitable business.

Sounds great right?


For about 20 years, Nkem Mpamah worked within financial services, precisely in banking.

He initially started as a qualified accountant and later took on the responsibility of working with small business owners, providing strategic advisory services to start, manage, and grow their businesses.

In 2010, he left full time employment to start his business strategy consulting and coaching practice. Through his coaching programs, workshops, executive classes, and blogging, Nkem has literally helped several hundreds of startup founders, small business owners, and successful entrepreneurs to turn ideas into reality, and achieve their dreams of building profitable businesses.

If starting a new business or designing a product (or service) that customers will buy willingly is of interest to you or someone you know, then pre-order this book right now! We want make the game of becoming an entrepreneur fun for you. Moreover, your donation will help us to reach hundreds of thousands more aspiring entrepreneurs across the world with our lean startup culture. 
 


What We Need, and What You Get

We believe that no matter what, you have the power within you to make change happen.

  • We are raising $27,500 to publish a comprehensive step-by-step guide to start, and manage a new business using Lean Startup Culture as a basis. We want you to join this movement, and together we can transform the world.
  •  We will invest your donation in publishing paperback and digital e-book version, which will be distributed across all major online and offline channels across the globe.  Rest assure, The Entrepreneur will offer incredible insights, tools and techniques for aspiring startup founders, as well as the very experienced business owners who are seeking to get a grip on Lean Startup Methodology.
  •  In return for your support, we are giving you the opportunity to receive digital copies of the book, signed paperback, full day live workshop for you and your team in your office, and a chance to feature on our website, or be acknowledged in the book.


A Global Impact

We have significantly helped several startup and experienced entrepreneurs to start and grow their own businesses successfully with the exact same concepts, tools and techniques shared in this book.


Read what few of them are saying about the impact we're making.....


"This year has been such a tremendous success so far, I have been able to accomplish all of my 2013 goals and it feels amazing. In particular I cleared a bulk of my debt and I finally got my Business beyond being just a good idea. This is the first time in my life where I have been able to set targets for what I want to achieve and actually see myself met them. I am feeling such a great sense of achievement and fulfillment and I could not have done it without the wonderful coaching and support from Nkem Mpamah. He is a fantastic coach to say the least." - Vanessa Barrett, London


"Working with Nkem has been great. Whether you are looking to startup your business, advance your career or simply need motivation, Nkem is the guy for the job and I would definitely recommend him. His style challenges you. He gives you a practical, pragmatic, and holistic step-by-step guide in achieving your goals. As a result of his coaching, I’ve had greater clarity in achieving the goals, which I had once thought was impossible to accomplish." - Chika Akinwale, Cambridge


“Nkem is the best at what he does. He helped me put my business ideas into perspective, and today, I have my own business. Nkem is very knowledgeable, personable and trustworthy. He offers strategic advice that will help grow your business or even inspire you to achieve your career/business goals. I highly recommend him for anyone who wants to start a new business or needs to achieve better results in their existing business.” – Carol Ibe, USA.


"Nkem has enabled me to confront and push aside all the compelling payoffs & rewards that did not support the change(s) I wanted in my life; the things that were responsible for keeping me where I’ve been for the last 12 years with regards to developing my career." - Ayca Isikyildiz Smith, Australia


Honestly speaking, I do not have any doubt in my mind that you can turn around the lives of thousands of aspiring entrepreneurs across the world, who do not have the means of accessing proven concepts, coaching tools, and mentoring by simply supporting us to publish this book!



Challenges

As you probably know, we do not claim to be the best in the world when it comes to helping startup founders or product developers turn ideas into reality. we wish we were though :). 

 But here's the truth; while there are many "classroom experts" out there, we are a team of practising entrepreneurs, business coaches, mentors, and startup evangelists.

What does this mean to you?

We have seen businesses succeed; and we have also seen businesses fail. Infact we have experienced business failure first hand and learned great lessons from it, part of which we are showing aspiring entrepreneurs how to avoid.

Let me ask you...

  • Whose tools and techniques would you recommend to your friend for starting a business; a classroom teacher or a practising mentor who has been there and done that?

That's the challenge, many people promise similar results, but you can help us get the real tools into the hands of people out there.


Other Ways You Can Help

While we hope that you will support us reach our goal in this regards, we will sincerely appreciate it if you could:

  • Share this campaign with every startup founder you know.
  • Share this campaign with every aspiring entrepreneur. It's never too early to prepare for the rainy days.
  • If you're as passionate as us to drastically reduce the high percentage of startup failure around the world, then make some noise! Tweet this campaign, share it on Facebook, email it to your friends, talk to your acquaintance in paid employment who would like to start his own business one day. The more people know about this campaign, the more likely we are to succeed in reaching our goal.

Thank you so very much for your support.

We appreciate you!

story:
Wandering Spirit Native Awareness Ltd

2015 Calgary Chamber of Commerce Small Business Award finalist...
Utilizing Traditional values and teachings of our ancestors while combining with modern tools, techniques our team at Wandering Spirit has inspired, empowered thousands of high risk youth, families, schools and communities over the years.  Wandering Spirit has now branched out to the corporate world, providing Aboriginal Awareness training, specialized workshops along with awareness presentations.
My name is Jackie Soppit, I am the owner and Executive Director of Wandering Spirit Native Awareness Ltd.  In short, I would like to express that providing such programs, presentations, performances, classes is my life's work, my passion and love.  I first handedly know the impact not having connection to culture has, in my young life I was disconnected, It wasn't until i was introduced to culture my life turned around.  I can truly say that this way of life saved my life many times over, it is that reason i do what i do.  At the young age of 18 myself and two others created Wandering Spirit as simply a traditional dance class.  Now Wandering Spirit runs programming five days a week - "Cultural Connections" and "Dance Forward", along with numerous performances, workshops, events, Aboriginal Awareness training, and newly added dance theatre productions. 


What We Need & What You Get

  - With government funding cut backs we are in need of extra funding to deliver our programming.  At present we have had to make several cut backs with in our programs just to continue.

  - With in our program "Cultural Connections" participants learn to dance, history of dances, drumming, music break downs, cultural teachings, protocols pertaining to both dance and drumming, life skills, team building, connection with traditionalist, elders, regalia making, public speaking, stage make-up, performance etc.  Once a participant has completed the program and their dance regalia they are recognized by the community in a special "Rites of Passage" ceremony held at a large community event (pow wow) open to the public every June. 

Wandering Spirit is in need of a space to call their own, at present Wandering Spirit is still run as a home based office renting various dance studios, community halls and spaces to accommodate our programs.  

 - materials and supplies

          dance regalia supplies - 12,000 (60 participants to create their own regalia)

          lighting,portable stage and props for dance theatre productions - 15,000

         - list of prices etc

        - $15,000 honorarium for elders/traditionalists/jr. instructor incentives

        - program coordinator salary - $20,000 we have partial funding ($20,000    private sponsor)

   - Full time studio costs $5000/month x 12 = $60,000 - the space would be to house our office, have daily dance training for our dance entertainment team, to deliver our community programming, host events, workshops, training for the public.  

**Funders Perks**

Funders/sponsors are welcomed to come and see the space, take part in classes, events and see schedule of events/performances to attend, they will be publicly acknowledged on our website and on all promotional materials (with their permission).   


The Impact

Your contribution will have an outstanding impact on our company.  Having our own space will allow growth on so many levels; stable facility to host all programming, space for our dance performance group to rehearse performances/productions, Wandering Spirit events, specialized workshops, the ability to transform to a professional dance company having a full time curriculum in all Aboriginal dance styles, in turn empowering a new generation of fully trained dancers/instructors/facilitators which will create new work opportunities as instructors/performers.

  • In return you as a contributor will have access to our scheduled events/programs/performances.  The opportunity to take part in classes, workshops and come have a site visit while having an authentic experience with in the Aboriginal culture of 2015.
  • Wandering  Spirit is a non-profit company who has provided such programming for 16years now serving well into the 1000's of clients.  We are a grass roots organization fully committed, passionate, hard working and devoted to the success of what we do, inspiring empowering healthy youth, families, communities on outward. 
  • In all we do cultural protocol is always followed, either offering, ceremony or consultation with elders. It is these values, traditional teachings we follow that have lead us to our success so far, we take all we do very seriously and handle with the highest respect and care.  

Risks & Challenges

Being that Wandering Spirit runs out of a home based office we face struggles with space restrictions, office supplies and until we move into our home base office/studio it will continue to be a struggle going from space to space for programming.

  • Wandering Spirit has run in these conditions for 16 years, its true we have outgrown our space and situation but we have grown from a tiny dance class to servicing 1000's of clients, we will continue until we are blessed with our new space.  
  • Another struggle we face is covering costs while waiting for program funding.
  • We have a savings account that will cover us for the next 3 months, by then our funding will be in.

Other Ways You Can Help

Wandering Spirit is always in need of volunteers for events/programming etc

  • your help can help move mountains by helping us get the word out about our company, programs and performances.
  • please share our campaign links with friends, contacts, your help in doing so can make all the difference... thank you for helping us help our community.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
I’m dj Diddie and I hail from Kibera, Nairobi - Africa’s largest slum with around a million inhabitants. Born and raised in this colourful but hectic neighbourhood, music has always been my escape and passion. I grew up dancing, rapping, amidst reggae, hip hop and East African music. That’s why it might come as a surprise that now that I a grown up, I am a house music dj. I may well be the only such dj in Kibera.

For the past two years I have been concentrating on building my skills and experience as a dj. And despite the obstacles, lacking my own equipment being the main one, I feel I have come far, having played in some of the best venues of Nairobi’s famous nightlife, and worked with some of East Africa’s premier dj’s and producers. I love entertaining, sharing the joy of music with the audience. Now I dream of having my own controller and other essential technology for me to be able to continue to grow as an artist, dedicate myself to this passion of mine, and start producing music and making my own tracks.

It is challenging to pursue one’s artistic aspirations when there is no access to music or artistic education, where the genre of music you love is marginalised and the music industry overall is just coming about. When it comes to electronic music, it’s particularly hard to make it when equipment is expensive and hard to come by. However, I am excited about someday getting to where I can and want to go as a dj. Any support from those of you out there is received with great gratitude. I wouldn’t be where I am without my community, without friends. In return, I promise to contribute to the electronic music scene in Kenya. I also want to give back to my community in Kibera, share my skills by training youths in Kibera interested in deejaying. Maybe some day I will have my own studio where they come and train for free and pursue their dreams in better conditions.

Donations are greatly appreciated, but if you're unable to donate, simply sharing my campaign with your friends could go a long way towards helping me out. Thank you!

In addition to thank you i will share my first album that i have produced with you for free and including a video from my first session plus a Big Hug
story_txt: I’m dj Diddie and I hail from Kibera, Nairobi - Africa’s largest slum with around a million inhabitants. Born and raised in this colourful but hectic neighbourhood, music has always been my escape and passion. I grew up dancing, rapping, amidst reggae, hip hop and East African music. That’s why it might come as a surprise that now that I a grown up, I am a house music dj. I may well be the only such dj in Kibera. For the past two years I have been concentrating on building my skills and experience as a dj. And despite the obstacles, lacking my own equipment being the main one, I feel I have come far, having played in some of the best venues of Nairobi’s famous nightlife, and worked with some of East Africa’s premier dj’s and producers. I love entertaining, sharing the joy of music with the audience. Now I dream of having my own controller and other essential technology for me to be able to continue to grow as an artist, dedicate myself to this passion of mine, and start producing music and making my own tracks.It is challenging to pursue one’s artistic aspirations when there is no access to music or artistic education, where the genre of music you love is marginalised and the music industry overall is just coming about. When it comes to electronic music, it’s particularly hard to make it when equipment is expensive and hard to come by. However, I am excited about someday getting to where I can and want to go as a dj. Any support from those of you out there is received with great gratitude. I wouldn’t be where I am without my community, without friends. In return, I promise to contribute to the electronic music scene in Kenya. I also want to give back to my community in Kibera, share my skills by training youths in Kibera interested in deejaying. Maybe some day I will have my own studio where they come and train for free and pursue their dreams in better conditions.Donations are greatly appreciated, but if you're unable to donate, simply sharing my campaign with your friends could go a long way towards helping me out. Thank you!In addition to thank you i will share my first album that i have produced with you for free and including a video from my first session plus a Big Hug

story:
Growing Home

A Food Program of HALO, Inc.

We are launching Racine's first urban farm CSA! Let me break that down for you...

Racine - our downtown area is considered a food desert (in an urban area this means that access to healthy, fresh food is more than a mile away; usually what IS easily accessible is a lot of fast-food, convenient stores, and small corner shops selling little to no produce); we want to be part of the solution to that problem.

First - before all others in time or order.

Urban - we are operated by HALO, Inc, an incredible resource addressing homelessness in Racine. Our operation is nestled partly in their parking lot and partly in space owned by our kind neighbor, Kranz, a local distribution company. We're in the city, in the middle of it all.

Farm - no animals, just amazing, locally-grown vegetables using organic practices!!

CSA (community supported agriculture) - we are providing this delicious produce to our direct community; the vast majority of our subscribers reside within a two-mile radius of us. These families will receive delivery of fresh vegetables 20 weeks of the year.

What We Need

HALO, Inc. was given a grant to raise a hoop house in 2013. With the help of Bukacek construction, the proper zoning from the city of Racine, and the dedicated work of three Americorps VISTA's, that hoop house went up and began producing in 2015. To realize the transformation of our program into a full-scale CSA, we need to construct nearly 20 raised beds and fill them with top-quality, organic soil. Here's a breakdown of these needs:

Lumber for one 8'x4' raised bed = $90
2.5 yards of soil to fill it = $60.

20 of these total = $3,000.00

Soil to fill the hoop house = $700

We also need a top-quality drip irrigation system and cash for the various odds and ends needed to finish off this project (think seeds, shovels, delivery baskets, etc).

Will This Matter in Racine?

 Here's a few things this program will accomplish:

- It is a step in the right direction to bringing fresh produce to those who lack easy access to it in our neighborhood. Here's a map of our region showing the extent of food desert in our area (areas in green have a significant number of low-income residents with low-access to fresh food; the orange star indicates our location directly neighboring this region):

- Our aim is to ensure that half of our recipients come from low-income households, the individuals and families most affected by food desert. This means that we are not merely delivering fresh produce to families that would otherwise buy it at Pick-N-Save, rather we are getting it into the hands of those who are not already consuming it on a regular basis.

- This program allows HALO residents an opportunity to learn a skill and more importantly have an opportunity to gain a much-needed reference for employment. Did you know that there are quality employers in our region willing to put people to work and train them on the job if they are in good standing with programs like these?

- Our doors are open to community members who would like to learn about urban farming and/or volunteer their time in a meaningful way to HALO.

- All profits from sales benefit HALO, Inc., 50% going directly to the shelter. The other 50%  ensuring the sustainability of Growing Home as a staffed program. Donations from this campaign will be used only to purchase items like the ones listed above. If you are unfamiliar with HALO, here are a few things you should know:

  1. Since opening in 2005, HALO has helped over 2,000 adults return to stable housing with enough income and savings to support themselves. 
  2. HALO is the only homeless shelter in Wisconsin offering Intensive Case Management paired with a comprehensive network of supportive services from 90+ area agencies. 
  3. The mission of the Homeless Assistance Leadership Organization (HALO) is to provide a pathway to self­‐sufficiency for those experiencing homelessness in Racine County. Read more here: HALO, Inc.

Risk and Reward

What am I most afraid of? Probably that my vegetables won't grow and I may have a lack of some produce and an excess of other things. Did you know, though, that CSA's are designed to allow the community to share seasonal risk with the farmer? Crop failure or drought doesn't have to mean the end of the season. It means we band together for a solution and reach an awesome outcome one way or another.

This model was chosen for this very reason. While it would be really cool to grow urban farm fresh vegetables for trendy restaurants that create awesome local dishes, we probably won't have the workforce and infrastructure needed to harvest, refrigerate and deliver crops in large volume on a weekly basis.

What we can do is provide an awesome product to a valuable community of people who are ready to share in the risk and reward with us!


What now?

There are two easy ways to help us out:

1) Donate today. Do I even need to say that every dollar counts? I know as well as you do that the hardest part of giving a small amount is getting up and finding my credit card. You can do it!

2) Share our story!

story:
OUR STORY

“The secret of getting ahead in life is getting started" - Mark Twain

•For over 15-years, owners - Kerry London Myers and Jeff Nunnemaker have been avid Pacific Northwest entrepreneurs with our roots embedded in the local travel and hospitality industries.

•Hood Canal Events is a unique event and recreation company that creates customized, personal and authentic PNW experiences for travelers to the region.

•Family run small business on the Hood Canal region of Washington State built on dedication, passion and dreams - oh, and a short bus.

•Kerry established Hood Canal Events in 2012, and I came onboard to assist with the growth of HCE and our event services in the PNW.

WHAT WE OFFER

“Far away the best prize that life has to offer is to work hard at work worth doing" - Theodore Roosevelt


•An unknown “escape” from the everyday to discover the magic of the Pacific Northwest through unique events and recreation based around YOUR needs.

•Premier venues, The Chateau Schafer – “Castle on Hood Canal” is an exclusive venue offering through HCE and we offer many other spectacular Hood Canal area venues in our preferred network.

•We represent a small book of vacation rentals to accommodate a comfortable over-night stay on the Hood Canal for our travelers.

•Local farm to table cuisine prepared in the PNW style by our professional chef as an integral part of every experience offered.

•Exceptional Hood Canal area recreational services – kayaking, hiking, foraging, shellfish harvesting, festivals and so much more.

•A 14-passenger custom designed bus for events, tours, and recreation transportation.

WHERE WE ARE GOING

“Roads? Where we're going we don't need roads" - H.G. Wells 

•Our passion and vision is to share unique Pacific Northwest events, recreation and experiences with travelers from around the world.

•HCE's #BeTheTraveler experience is uniquely designed to deliver the highest level of comfort and an unmatched PNW encounter.

•Each event we create is personally crafted with convenience, affordability and an amazing PNW experience as our top priority.

•Operated by local knowledgeable industry professionals for a safe and memorable Hood Canal experience.

•Hood Canal Events is the hub for local area experiences - our region is home to local art, exquisite farm to table cuisine, craft beer/wine/spirits, resorts, shopping and tremendous recreational opportunities along our incredible waterfront.

•As YOU become a member of HCE's #BeTheTraveler family you'll continue to develop tourism growth in the region by utilizing local small businesses and resources, while providing exposure for the Hood Canal and its surrounding communities.

THE HOOD CANAL REGION

“As soon as I saw you, I knew an adventure was going to happen" - Winnie the Pooh 

•The Hood Canal Events family is built around the local community, its history, and the legend of the Traveler. 

•The Traveler is a local icon in Union, WA. and his story is described beautifully in an article in the Kitsap Sun, Union Welcomes the Return of “TheTraveler.”  http://www.kitsapsun.com/news/local-news/union-welcomes-return-traveler

•When you #BeTheTraveler, you'll embrace the Hood Canal experience searching for the very best in local art, cuisine, recreation, events and the undeniable beauty of the PNW.

THE BIG ASK

“The only mistake you can make is not asking for help" - Sandeep Jauhar 

•Our dream is to grow our company, community, Pacific Northwest tourism and our traveler family by providing exposure for this "hidden gem" in our upper left corner of the U.S.

•Hood Canal Events has been extremely busy creating unique Pacific Northwest experiences and we want to increase our capabilities to support our local community, families and the growing tourism demands for our 2016 season.

•Our rented cottage office is quaint and unheated - don’t get me wrong, the view is amazing.

•Our catering and recreational equipment is currently stored in a rented garage across the street from our office.

•Our 14-passenger bus has an aging transmission that will need to be replaced soon.

•Any additional funds received will be utilized for marketing this beautiful area and the extraordinary event and recreational opportunities it posses for future travelers – exceptional fishing, hiking, kayaking, festivals and larger events (5k/10k, etc.).

DOLLARS AND CENTS

•New Office/Shop/Kitchen: 25K | We have been looking at a couple of locations capable of handling our office, operational, and storage needs and it is not cheap. Right now we would like to find a convenient office and storage location to optimize efficiency while we find a lease option for our commercial kitchen space and streamline our event and catering needs.

•New Transmission for the HCE Bus: 5K | Currently our bus is functioning safely with no signs of transmission failure. However, I've had the transmission serviced recently and replaced the rear differential. I was informed that it is showing signs of abuse and we would like to replace the transmission prior to the 2016 peak season.

•Additional 14 Passenger Bus: 20K | We have been very busy and it's great, but we are running into transportation conflicts. My partner handles the event planning side of HCE pursuing weddings, corporate retreats and special occasions. We have found it limiting on the business we can accept because of conflicting transportation demands on our recreation and private event side. I have restored a short bus before, and I am willing to do it again if provided the opportunity!

•Marketing and Advertising: 10K | The Achilles heel of business, how to spend your marketing budget and what works? We have spent the past year branding and building a strong social media following and ad campaign. Please visit our social media sites to see what it's like to #BeTheTraveler, don't forget to "like" us! I would like to explore other avenues like radio, television and print directed at larger markets to provide exposure for Hood Canal Events and tourism around the Hood Canal.

THE PERKS

"We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give" - Winston Churchill


•Hood Canal Events is all about #BeTheTraveler and delivering Pacific Northwest events, recreation and amazing experiences. 

•To celebrate your membership to the HCE family we've custom designed a limited edition graphics, and we will donate $1 from every T-shirt to Washington’s National Park Fund - a charity that is committed to deepen the public’s love of, and experiences in Mount Rainier, North Cascades and Olympic National Parks.

•We have included some tremendous perks for larger contributions to show our appreciation for your generosity traveler - we hope you find your own #BeTheTraveler experience on Hood Canal!

WHAT IT ALL MEANS

"Not only must we be good, but we must also be good for something" - Henry David Theoreua

•While visiting your Hood Canal destination #BeTheTraveler on a uniquely designed and unmatched Pacific Northwest experience.

•Bordered by the Olympic Mountain range, travelers reconnect with the world around them while discovering tremendous waterways, scenic trails and the many other alluring experiences that create the foundation for spectacular Hood Canal Events experiences.

•The Hood Canal region is one of the most beautiful areas of the world surrounded by a lush evergreen landscape, incredible waterlines and a comfortable mild climate that is perfect for enjoying your tailored events. 

•Whether you ascend the 5,951' elevation of Mt. Ellinor in the Olympic National Forest, say "I do" on the spectacular Hood Canal waterline, or harvest fresh PNW seafood, we guarantee you will NOT be disappointed in your experience. 

•Join us in supporting the Hood Canal region, its communities, small businesses and Hood Canal Event's vision to provide unique local events, recreation and experiences for PNW travelers!

THE CHALLENGE

"Part of adding value is helping people reconnect with some emotional side of their lives. In any situation, bring back the humanity, the emotion, the color, the flare, the joy, the vibrancy, the real hues of human emotion and you'll go to a level of adding value that most people will never replicate" - Brendon Burchard

•The Hood Canal area has seen a major shift away from the timber industry that was booming prior to the year 2000.

•Travel and tourism are now the leading income generators for the Hood Canal region as we continue into the 21st century.

•Hood Canal Events is looking to take advantage of this trend and emerge as a destination location and a premier area resource for travelers from around the world.

•With enormous growth in the Hood Canal community we have seen an increased demand for event and recreational services as well as larger events and festivals suitable for travelers of all ages.

•Mason County has acquired $160K in state tourism funds from the local government to support tourism expansion and unique #BeTheTraveler PNW experiences.

•Hood Canal Events has partnered up with Blue Collar - an interactive marketing company and the "Explore Hood Canal" campaign as well as programs like the Outdoor Project to take advantage of emerging area opportunities.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

"A kind gesture can reach a wound that only compassion can heal" - Steve Maraboli

•Hood Canal Events makes it easy for anyone to #BeTheTraveler. Supporting the local community, environment and creating memorable Pacific Northwest experiences is what we're about - we appreciate everything from a simple share to a contribution of any size!

•Pick a Perk and #BeTheTraveler with pride, or give us a shout and share what we're up to with your community and network - word of mouth is extremely valuable and it is how we got our start. 

•We need the support from the HCE traveler family if we are going to reach our funding goals - the more talk and exposure the better for Hood Canal Events, our community and local tourism, thanks for your support travelers!

•Discover the Hood Canal on Twitter -  http://www.twitter.com/HCETraveler

•Give us Your Heart on Instagram - http://www.instagram.com/HCETraveler

•Be The Traveler on Facebook - http://www.facebook.com/HoodCanalEvents

story:
Short Summary

Our grandma is an amazing, humble, loving woman. She is 77 and lives simply in a little trailer in Victor, MT. Recently, her electricity went on the fritz leaving her with iffy power at best. Then, to top it all off, her well's water pump is dying. Help donate to get Grandma's water and electricity back!

What We Need & What You Get

Initial quotes are that fixing the well pump will be upward of $1500! That's not to mention the hundreds in repairs she's already spent trying to limp through with the well as-is. Additionally, rewiring the electric and addressing electrical safety issues will likely be over $1000. We're looking for donations toward a modest goal of $2500 to help Grandma get the heat and water on before the Montana winter hits!

  • Just $10 will come with a big high-five and our gratitude. 
  • $25 donors will get a handwritten thank you from one of her six grandkids. 
  • $50 will award you with an eclectic drawing from one of her three great-grandkids. 
  • $100 will get you a handwritten thank-you from Grandma herself! 
Even if we don't meet our goal, all proceeds will go toward the cost of her projects. If we happen to go over our goal, she'll get a much-needed rainy day fund to help take care of other repairs around her modest property.

The Impact

Without your generosity, we grandkids aren't sure how to reach the amount of money she needs to take care of her basic needs of heat and running water. We'll give what we can, but need a little help from our friends! <cue The Beatles> That's where you come in. You have the opportunity to bless a very deserving, caring person with love and support that she has shown so many people over the course of her life.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that's OK! We would love if you could help us spread the word with your family, friends, social medias, communities, churches, and beyond. Thank you!
story_txt:
Short Summary Our grandma is an amazing, humble, loving woman. She is 77 and lives simply in a little trailer in Victor, MT. Recently, her electricity went on the fritz leaving her with iffy power at best. Then, to top it all off, her well's water pump is dying. Help donate to get Grandma's water and electricity back!   What We Need & What You Get Initial quotes are that fixing the well pump will be upward of $1500! That's not to mention the hundreds in repairs she's already spent trying to limp through with the well as-is. Additionally, rewiring the electric and addressing electrical safety issues will likely be over $1000. We're looking for donations toward a modest goal of $2500 to help Grandma get the heat and water on before the Montana winter hits!


Just $10 will come with a big high-five and our gratitude. 
$25 donors will get a handwritten thank you from one of her six grandkids. 
$50 will award you with an eclectic drawing from one of her three great-grandkids. 
$100 will get you a handwritten thank-you from Grandma herself! 

Even if we don't meet our goal, all proceeds will go toward the cost of her projects. If we happen to go over our goal, she'll get a much-needed rainy day fund to help take care of other repairs around her modest property.
    The Impact Without your generosity, we grandkids aren't sure how to reach the amount of money she needs to take care of her basic needs of heat and running water. We'll give what we can, but need a little help from our friends! <cue The Beatles> That's where you come in. You have the opportunity to bless a very deserving, caring person with love and support that she has shown so many people over the course of her life.

    Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute, that's OK! We would love if you could help us spread the word with your family, friends, social medias, communities, churches, and beyond. Thank you!

story:
Why I need your help:

Here in Cork East we have a real chance of taking a seat for the Social Democrats but we can only do that with your help.  We are a new party and I'm a new candidate and we're trying to compete with parties who have very deep pockets and huge party machines.

Every cent we raise in this campaign will go directly towards the purchase of election materials like posters and fliers.  Every contribution no matter how large or small can make a real difference.

You can also contribute directly via my website http://www.kencurtin.ie

All contributions are in accordance with the rules as laid out by SIPO here: http://www.sipo.gov.ie/en/Guidelines/Donation-Guidelines/Guidelines-for-TDs-Senators-and-MEPs/Donations.html

To find out more about my campaign please follow me on twitter http://www.twitter.com/kencurtin and like me on facebook http://www.facebook.com/KenCurtinSocialDemocrats

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Executive Description

Truly honest people in the Information Technology world, of today, understand and have understood for quite some time that existing approaches to managing and using data are woefully inadequate. Senior management, politicians and business owners alike across all spectrum of Industry, government and research are in agreement, or as one retired Oil Company executive put it. “50 years of promises, still no straight answer!” After all, they pay the bills...

The nature of our "Associative" Atomic Database technology makes it purpose-built for Big Data, making it possible for organizations to dramatically reduce the effort, time, and investment requirements of any Big Data project. Our platform is a multi-dimensional, multi-data information system, designed from inception to manage relationship complexity to any degree, with no restrictions on the number of associative dimensions or levels persistently. Data security is based on factorial encryption with byte random variability, substantially exceeding RSA encryption standards.. Engineered with usability in mind, AtomicDB is simple to use and easy to understand. This allows AtomicDB to implement projects several orders of magnitude faster than other technologies, ensuring business value and success.

One of the potential uses for AtomicDB is as the backbone for Bitcoin, allowing for truly global transaction capability. Another would be as a new Peer to Peer online game development platform. or the ability to correlate and investigate the entirety of medical information in the  USA, and even the globe, with proper design.

Unprecedented Technical Advantages

*    Speeds over 1000+ times faster than SQL row/table queries;

*    No data is too large to gain business insight

*    Data warehousing simplified

*    Little or NO ETL

*    Unlimited data Aggregation & Correlation (removing the limits of the SQL 15 Join Limits)

*   The design capacity to hold PETABYTE  or even EXABYTE + of information using 1/8 the disk space, significantly reducing data storage, hardware and maintenance costs

*    Single instance storage; no piece of data is ever duplicated making ETL (Extract Transform and Load) operations and data cleansing fast, easy, and cost effective

*    Data type agnostic; automated data aggregation across

hundreds of sources becomes a breeze, and seamless

*    No tables or indexing to maintain or understand; App

development time shrinks and complexity is reduced

*    Impenetrable security; with no name-space or storage

structure binding, there is nothing to hack into

*    NO QUERY Language

*    6 primitive API Calls

All of this translates to Business Advantages such as :

*    50-90% reduction in Storage requirements (costs)

*     70-80% reduction in developer costs

*     Immediate ROI

*     Near elimination of Security concerns (presently 23% of all IT budgets)

*     Unprecedented Access to Business Analytics (real time information )

*     50% faster to time  market

This is the First quantum leap in Computer Science and Data Management since Dr. Codd in 1971, and his rules of data Normalization. The impact will be global and pervasive for the very simple reason of "Efficiency"

 The single most powerful word in the world or nature is “Efficiency”, Energy can never be destroyed only transformed. The same applies to information. Despite the best efforts of the best computer scientists in the world with efforts like Hadoop, Mongo, Casandra etc..., they will and are all failing, simply due to the mathematics of the situation... Dr. Codd, created, devised, extrapolated 6 forms of Data NORMALIZATION, and after 45 years (1971), every single Database system or information management system to date has not exceeded the 3rd normal Form... except AtomicDB, (N) Normal Form improving on Dr. Codd's work by 4 levels (dimensions)at the very least .

There was and is a method to his theory, that with each level of Normalization brings a geometric increase in "Efficiency" and scalability, however, no one has even attempted the restrictions of the 4th normal form (no duplicates) let alone the 5th or 6th, and now with Dr. Everett’s (N)th Normal Form, we can do anything the human mind can devise on a computer and in nearly real time, that is


The founders include:

  • Mr Jean Michel LeTennier, 30 Veteran Data-center Architect and Engineer (CTO),
  • Ms Rhonda Greco, 20 year veteran comptroller (CFO),
  • Dr Diana Macys-Staley PHD 30 years veteran of Data Analytics (VP)
  • Mr. Ken Rubin 45 year Veteran Sales Executive.(VP)
  • Mr Matthew Kiderman  20 year Veteran Sales Executive.(VP)


We are nearing the end of phase one, The introduction of AtomicDB to the market, now 3 years in progress.  We have presently invested over 6 million$ into the company, all self funded

This has been a labor of love and extensive effort from everyone involved and we are seeking equally enthusiastic investors, partners to help bring this benefit to humanity


What We Need 

We are seeking funding to dramatically expand marketing and promotion and further develop our resale and partnership channel. This will permit use to hire 4 new sales executives and 4 new support engineers, as well as hold monthly technical conferences for introductory seminars.

 

The Impact

Aside from participating in a game changing technology, with massive humanitarian  & global implications, the excitement of being free to accomplish anything the human mind can imagine using computers is simply intoxicating, to Business, Technical and Academic enterprises alike.

Every book in the world is still made up of words or phrases or combined symbols. These amount to less than 2 million unique objects, whether some people  like it or not.. Using Associative technology, we can literally now store and make available any and all human knowledge in one place (if desired) and in all languages. The Impact to humanity will be global and pervasive.. Now it's up to you to open your mind..and stop thinking with a 1970's technology

 

 

Risks & Challenges

 The major challenges have been met introducing "Associative Technology" to a significant number of clients, this however is insufficient and we have to expand our exposure to more varied and wide ranging clients as well as academic environments Our risks are minimized due to our existing client base

 

Other Ways You Can Help

For those who want to participate in other ways, we ask you to learn about the technology (programmers, Data Scientists, Data analysts) and consider using it and introducing it to potential clients. We assure you, they will love you for it...

.

story:
D.C. Imaginaria 

¿Qué es?

Es un nuevo proyecto que invita a las personas a vivir una experiencia única desde el momento que entran al local y consumen nuestras pizzas de altísima calidad, toda una experiencia sensitiva, que gracias a un chef local podremos crear; nuestro fuerte: El servicio, este completará la experiencia única que será una mezcla de simplicidad e innovación en todos los sentidos. El objetivo es hacer sentir a cada persona que entre importante, por qué? Porque son la base del proyecto social que se esconde bajo la pizzería. La iniciativa en realidad invita a las personas a realizar una acción solidaria que tiene su fundamento en la confianza. Consiste en pagar anticipadamente una comida en este caso una pizza, para que pueda ser entregada a alguien que no tiene recursos para comprarlo. Esta idea surgió originalmente en Nápoles, Italia con el nombre de “caffè Sospeso”  y que gracias a las redes sociales ya se ha extendido por el mundo con muy buena respuesta de la gente, en Colombia se encuentra Café pendiente Colombia, movimiento del cual somos parte y nos apoyamos para la primera etapa de este reto.

La segunda etapa consiste en hacer la entrega de estas pizzas pendientes, en alianza con las diferentes organizaciones que trabajan con las víctimas de la violencia poder realizar encuentros semanales para entregar las porciones de pizzas donadas por los clientes de D.C. Imaginaria, no se trata de una limosna para comer, la persona que deja una pizza pendiente está brindando la posibilidad de un propósito de vida a personas que por su situación no tienen esa opción. En resumidas cuentas D.C. Imaginaria es una plataforma de empoderamiento social.

El cambio comienza con una porción de pizza… iniciará un viaje que es voluntario, pero que dice “te vamos a dar un empujón, porque tienes todas las posibilidades de salir adelante” el objetivo en esta etapa es capacitar a estas personas en habilidades de vida, emprendimiento y equipamiento laboral, para finalizar con una oferta formal de trabajo, ya sea en la pizzería o en una organización que aliada.

¿Cómo funciona y en qué consiste?

Imaginaria D.C. tendrá un local independiente en Bogotá – Colombia, ubicada centralmente donde tanto turistas como bogotanos puedan acercarse y  vivir una experiencia que inicie con el aroma de una pizza que bien merece la pena comer; vitrinas con pizzas, recetas nuevas, simples pero con innovación de sabores y mezclas, dejando de lado lo tradicional de las pizzas y poder brindar un bocado de Colombia en cada pizza, si te encanta probar cosas nuevas, estas pizzas tendrás que probarlas.  

No es una pizzería común.

Detrás de la experiencia gastronómica, se encuentra el corazón de D.C. Imaginaría, y todo empezará con una sección en el menú llamada “pizza pendiente” ¿por qué tienen una sección especial del menú? Porque D.C. Imaginaria cubre un porcentaje del precio de estas, y por cada cinco pizzas pendientes que nuestros clientes donen D.C. imaginaria pagará otra pizza pendiente para las personas víctimas del desplazamiento mayores de edad que viven en Bogotá.

En Colombia el  desplazamiento por la violencia afecta a miles de colombianos cada año,  de hecho hoy en día, buena parte de los hogares colombianos afectados viven en condiciones críticas, que en la mayoría de los casos son peores que las que caracterizan la indigencia; según estudios realizados para la Misión de la Pobreza y la Desigualdad de Planeación Nacional la situación de los hogares víctimas del desplazamiento en los municipios receptores es más precaria que la que viven en los mismos lugares los pobres urbanos y los hogares indigentes.

Los niveles de desempleo para los miembros de los hogares desplazados son mucho más altos que los que se tienen para los miembros de familias pobres urbanas y rurales e indigentes urbanos, los niveles de cabezas de familia analfabetas es mayor que en otros grupos, es por esto que decidimos trabajar con ellos no solo para brindarles una porción de alimento sino para generar una solución que pueda acabar con su ciclo de pobreza, generando un empleo, dignificando a la persona que salió del campo y ahora recorre el asfalto sin muchas garantías, brindando herramientas para que puedan salir adelante.

¿Cómo queremos lograrlo?

Primero es importante aclarar que D.C. Imaginaria es una organización con fines de lucro, podríamos decir que está basado en un modelo híbrido de negocio, es decir que genera un cambio social antes de tener un retorno de inversión, siendo al mismo tiempo lucrativo y funcional, el plan es llegar al retorno de inversión los primeros seis meses de funcionamiento, pero que semana a semana el dinero que se genere sea suficiente para cubrir los gastos operativos. Para esto es indispensable mantener un producto de calidad y un servicio humano excepcional.

El plan para el programa de cambio social es crear un programa de sensibilización para la generación de nuevos empleos que pueda presentarse en organizaciones, fundaciones y empresas que quieran y puedan hacer parte de este proyecto. En constante seguimiento con nuestro apoyo para poder capacitar a las personas que estén comprometidos con dar un cambio a su vida, los vamos a apoyar, a capacitar, a dignificar para que puedan contar con las herramientas necesarias para su sostenimiento.

¿Quiénes somos? 

Dos jóvenes colombianas psicólogas, apasionadas por la comida y decididas a hacer un cambio. Soñamos con un proyecto que una nuestra pasión, misión, profesión y vocación para volverlo nuestro propósito. Queremos promover un gesto solidario e integrador con quienes no tienen recursos. Nuestra idea parte con la labor que se está llevando a cabo en Argentina, Chile, México con café pendiente y sensibilizadas por el impacto que está tiene decidimos unirnos y trabajar en un proyecto en donde pudiéramos poner en marcha esta idea. 

Con esta campaña la vamos a sacar del estadio!!

Esto ya no se trata de nuestra campaña, se trata de cambiar la forma de pensar en los demás, esta idea no termina con la entrega de una pizza a alguien que tiene hambre. Queremos crear una revolución en las personas que nos visiten, que puedan ser testigos del impacto que crean con su colaboración; sencillamente queremos darle la oportunidad a las personas de ayudar fácilmente a otro: De ser parte del cambio, de cómo SU INVERSIÓN cambió la vida de alguien e inspiró a muchos otros a seguirlo haciendo. 

Podemos hacer esto juntos !

“Un simple acto de caridad, crea una espiral sin fin que siempre vuelve hacia ti”

Nuestro objetivo es ser una pequeña solución al creciente problema. También queremos que sea lo más fácil posible para las personas que nos siguen y apoyan ser parte de este viaje con nosotras! 

Por favor, ayúdanos a difundir esta campaña a través de los medios sociales, el boca a boca y compartirlo con tus amigos !!! Y los amigos de tus amigos !!!

Tu participación en esta campaña es muy significativa!

¿Cómo vamos a utilizar el dinero?

Buscamos financiamiento de 13.000 USD aproximadamente 35 millones de pesos Colombianos, que estarán destinados a la compra de materias primas, instrumentos, mobiliario, instalaciones y adecuaciones del local, que son necesarios para iniciar con la venta de las pizzas. Para esto debemos destinar 7.400 USD - 20 millones de pesos. 

El dinero restante estará destinado a cubrir: 

- Pizzas pendientes (a cargo de imaginaría por el primer mes) 

- Gastos de constitución

- Publicidad 

- Pagos de los primeros dos meses de funcionamiento:

* Alquiler

* Suministros

* Servicios públicos

* Gastos de personal ( 1 cocinero - 2 meseros) 

También puedes ayudar !

¿Quiénes pueden participar?

Toda persona que quiera ser parte del cambio abonando una comida pendiente una comida. Adicionalmente cualquier organización, fundación y empresa que quieran hacer parte de este movimiento, con un programa de sensibilización para la generación de nuevos empleos. Si deseas ser parte de este movimiento como voluntario, pasante, ángel financiero, también tenemos un espacio para ti.

Cómo puedo sumarme a la campaña?

Todo modelo de negocio tiene etapas, en este momento nos encontramos en nuestra etapa de financiación, hemos decidido hacerlo desde la plataforma Crowdfunding Indiegogo, deseamos evitar el endeudamiento con entidades financieras, y de esta manera todos pueden empezar a ser parte del cambio.

1.  Si te parece interesante el movimiento y quieres ayudarnos, puedes realizar tu donación a la campaña, solo necesitas una tarjeta de crédito y muchas ganas de ayudar. Tu ayuda hace una gran diferencia.

2.  Comparte esta campaña con tu familia, en el trabajo, tus amigos, los amigos de tus amigos y en redes sociales.

Estaremos publicando los avances y respondiendo cualquier pregunta que pueda surgir en cuanto a la campaña. Desde ya muchas gracias por colaborar.
