Twitter  - PDC_GO

Website  - PLAYDATECLUBHOUSE.COM


For media, contact Karen Taylor Bass, kt@taylormademediapr.com, 917-509-3061.

story:
Who We Are...

Rip's Malt Shop is a modern revival of the classic American five-and-dime with a new-age twist: we use 100% plant-based proteins (from @beyondmeat and @fieldroast) to create the delicious American classics you know and love.

 

In June 2018, we launched our flagship restaurant in the Brooklyn Navy Yard in an effort to balance out the need for vegan and plant-based, comfort-food options in the area - and the people flippin' LOVE the food we make @RipsMaltShop.  Our team is proving that it's possible to provide the mouthwatering meals people crave while still holding the principles of sustainability and veganism at the forefront.

 

No raw vegetables and bland quinoa here.

 

We have decadent malts and  ice creams with oodles of toppings, “bacon cheeseburgers”, vegan chili, chopped cheese, and fully loaded tater tots, like the ones you grew up loving.  Our food rip's up all the stereotypes you know about veganism.

 

 

What We Serve...

 

100% plant-based, vegan comfort food made by people who believe there is a sustainable way to feed the planet without having to miss out on mouthwatering flavor. Whether it's your first time trying meat-alternative foods or you're a certified vegan, Rip's is the destination for delicious, American-style comfort food. 

 

"We have customers that come in who don’t even realize that the food we are selling has no meat in it, and they leave just as happy as anybody else."

 

One of our top selling items at Rip’s Malt Shop (pictured above) is our “Chopped Cheese,” which is a NYC bodega staple. Being natives, we just had to include it on the menu.  The chopped cheese is a burger all chopped up, as the name suggests, with relish and onions added to it as it’s cooking on the griddle and topped with shredded cheddar cheese. Then we put all that on a hearty, club roll with lettuce, tomato and secret sauce. 

 

 

Our other best-selling item is the Rip's burger, made with coleslaw, BeyondMeat burger patties, rice-paper bacon (which we make in-house), red-bean & quinoa chili, and our very special Rip’s Sauce - an in-house, vegan version of “secret sauce”.

 

 

All of our sundaes and milkshakes are made with Van Leeuwen’s vegan ice cream products, another Brooklyn-based company with a conscious mission in mind.

It's the personal opinion of one our owners, Dave - life long ice cream connoisseur and professional chef -  that the vegan ice cream makes even better milkshakes than regular ice cream does. So Yeah - you’re welcome for that RipTip!

 

Veganism is about more than just food,

and this campaign is about more than just opening another vegan restaurant.

 

 

Hear our stories why...

 

Erick’s RIP's Story

Rip’s is a great restaurant because it's a nice stepping stone for people trying to make a change to veganism. It’s really easy to understand our menu – you know what a burger is, what a hot dog is, and you know what a milk shake is. And yes - you can still enjoy all of those things as a vegan.

Rip’s wants people to still enjoy eating whatever they want. Eating healthy is the way to go, but sometimes you do want a burger and you do want a hot dog - at Rip’s we have that awesome comfort food you want, and you don’t have to hurt your body or the planet to enjoy it.

People come here and stay for hours. They’ll eat one burger and hang out for 2 or 3 hours just talking with other customers. It’s cool how people can share ideas here. There are so many times I’ve started conversations with someone and then someone across the room chimes in, and the delivery guy comes in and says “I’ve been coming here for weeks and didn’t even realize it was vegan!” and that starts a whole other conversation!  Everyone's open to each others ideas here, it's what makes this place so special.

 

Veganism is more than just food. To show people what I meant by that I started an Instagram @HowToBeVeganInTheHood. A lot of my friends didn’t understand veganism, and they were always wondering “like, what do you eat as a vegan?” There are so many times I heard “So what?You only eat salad?  You eat dirt? What do you eat?" So I honestly just wanted to show them that I wasn’t missing out on anything. I was still getting the same flavors that I wanted and I didn't have to hurt animals or the environment in the process.

 

Being Puerto Rican, it’s part of the Heritage to eat pork and all this other stuff, and for a while I was like “I’m never going to stop. I can’t.” But I’ve come to learn that being closed minded about anything in life isn’t going to get you very far. I feel like I was that way and a lot of my friends were that way until we gave it a try. Now, to this day, I tell people, “even if you’re telling yourself you don’t want to go vegan - ever – give it a try for just a week out of your life and see how you feel." You may like it, you may not, the choice is yours, but give it a chance and then see what happens from there.

 

Dave’s RIP's Story

 

Before I owned Rip’s Malt Shop, I owned a barbecue restaurant if you can believe that.  However, the more research I did on growing my meat-based business, the more I found instead of the appalling impacts red meat and meat production on our bodies and our environment. 

It became too hard to stomach the facts. As a young, restaurant owner I knew I had to step up and do my part now to end the cycle of using products that generate profit at the expense of people and the environment.  

Look, I'm not saying that making this kind of conscious commitment is easy.  I used to be the biggest meat-eater ever.  I'm not proud to admit it, but I even tried denying all this for a while because, like most other people in NYC, I grew up having meat in almost every single one of my daily meals my entire life.  Now I never could have imagined that I would "take" to plant-based foods myself, but I also knew in some way I had to at least try, if not for myself, then for the people I serve.

Interestingly enough, in the process of searching for plant-based alternatives to serve at my restaurants I ended up learning how easy it was to eat plant-based myself while still getting all the flavors I love.  It's been an enlightening process so far, and dare I say it, I just might be on my way to becoming fully plant-based myself.

That's right - spoiler alert - not all of us who own Rip’s are vegan. (It's probably why we aren’t your typical snobs about it too!) Our team of diverse, industry veterans is committed to supporting conscious food practices, eating locally, and serving plant-based foods whenever possible.

At Rip's we acknowledge that veganism is a conscious process. It's not something that can be flipped on and off like a switch. It takes an effort to change our minds and accept the work we each need to do to ensure a sustainable future we can all benefit from.  That’s really the "meat" of what Rip’s is about and why we started this concept.

 

Whether you’re a vegan or not, everyone can come and enjoy the comfort-food at Rip’s Malt Shop. 

 

What We Are Looking For...

 

We want to rip up everything you thought you knew about veganism and bring the best, vegan dining experience to lower Manhattan that everyone - from the certified vegans, to the plant-based curious, to the true-blooded meat-eaters - can enjoy. 

 

Rip's is looking to raise $35,000—with a stretch goal of $80,000— to help us expand our vegan restaurant concept to Lower Manhattan. With your support we can achieve our mission to build a competitive, restaurant business based on ecologically sustainable and socially-forward practices.

 

Help us show more people that there is a better way to eat comfort-food that's both better for you and for our planet.  

 

Every dollar of your support will be put right back into developing and expanding the Rip's Malt Shop restaurants.  From buildout, to equipment, to licensing logistics and operations - your donations will help us grow and become a leader of the plant-based movement toward a sustainable future for our people and our planet. 

 

 

With Your Help...

 

We can spread the plant-based food phenomenon to help lessen the human impact on the environment, slow down the detrimental meat industry in America, and bring vegan food to neighborhoods lacking in decent meat-alternative options. At Rip's we believe in conscious eating and we are committed to serving people the food they love without harming the planet. Lettuce prove it to you - one burger at a time.  

 

Our seeds for a plant-based movement have been sown, and we are passionate in showing how Rip's Malt Shop can grow to its utmost potential.   Rip's is committed to making food that's both good for you and for the planet. We want to share our vegan concept with a larger community and with your support, open a 2nd location in Lower Manhattan.

 

Help us spread the word & share our campaign!

 

         #RipsItUp

    #Buckforourluck

 

 

 

 

 

Video created & produced by The Humane League

Now, to this day, I tell people, “even if you’re telling yourself you don’t want to go vegan - ever – give it a try for just a week out of your life and see how you feel." As a young, restaurant owner I knew I had to step up and do my part now to end the cycle of using products that generate profit at the expense of people and the environment.  Look, I'm not saying that making this kind of conscious commitment is easy.  I used to be the biggest meat-eater ever.  I'm not proud to admit it, but I even tried denying all this for a while because, like most other people in NYC, I grew up having meat in almost every single one of my daily meals my entire life.  Now I never could have imagined that I would "take" to plant-based foods myself, but I also knew in some way I had to at least try, if not for myself, then for the people I serve.Interestingly enough, in the process of searching for plant-based alternatives to serve at my restaurants I ended up learning how easy it was to eat plant-based myself while still getting all the flavors I love.  It's been an enlightening process so far, and dare I say it, I just might be on my way to becoming fully plant-based myself.That's right - spoiler alert - not all of us who own Rip’s are vegan. (It's probably why we aren’t your typical snobs about it too!) Our team of diverse, industry veterans is committed to supporting conscious food practices, eating locally, and serving plant-based foods whenever possible.At Rip's we acknowledge that veganism is a conscious process. It's not something that can be flipped on and off like a switch. It takes an effort to change our minds and accept the work we each need to do to ensure a sustainable future we can all benefit from.  That’s really the "meat" of what Rip’s is about and why we started this concept. Whether you’re a vegan or not, everyone can come and enjoy the comfort-food at Rip’s Malt Shop.  What We Are Looking For... We want to rip up everything you thought you knew about veganism and bring the best, vegan dining experience to lower Manhattan that everyone - from the certified vegans, to the plant-based curious, to the true-blooded meat-eaters - can enjoy.  Rip's is looking to raise $35,000—with a stretch goal of $80,000— to help us expand our vegan restaurant concept to Lower Manhattan. With your support we can achieve our mission to build a competitive, restaurant business based on ecologically sustainable and socially-forward practices. Help us show more people that there is a better way to eat comfort-food that's both better for you and for our planet.   Every dollar of your support will be put right back into developing and expanding the Rip's Malt Shop restaurants.  From buildout, to equipment, to licensing logistics and operations - your donations will help us grow and become a leader of the plant-based movement toward a sustainable future for our people and our planet.   With Your Help... We can spread the plant-based food phenomenon to help lessen the human impact on the environment, slow down the detrimental meat industry in America, and bring vegan food to neighborhoods lacking in decent meat-alternative options. At Rip's we believe in conscious eating and we are committed to serving people the food they love without harming the planet. Lettuce prove it to you - one burger at a time.   Our seeds for a plant-based movement have been sown, and we are passionate in showing how Rip's Malt Shop can grow to its utmost potential.   Rip's is committed to making food that's both good for you and for the planet. We want to share our vegan concept with a larger community and with your support, open a 2nd location in Lower Manhattan. Help us spread the word & share our campaign!          #RipsItUp    #Buckforourluck     Video created & produced by The Humane League

story:
Hi! I'm Amy, and I run a bakery called Peaches Bakeshop. I'm fundraising to create a brick & mortar location for making and offering my vegan baked goods!

 

I formed Peaches in April of 2018, but I’ve been baking for over 10 years. My love for baking sparked when I went vegan in 2009. Vegan baked goods weren’t accessible to me where I lived in New Jersey, so I started baking for myself. The first thing I ever baked was vegan snickerdoodle cookies. Once I bit into that cookie, it was like my world opened up, and I began to wonder what other baked goods I could veganize. I graduated with a Pastry Arts Certificate in 2011, and that’s when my career really started. I worked in bakeries in New Jersey until my husband and I moved to California in the fall of 2013. Since then, I’ve been working in kitchens and baking freelance, and I am finally ready for a space of my own. 

Not only will your contribution help me to secure a storefront, fill the space with all of the necessary equipment, and get me started, it will enable me to live out my dream - providing Los Angeles with handcrafted baked goods made with love - something that I believe that the city is still in need of. My specialty is cakes, but I make everything from cakes to croissants to pies and more.

I don't have a location secured yet, but the aim is to be located in Northeast LA.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I am seeking $50,000, which will aid in securing the lease of a building, equipment (including mixers, double convection oven, bakery cases, commercial fridge & freezer, retail POS system), working capital in the beginning stages of opening the Peaches storefront, and permits & licensing.
  • My perks include coffee, pastries, merch, cake, and even a cake decorating class for you and a friend!
  • If I don't reach my entire goal, I'm still going to push hard to keep Peaches Bakeshop going. Funds raised will be used to secure the lease of a space, and if necessary, I will seek a small business loan. Of course, I'd rather operate with the support of my community rather than be at the mercy of a bank, but the Peaches brick & mortar is on the horizon either way!

The Impact

  • More vegan options for the community! Making vegan baked goods more readily accessible in Los Angeles is, in my opinion, deeply necessary! Even in 2020, it is a scarcity to walk into a bakery and order a delicious and beautiful vegan birthday cake.
  • The vegan community is growing every year, with new vegan options popping up all of the time. The demand for vegan food is on the rise.
  • Peaches Bakeshop as it exists now, although small, with just me at the helm, and only operating in my spare time, has been a success! I am asked often where I can be found, and I can't wait to be able to point folks in the direction of a physical brick & mortar!

Risks & Challenges

  • Owning a small business always comes with risk. Price fluctuation in food depending on the season is among one of them. I can avoid this risk by negotiating contracts with wholesalers at fixed pricing. 
  • Competition is also another potential challenge. I believe that I navigate this by offering unique products not found anywhere else in Los Angeles. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Many folks, including myself, live paycheck to paycheck. Extra funds are few and far between, so I understand what a HUGE ask it is to contribute financially. Even if you cannot support monetarily, you can still help! Please share my campaign on social media platforms and ask your friends to share as well. Spreading the word is the most valuable asset to my campaign.
  • No matter how you choose to support, I appreciate you all from the bottom of my heart!

story:
Dear Upper Valley residents; Dartmouth students, faculty, alumni, and staff; and maybe even a few generous book lovers from all around the world,

My name is Allie Levy and I am here to bring Still North Books & Bar to Hanover, NH. 

A bookstore/bar!? Tell me more.

Yes! Still North Books & Bar will occupy 2,678 square foot on the first floor of the former Dartmouth Bookstore, with the main entrance on Allen Street. The inventory will be curated specifically for the community, with a focus on literary fiction, narrative nonfiction, indie presses, local and alumni authors, book club picks, poetry, outdoor reference and guides, cookbooks, and theory. Want a book that’s not on our shelves? Just ask. We will have access to nearly any book currently in print and be able to get it in for you in just a few business days.

When I heard that the Dartmouth Bookstore would be closing at the end of 2018, I was heartbroken at first to see a nearly 150-year old institution shutter its doors. But the more I thought about the possibility of bringing a bookstore to a town we love, I got excited. I think we need a new bookstore in Hanover, and it turns out, a lot of you agree. After months of lease negotiations, I am ecstatic to have secured a portion of the former Dartmouth Bookstore space, which I will be turning into the bookstore (plus bar and cafe!) that Hanover deserves. While my personal funding and loans will cover what I need for build-out, fixtures, professional services, and operating expenses, I’m asking for your help in filling the shelves with books.

Hanover doesn’t deserve just any bookstore. We deserve a bookstore overflowing with the books that we want to read in a gathering space with cozy chairs and perfect work nooks and beverages for any time of day and delicious food from fresh ingredients. We deserve a bookstore that’s going to last. Yes, it can be a tough world for bookstores, which rely on low-margin products that require a lot of physical space to make a profit. Supplementary revenue from the bar and café will help.

For this reason, Still North Books & Bar will serve wine, craft beer, and locally roasted coffee to keep your thirst quenched and your energy up while you devour your book or get in the zone with some work. We don’t just want you to buy your books here; we want you to stay and enjoy them, maybe even make a friend or find some community, and the physical space will reflect that. We look forward to welcoming you for our community events, including readings, signings, book clubs, story times, trivia and game nights, and more when we open for business in fall 2019.

If you want to watch us as we grow, follow us on Instagram, Twitter, or Facebook for renovation pictures, promotions, event teasers, special guest star testimonials from some of your favorite authors, and of course, the opening day announcement. 

And all this is going to cost HOW MUCH?

My total start up budget is $350,000. That includes extensive renovations (many of which will be covered by my landlord), bar build-out, book fixtures and other furniture, licensing, legal fees, graphic design, signage, other professional services, labor, tech, a point of sale system, coffee equipment, refrigeration, miscellaneous bar equipment, and, of course, books.

$75,000 will cover roughly 75% of our opening inventory. Every dollar over our goal up to $100,000 means more books on the shelves! And any amount over $100,000 will go towards making the store an even better place for you to hang out—more comfy chairs, better reading nooks, more programming… I need your help to make Still North Books & Bar the bookstore that Hanover deserves.

What's in it for me?

When you contribute, you're actively investing in the future of your community. For added motivation, we're offering some great incentives, including signed books, tote bags, free coffee, bookmarks, discounts, early access to news about the bookstore, and more. If you have ever longed for a new kind of space in Hanover, here is your chance to help make one.

Okay, but who are you?

I graduated from Dartmouth in 2011 with a degree in English. Since 2005, I have worked for and managed both small businesses and regional chains, including:

  • a Birkenstock store in Northern Michigan where I learned that even if the shoe fits, what matters most is making happy customers;
  • the Eastern Mountain Sports flagship in NYC where I realized that even if you try, you can’t turn Manhattan into an outdoor playground on par with the Upper Valley;
  • an ice cream shop in Golden, Colo., where I was reminded day after day that while Amazon can ship ice cream, they can’t ship an experience;
  • and the most perfect bookstore/wine bar you could possibly imagine in Denver, which is the primary inspiration for this project.

Interspersed with my retail experience is four years of marketing experience in the book publishing and outdoor industries, with a focus on social media, content marketing, and event coordinating. My career has taken me from New York City to Denver, and back to New York, and after years of city dwelling, I could not be more thrilled to return to Hanover!

What you really need to know is that I have dreamed of opening a proper bookstore in Hanover for years. The Upper Valley felt like home from the minute I stepped foot on the Dartmouth campus as a visiting high schooler. While my experience in publishing, marketing, and bookselling will be a huge asset, what’s really going to get the doors open (and keep them open) is my love for this place and the people that live here—and my conviction that bookstores are crucial to the health of their communities.

Seems like risky business… Why indies?

Between 2009 and 2015, the number of independent bookstores in the U.S. increased by 35%. E-book sales are down this year while physical book sales continue to climb, particularly in the independent channel. Sales at indies showed a 5.4% compound growth rate over the past five years, and a nearly 5% increase for 2018 over 2017 as of mid-December. At the same time, sales at big-box book stores are down.

You may have seen this on your social media feeds recently:

But you’re a reader, not a statistician, so here’s the crux of the matter: independent bookstores provide a third place for people to gather away from work or home and revel in their community, exchange ideas with their neighbors, get lost in someone else’s experience, or simply take some time alone—together.

How else can I support Still North Books & Bar?

If you’re not in a position to give, here are a few other ideas:

  • Share this page on your social media
  • Follow our progress @stillnorthbooks on Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook
  • Tell a friend or two or 100 about this campaign
  • This is your bookstore, and we want to hear from you. Tell us what you want to see in the store and we’ll try to make it happen. You can reach us at info@stillnorthbooks.com.

Funding is just the beginning. The most important thing you can do is join us at Still North when we open in fall 2019. Read a book, grab a coffee or a snack, sip a glass of wine, catch up with a friend, bring your family, or challenge a coworker to a friendly round of Scrabble. Please, use this space for what it was made for so that we can be here for another 150 years.

I can’t wait to see you there! Thank you so much for your support.

Until then,
Allie

story:
COLONIAL MARKET FAIR 2015...THE BEST YET!


This year marks the sixth annual Colonial Market Fair on June 13 and 14 at the Benjamin Banneker Historical Park and Museum in Catonsville, MD and we need your help to fund this community event. A celebration of early American life, this event offers visitors a rare opportunity to retrace the footsteps of Benjamin Banneker while they watch colonial craftsmen at work, hear lively music of the period, and try their hand at colonial crafts and games. Last year this two-day event was a huge success with over 1,600 visitors and twenty-five colonial craftsmen and re-enactors.

Now the planning committee is working hard to make the 2015 Colonial Market Fair even better. However, to do so we need your support. Please make a donation or purchase an ad to be featured in Colonial Market Fair promotional materials. All funds will be used to compensate craftsmen and re-enactors, increase marketing efforts, and purchase additional colonial games. 

Ad prices are as follows:

o  $25.00 name featured in program

o  $50.00 name featured in program (3 ½” x 2”) and on website

o  $100.00 name and logo in program (4 ¼” x 2 ¾”) and on website

o  $250.00 name and logo in program (4 ¼” x 5 ½”), web site and lawn signs

o  $500.00 name and logo in program (5 ½” x 8 ½”), web site, lawn signs, and banner over Frederick Road in Catonsville,, MD (pending)

All ads printed in the program will be in black and white.  Remember, there was no color ink during colonial times.

Please email your advertising material to Cara Miller at colonialmarketfair@gmail.com in .docx, .jpg or .bmp form.  Ads can also be mailed to:

Benjamin Banneker Historical Park and Museum

c/o Cara Miller

300 Oella Ave.

Catonsville, MD 21228

All ad submissions are needed by May 16, 2015. 

For any further information on Benjamin Banneker Historical Park and Museum or the Colonial Market Fair, please do not hesitate to contact the museum at (410) 887-1081, or by emailing BannekerMuseum@BaltimoreCountyMD.gov.  You may also view our website at benjaminbanneker.wordpress.com.

story:
We are heading into the final push of our campaign. 

 23 hours left! 

We are so grateful for all who have shared the news. It has meant over 1200 visitors and 22% funded, and a campaign that is Trending in the Small Business category!   We are asking all of you to help us reach our goal.

Support the farm "Pretty, pretty please with strawberries on top?" :o)

The dry season is soon upon us, the rain water reservoir tank  is currently at 34 cm which is about 12,000 liters, but we need to seal it properly in order to use the full capacity of 46,500 liter!  We still need help.

Sam has chosen lovely perks, ranging from insider knowledge on growing your own hydroponic strawberries to oyster mushroom sporeprints (with instructions on how to grow them) to a variety of beautiful African handicraft.

If you visit Kololo in Kampala, drop into The Bistro where they use Sam's Hydroponic Strawberries in a popular cocktail with rum and crushed ice. Sam has dubbed the drink "Dessert Yum Yum". His berries can also be bought at a Chinese owned Italian supermarket and an Indian grocer- in Tank hill and Kisimenti.

If you're too far away from Kampala,  you can take some video tours of the farm with Sam: check out the ingredients required to produce lovely strawberries and have a look at all the wonderful wildlife in the area. There are new updates in the video gallery!

Keep in mind that you are helping someone who is helping themselves in "The Pearl of Africa". If you've never been there, I found a wonderful blog which describes it so well. 

www.fortheloveofwonder.com/blog/21-best-things-about-living-in-uganda

This is where my brother is innovating farming with his Hydroponic Strawberries. 


All help counts to reaching our goal!

xo Luba Mukibi Lynch




Sam's Hydroponic strawberries are grown on the family farm which is located in the lakeshore zone outside of Kampala, Uganda where I live and work. Agriculture is the backbone of Uganda's economy and the rich, red earth and favorable climate conditions are a blessing. Aside from Strawberries I have used my entrepreneurial and engineering skills to be a self-taught farmer in fish, mushrooms and various fruit seedlings for local farmers. Being my own boss is exhilarating as well as a challenge and I am learning everyday.

My farm relies on a 46,500 liter underground rainwater reservoir for most of our water needs.

In order to be economically viable we must use the free rain water, and store it in anticipation of the dry season. There is also a government water utility company, but, to cut down on costs and ensure that our small business can keep in business, we limit the use of expensive government water.

Hydroponic strawberries have many benefits and are easy to grow: the berries are plump and luscious and easier on your back to harvest. There is a good market for the sweet strawberries- full of vitamins and minerals. I started construction of the system and planting of the strawberries last year.

As I got ready to start my business, I did not realize that my underground rainwater reservoir was leaking!  Primarily, it was a slow leak. The full tank leaked out in 3-4 weeks and by the time that I noticed, my construction budget had also leaked dry.

I messed up.  And now, I need some help.

Today, the leak is worse, and in the film you can see how plant roots are growing and increasing the cracks. Along with hairline cracks in the walls and sides this means that the tank can now only hold 34 cm of water. That is approx. 3 days supply in the Dry season!

Last January to March was an unusually hot Dry season and it was a real challenge to keep my plants alive while they consumed 1000 liters of water per day. Unfortunately, there was not a drop of rain and the government water utility started rationing water. This meant that water was only supplied Saturday, Tuesday and Thursday from 12am to 5am.

Under these conditions, I have spent all my local resources to get Phase 1 of the Hydroponics strawberries up and running, and I desperately need your support to help my plants survive.


My goal is to raise 1800$ and renovate this underground tank using waterproof cement with a steel float finish.

This requires:

  • Plaster sand
  • Lake sand
  • Waterproof cement compound
  • Cement
  • Transport
  • Supervisor
  • Skilled labor
  • Unskilled labor
  • Some tools and scaffolding
  • Water to fill up the tank when done

A large part of the funding raised will go towards purchasing, shipping and packaging of perks , as well as fees.

Your contribution is vital in helping to uplift this farming community because without the safety net of a water reservoir we are always a week away from disaster. You help will also ensure jobs in the local community. If you are not in a position to contribute to our campaign, we would also appreciate if you help out by sharing a link to this page on your various social media accounts!

If I do not achieve my funding goal then I will water proof as much as I can.  Every 7 cm water proofed represents ca. 1000 liters of storage, and it would be great to water proof up to the 12,000 liter mark. Then I would able to call a 12,000 liter tanker in an emergency and that would be an enormous help. 

If I exceed my funding goal then I would put the excess in my plant seedling nursery producing orange and mango grafted seedlings for other local farmers for the next rainy season. 



Check out the perks! I hope you find something you will enjoy.

I have fashioned three categories of perks;  

  • sharing my strawberry hydroponics farm experience with you
  • sharing my love of mycology (mushroom spore prints/cultures) 
  • locally-made and unique African handicrafts that further support our local craftsmen and artists  and make you look trendy at the same time.

Are my strawberries June-bearing, ever-bearing or day neutral? 

Get these and other questions answered on all perks below 25$! 

Learn how to grow your own tasty strawberries and mushrooms loaded with essential nutrients.

I will share information about my farming experience in strawberry hydroponics and mushrooms.   

All questions asked during the duration of the campaign will be answered even after campaign end. I'm looking forward to sharing information with those interested.

The spore prints/cultures will be sent by registered Airmail, with 2-4 weeks arrival time from my receipt of funding.

The East African ethnic products will be shipped with TRACKING estimated arrival 2-4 weeks from my receipt of funding. Please quote size of shirt required.

If demand is high, the hand-crafted items will have an added 2-3 week period to allow for more stock to be crafted. Items might differ slightly from picture i.e no 2 handmade items are exactly alike.

I hope you find something that you or your loved ones can enjoy.

We understand that you may not be in a position to contribute to our campaign. You can still help out by sharing a link to this page on your various social media accounts!

Thank you!


Explanations and descriptions of The Perks are available under the photos below, as well as in the Perks selection.


5 USD. Spores and Curiosity 

A grey oyster (Pleurotus ostreatus) sporeprint (with instructions on how to grow your own delicious oyster mushrooms) and 3 questions answered. 

15 USD. More spores and Curiosity 

A grey, white (pluerotus sajor caju) and yellow (Pleurotus citrinopileutus) oyster sporeprint (with instructions on how to grow your own delicious oyster mushrooms) and 5 questions answered. 

25 USD Spores galore and Curiosity 

A grey, white and yellow oyster sporeprint Plus a Shiitake and Calocybe indica culture (with instructions on how to grow your own delicious oyster mushrooms, beware Shiitake and Calocybe indica are much harder to grow)  And 5 questions answered. 

25 USD  Curiosity killed the Cat

All your questions answered.  From construction to day to day management, I will share my experience with you.

25 USD    I just want to help and require nothing but gratitude.
Cool. We can give you our undying gratitude.



25 USD "Elegance"  Earrings. 


25 USD "SunShine" earrings. 

Handcrafted and also available in green and red. Please note color on order.

45 USD Travel neck pouch 

The pouch is made from Mutaba tree bark cloth- an ancient craft of the Baganda tribe.  UNESCO recognized bark cloth as a Masterpiece of Oral and Intangible Heritage of Humanity. Open the zip, it is the perfect size for passport and credit cards when you are on the go as you can wear it under your shirt. 



40 USD "Nandi" necklace.


50 USD "Isis queen" necklace.



50 USD "Cleopatra" Necklace.



50 USD  "Mbora mbora" handbag

Medium size. Handmade African ethnic handbag with leather woven shoulder strap.   Very stylish for shopping, casual and beach trips. All bags have inner lining and a zip.

50 USD  "Serengeti" handbag.

Medium size. Handcrafted African handbag with broad leather shoulder strap.  For when you want that Ethnic look.This bag has s sturdy inner lining and zip.

50 USD African art.

Art on cloth depicting rural African scenes. Here a herder with famous Ankole Longhorn cattle. Comes without frame.


75 USD  African Display Chess set

Elegant African inspired hand carved from soap stone.  This would look great on your living room coffee table.

100 USD "Mboro mboro moja" Handbag

Very Large and beautifully crafted Handmade African ethnic bag.   Great for shopping,  All bags have inner lining and a zip. For when big is in, very chic.

100 USD  "Serengeti moja"Handbag

Large and sturdy Handmade African ethnic bag.   Great for shopping, weekend trips or just when big is back. All bags have inner lining and a zip. When you want an ethnic look.


100 USD African ethnic shirt.

Every man needs one of these in their wardrobe.  Look fabulous at that party, everyone will notice you.  You can pick the main color but designs vary because they are all unique.


Thank you for your contribution.  Please help us by spreading the word.
story_txt:
We are heading into the final push of our campaign.  23 hours left! We are so grateful for all who have shared the news. It has meant over 1200 visitors and 22% funded, and a campaign that is Trending in the Small Business category!   We are asking all of you to help us reach our goal.
Support the farm "Pretty, pretty please with strawberries on top?" :o)
The dry season is soon upon us, the rain water reservoir tank  is currently at 34 cm which is about 12,000 liters, but we need to seal it properly in order to use the full capacity of 46,500 liter!  We still need help.
Sam has chosen lovely perks, ranging from insider knowledge on growing your own hydroponic strawberries to oyster mushroom sporeprints (with instructions on how to grow them) to a variety of beautiful African handicraft.
If you visit Kololo in Kampala, drop into The Bistro where they use Sam's Hydroponic Strawberries in a popular cocktail with rum and crushed ice. Sam has dubbed the drink "Dessert Yum Yum". His berries can also be bought at a Chinese owned Italian supermarket and an Indian grocer- in Tank hill and Kisimenti.
If you're too far away from Kampala,  you can take some video tours of the farm with Sam: check out the ingredients required to produce lovely strawberries and have a look at all the wonderful wildlife in the area. There are new updates in the video gallery!Keep in mind that you are helping someone who is helping themselves in "The Pearl of Africa". If you've never been there, I found a wonderful blog which describes it so well. 
www.fortheloveofwonder.com/blog/21-best-things-about-living-in-uganda
This is where my brother is innovating farming with his Hydroponic Strawberries. 
All help counts to reaching our goal!xo Luba Mukibi Lynch
Sam's Hydroponic strawberries are grown on the family farm which is located in the lakeshore zone outside of Kampala, Uganda where I live and work. Agriculture is the backbone of Uganda's economy and the rich, red earth and favorable climate conditions are a blessing. story:
Here's the Scoop

Hi, I'm Cheryl. What this campaign is about is giving hope and a future to a 16 year old boy and his family from Uganda. My family and I met Regan James just last year while he was touring Canada with his school. He was happy to meet us, because we are a family of artists and so is he. Opening up to us, he told us about his dream of becoming a video editor. When I saw his desire to help others, and the potential he had to make a difference for his country, I quickly became interested in getting behind him to support him in reaching his goals. 

What we need first and foremost is to make sure that he and his family are provided for. Our goal is for them to be able to buy property in Uganda so they can run a chicken farm. Currently Regan James and his mother and five siblings are renting a small place, and only one of his sisters is working. The others are sponsored so that they can go to school. However with your help, they can have their own property and a chicken farm to sustain them.

Secondly, we are supporting him to make his dream a reality. Regan James dream is to become a video editor, and produce movies. His desire is to come back to Canada so he can attend school here, to learn video editing. My husband, Jared and I, with our sons, Toby and Jairus, are very excited to have him come to live with us so he can fulfill his dream.

If you will join in and help alongside us, Regan James and his family will experience hope and a future. The magnitude of your contributions how ever small or large will be very far reaching. Through his movies, he plans to promote change in his country and even reaching all over the world. You have the honour of being a part of this!

What We Need & What You Get

We will be needing at least $10,000 for land and a chicken farm. If we don't reach our goal, our family will still give all the money we raise to Regan James and his family and we will continue to fund raise in other ways in order to help them become established with their own property and chicken & egg business. If we exceed the amount, 100% of the funds will still go to him and his family, for building a house, establishing their business. The cost of the Perks you get will be covered by generous businesses like Creative Print All in Steinbach, MB and others, separate from this campaign. 
Some of the perks we offer are t-shirts, vinyl stickers, original paintings by Cheryl Nickel and an invitation to attend a party at our house for Regan James when he comes to Canada. See pictures of the art in the Gallery.

The Impact

The really cool thing about this campaign is that Regan James will be making movies, and you will be able to see them. You can simply follow him on YouTube and see his movies progress throughout the years. His mandate is to promote change in Uganda first, and then the rest of the world. What a difference you will be making just by contributing to this campaign, enabling him to live out his calling.

Personally, I have never felt so passionate or driven about any project I have undertaken before this. I am very honoured that God has put me in a position that I can do something so significant as this.

In the future we plan to take our family to visit Uganda. It will be so exciting to meet Regan James family and see the impact you all have made in their lives by your generous contributions. In advance, I want to thank you so much for caring! 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are other ways you can help besides money donations. One big way is to tell people about this campaign, send out facebook links, twitter etc... anything you do has the potential to make a big difference!

Thank You SO Much!

I wish you could just see how happy I am doing this campaign for Regan James. Thank you so much for your contributions, your sharing links, your interest, and your time. God bless you heaps!

story:
Why Mutts 'N Honey?

We love dogs.  We're crazy about them.  We treat every dog we interact with as though it were our own.  We always seem to be the ones our friends have always asked to watch their dogs when they're out of town.  And we do.  We realized that we are pretty good at being pack leaders and caring for dogs with our full attention - so we decided to expand beyond watching our friends' dogs and provide those in the City of Angels with a place their dogs can enjoy, socialize, and feel part of a social network.  

We've found a great location, in a neighborhood with far too little options for their furry loved ones.  We are located in the heart of the warehouse district, amid countless rehabilitation and housing projects.   We are adjacent to the city's $400M 6th Street Viaduct project, which aims to bring a new "gateway to Los Angeles" towering over a new park and recreation area.  

Another project in the vicinity, about 5 blocks away, is One Santa Fe.  This mixed-use project is designed by the same firm that designed the new bridge.  It contains 438 designer apartments which are dog-friendly.  Combined with cafes, shops, and markets, this development will bring many people to this area of renaissance in Downtown Los Angeles.

While a small number of dog daycare facilities exist in the area, and even smaller number offer any outdoor space for the dogs to play in, and as any dog owner can attest to - dogs LOVE the outdoors.  Another thing dog owners can attest to: dogs HATE being left alone.  Which is why we want to help.  We understand Los Angeles is a town filled with people who work long hours and with seemingly longer commutes.  And after coming home from a long day at work and sitting in traffic for what feels like eternity, the last thing you want to do is go on a long walk with your pup.  We want to wear your dogs out so when you get home - you have a loving, furry friend who wants to curl up and cuddle with you.

What We Need & What You Get

We’re looking for a minimum of $40,000.00 for this campaign so we can pay the contractor, RJ Design & Construction.  They have agreed to work with us and are continuing the construction process to get us open.  How amazing is that?!?!

As for what’s been paid and what still needs to be paid for, it comes down to this:

Paid for:

-Demolition

-Concrete steps – had to add these in

-Plumbing

-Electrical

-Framing & drywall supplies

-Roll-up door

-Interior doors & hardware

-Entry door & glass windows

-Lint trap

Still need to pay for:

-Additional plumbing

-Additional electrical

-Drywall installation

-Stucco

-Interior doors & hardware installation

-Floor tile & installation for bathrooms

-Dropped T-bar ceiling – to pass mechanical inspection


We're ALMOST there!!!


For helping us, you get the following perks:

-$5 – you get a hi-five when you come to visit!

-$10 – you get an amazing bear hug for being you!

-$25 – your choice of one of the following: one night of boarding, one day of daycare, a Mutts ‘N Honey retractable leash, or a Mutts ‘N Honey LED doggy bag dispenser --> day of daycare normally costs $35, night of boarding normally costs $60, so you save $10 or $35 respectively

-$50 – your choice of either one night boarding or one day of daycare PLUS a leash or an LED --> night of boarding normally costs $60, so you save $10

-$100 – one night of boarding or one day of daycare, PLUS a ticket to the grand opening party, an LED, a leash and a t-shirt --> package worth $150

-$150 – one week of daycare, 2 tickets to the grand opening party, an LED, a leash and a t-shirt --> package worth $385

-$250 – one week of boarding, 2 tickets, an LED, a leash and a t-shirt - package worth --> package worth $560

-$500 – one month of daycare, 2 tickets, an LED, a leash and 2 t-shirts --> package worth $1225

-$1000 – one month of boarding, 2 tickets, 2 LEDs, 2 leashes and 2 t-shirts --> package worth $1990

-$2500 – daycare for 1 year, 4 tickets, 2 LEDs, 2 leashes and 2 t-shirts --> package worth --> package worth $13,055

-$5000 – boarding for 1 year, 4 tickets, 2 LEDs, 2 leashes and 2 t-shirts --> package worth $22,180

-$10000 – daycare for life, 10 tickets, 2 LEDs, 2 leashes and 4 t-shirts --> value priceless!

-$20000 – boarding for life, 10 tickets, 2 LEDs, 2 leashes and 4 t-shirts --> value priceless!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, that’s alright.  We more than appreciate you looking at this page.  Here are some other ways you can help:

-Spread the word! Tell your friends, family, neighbors, co-workers and other dog lovers about us!

-Follow us and like our posts on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter

   What We Need & What You Get 
We’re looking for a minimum of $40,000.00 for this campaign so we can pay the contractor, RJ Design & Construction.  They have agreed to work with us and are continuing the construction process to get us open.  How amazing is that?!?!As for what’s been paid and what still needs to be paid for, it comes down to this:Paid for:-Demolition-Concrete steps – had to add these in-Plumbing-Electrical-Framing & drywall supplies-Roll-up door-Interior doors & hardware-Entry door & glass windows-Lint trapStill need to pay for:-Additional plumbing-Additional electrical-Drywall installation-Stucco-Interior doors & hardware installation-Floor tile & installation for bathrooms-Dropped T-bar ceiling – to pass mechanical inspectionWe're ALMOST there!!!For helping us, you get the following perks:-$5 – you get a hi-five when you come to visit!-$10 – you get an amazing bear hug for being you!-$25 – your choice of one of the following: one night of boarding, one day of daycare, a Mutts ‘N Honey retractable leash, or a Mutts ‘N Honey LED doggy bag dispenser --> day of daycare normally costs $35, night of boarding normally costs $60, so you save $10 or $35 respectively-$50 – your choice of either one night boarding or one day of daycare PLUS a leash or an LED --> night of boarding normally costs $60, so you save $10-$100 – one night of boarding or one day of daycare, PLUS a ticket to the grand opening party, an LED, a leash and a t-shirt --> package worth $150-$150 – one week of daycare, 2 tickets to the grand opening party, an LED, a leash and a t-shirt --> package worth $385-$250 – one week of boarding, 2 tickets, an LED, a leash and a t-shirt - package worth --> package worth $560-$500 – one month of daycare, 2 tickets, an LED, a leash and 2 t-shirts --> package worth $1225-$1000 – one month of boarding, 2 tickets, 2 LEDs, 2 leashes and 2 t-shirts --> package worth $1990-$2500 – daycare for 1 year, 4 tickets, 2 LEDs, 2 leashes and 2 t-shirts --> package worth --> package worth $13,055-$5000 – boarding for 1 year, 4 tickets, 2 LEDs, 2 leashes and 2 t-shirts --> package worth $22,180-$10000 – daycare for life, 10 tickets, 2 LEDs, 2 leashes and 4 t-shirts --> value priceless!-$20000 – boarding for life, 10 tickets, 2 LEDs, 2 leashes and 4 t-shirts --> value priceless!  Other Ways You Can Help 
If you cannot contribute, that’s alright.  We more than appreciate you looking at this page.  Here are some other ways you can help:-Spread the word! Tell your friends, family, neighbors, co-workers and other dog lovers about us!-Follow us and like our posts on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter

story:
Hello Friends!

As many of you may already know, Spirithaven has hosted the Darbukastani Independence Days (DID) cross-cultural, music and dance camp for 15 years now, as well as the Front Porch Fest musical festival for the past several years.

These are community centered, performance arts events that bring music and dance to folk of all ages. The events provide an educational, artistic outlet to the people of southern Virginia and the surrounding area as well as great performance offerings for the community.

And Spirithaven's event offerings are expanding!

Not only are DID and Front Porch Fest growing, but Spirithaven is expanding its offerings in June 2015 with:

* the Blue Ridge World Music Festival - http://www.spirithavenevents.com/blue-ridge-wor...

* and the Virginia Faery Festival - http://www.spirithavenevents.com/virginia-faery...

You can read more about Spirithaven and events held at Spirithaven at:

http://www.spirithavenevents.com

While we are excited to be offering such a diverse selection of artistic experiences for the community, we also need to make some necessary improvements to help accommodate our camping patrons, artists and performers alike.

We have recently purchased some additional land that will help to expand our parking and camping capacities, but the land needs to be cultivated for these needs.

We are also in near desperate need of a new well and shower house for our campers.

It is going to cost us (ballpark) $10,000 to have a commercial well dug near the main camping site, as well as $2000-$5000+ to build a new shower house and start developing the recent land purchase.

The well is the most important part right now. It needs to be 330 feet deep. With a $10,000 price tag, that's a bit more than $30 per foot. 

And we're asking for your help.

Everyone who donates to our fundraiser will have their name included on a commemorative plaque on our new shower house. :-)

Every little bit will help us to offset the costs of getting Spirithaven ready for our fabulous events this summer. Even a $5 or $10 donation can help. 

Thanks so much for reading about our project, and please pass the word along.

-The Eutslers

story:
My name is Matt Knudson and I am a 25 yr old artist, musician and entrepreneur from Norman, Oklahoma. My latest project is an organization dedicated to positive human connection. The Bamboo Geodesic Dome I am almost done building, will be a hub for evolved ideals, sacred moments, and enlightened creations. Workshops will be held inside of the dome to help heal the human mind body and soul in an attempt to raise the collective consciousness. (i.e.Yoga, Meditation, Sound & Crystal Healing) 


To bring the dome to it's target audience, we ask you to join us in raising funds, for the weatherproofing and transportation. We wish to purchase repurposed vinyl billboard tarps to create a weatherproof cover. Sewing the vinyl together will also require heavy duty thread and/or velcro for easy setup and takedown. For transportation we wish to purchase a 10 ft trailer to haul the collapsable dome from state to state. All of the leftover proceeds will go towards solar equipment, eventually making the dome temporarily habitable for off the grid situations. I estimate the trailer will be the biggest expense, but for $200 we will be able to get roughly 2,000 sq ft of tarp. That will be plenty to cover the entire structure.


Thank you again for your Time & Support! Every contribution will be rewarded with Pyrography art by @Cosmic_Impressions. 


Project P.E.A.C.E & The Bamboo Dome are scheduled to appear at Easter Island Festival, Norman Music Festival, and Head For The Hills Music Festival. Come Vibe With Us! Much Love

story:
We are raising money for the initial buildout and support for the first few months of North County Family Bicycles. We are using a local contractor and local labor. North County Family Bicycles is a place to go to find the right bicycle for you from the current utility cycling technologies and use that bicycle to pursue your personal goals.  Come check out more of our philosophy and product line at:

http://ncfamilybicycles.com/about/

http://ncfamilybicycles.com/family/

http://ncfamilybicycles.com/products/

story:
Help prevent a tragedy

7 Kingdoms, and more, are in danger. By providing regular healthy meals to George RR Martin, we can ensure that the citizens of Westeros continue to exist.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $15,000, which is our estimate for enough to feed one person for the length of time required to write two novels.

The Impact

Every citizen of Westeros will continue to survive.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk is that George RR Martin will have enough healthy meals available already. If so, we will donate any additional money to Meals on Wheels: because every older person has a universe inside of them that will be gone when they pass on, but not  everyone has a legion of fans supporting them.


Update:


An endorsement from Miss Nevada 2015, Lisa Song Sutton, playing the Game of Thrones theme song on her flute. Note the two-book gap on the bookshelf!

story:
What happened?

In 1997 I visited Nepal for the first time. During that trip I made a friend for life, his name is Ram Khatri. I've been back to visit Ram several times over the years and I've seen his family grow and also his own family home built between his sister's house and his father's house.

His family has grown too! The first time I was there his first daughter, Mira was just a few months old. The last time I was there in April 2014 he had 4 children. Mira, Krishna, Rupa and Rashmi.

In the first earthquake that hit Nepal last month Ram's house collapsed. Rashmi, his youngest daughter was only 4 years old and was inside the house.

She didn't make it.

What They Need


During the last trip I was accompanied by two friends who were welcomed into Ram's home like family. Jago Miller, Harrison Duff and I made a film whilst we were out there featuring our stay in their home. You can watch it here and see what life is like; https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zbziahTLPAY 


We are giving what we can, but we don't have the means to send enough money to help the Khatri family rebuild their home.


Right now they are sleeping outdoors and the monsoon is starting.


The idea is to raise £3,000 which will pay for his house to be rebuilt along with helping the surrounding community. 


Anything raised above this amount will go directly to helping the people of Jyamrung.


The community in Jyamrung is remote and no aid has reached them so far. Nobody knows if it ever will. Even though the donations so far to charities has been overwhelming, it's not going to be enough.



The Impact


There can never be any form of compensation for the loss of a child. No parent should ever have to endure that, but to also see your remaining children sleeping outside must be unbearable.


Every penny raised here will go directly to the family. They will use the money to rebuild their lives. Anything raised above the goal will go help those in the surrounding community of Jyamrung.


Other Ways You Can Help


If you would like to send some kind of aid package instead of donating money then please get in touch and we can help you to do that.


Let's make a difference and directly rebuild the lives of this grief stricken family and community who are far from the current reach of aid programmes.

story:
Hi there!

Have you ever tried to learn English but had a hard time using it in real conversation?

My name is Jennifer England.  I am a Canadian who has been living and teaching English in Spain for close to 20 years.  Through my experience, I have come to learn that the missing piece of the English puzzle, for most of my students, is the ability to practice what they have learned, in a safe environment, without fear of failure.

That is why I have designed a learning experience like no other.  Here at English Laboratory we are dedicated to helping business professionals, students and travelers take their English skills to the next level.  Through our innovative 2.0 program, individuals are video-linked live directly to one of our professionals who will facilitate English conversation practice. Depending on your starting point, the program lasts from one to six months. Our model consists of 3 twenty-minute sessions a week with the tutor of your choice and a Personalized Daily Training Program. This combination of increased exposure to the language, multiple interactions with a native speaker plus a custom-designed program based on your needs and schedule makes it possible for learners to reach fluency in a maximum of six months. 

At English Laboratory, we don’t want communication to be a barrier to success for businesses or individuals and so we would like to spread the word that we are here to help.

In order to do so however, we are going to need a little help promoting this endeavor.  The website is almost ready to go and our conversation specialists are online and eager to talk. 

Please help us achieve our goal of raising 6600€ to be allocated to advertising and finishing the web page, so that we can start connecting people to people and begin a world-wide conversation.  After all, we at English Laboratory see no reason why our efforts cannot expand to languages around the world, building opportunities for a global village. 

Don’t wait!  Be one of the first to get involved in this ground-breaking learning media.

Thank You!

Jennifer England, Radical English Tutor

English Laboratory

Risks and Challenges

The English as a Foreign Language (EFL) environment is very competitive with a plenitude of both David and Goliath players. Book publishers, official institutions, private schools and independent tutors all vie for the learner’s dollar. What most organizations or individuals fail to recognize is that while money is no object when it comes to learning English, time is of considerable consequence. The method employed by English Laboratory launches the learner to fluency in one to six months depending on the starting point. This is a fraction of the time it takes compared to traditional grammar based methods that measure progress by years.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't make a financial contribution you can still be a part of this exciting project! Please spread the word. If you know any donators, learners or tutors, let them know about English Laboratory!

story:
About Us

We are here growing organically in Mallorca because we love the island, and we love to grow delicious and nutritious food for others. It gives us the greatest of pleasure to know that the finishing touches on fine dining plates around the island come from us.

 

 

Our clients have come to depend on us, and we have a responsibility to keep growing and evolving, continually striving for the best, and always keeping ahead of trends.

To continue to expand at the rate that we need to we need to enlarge our growing space. As we increase our client base, and our product range, our polytunnel is getting increasingly packed. We need to at least triple our growing area to be able to continue to provide our clients with the amounts, and types of produce they need.

Our clients are constantly updating their menus. This means that they are always looking for innovation from us. They need new products, so we need to invest in new seeds. As our client base increases, we need larger quantities of seed. A kilo no longer lasts us long, and we need to be able to order 10 kilos of each seed variety at a time.  We also need to be able to store these seeds, so will need to buy a container for that purpose.

Our current storage space for our cut produce is a small, old fridge. We need to get two larger, economical ones.

We need to add three solar panels to our system in order to be able to run the fridges.

Delivery is becoming difficult, as we have a small vehicle, and our orders are growing. We urgently need to upgrade our vehicle to accommodate rapidly increasing demand for our products.

Being able to expand in these areas will allow us to go from a small business to the leading microgreen business in Mallorca. It's what our clients what, so we need to make it happen.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need 74,600 euros. 30,000 will get us our vehicle,  1,000 our solar panels, 25,000 our polytunnel space, 2000 will enable us to hire a digger and do the work to clear the land where we will put the tunnels, 4500 will pay for shelving for the tunnels, and payment for people to help us build them. 4000 will allow us to buy enough compost and trays for the year ahead. Another 600 will enable us to buy gravel to cover the ground under the polytunnels. This will help to stop weeds coming through.

3000 will buy us the seeds we need to kickstart ourselves for the year, and 2000 will buy us the container in which to store the seeds. 2500 euros will buy us the fridge space we need

In return for your help, you will get the chance to try growing microgreens for yourself, with our tailored kits that make it easy for you to grow these delicious, nutritious microgreens for yourself.

We also have in stock items labelled with our unique Els Ullastres logo. We have t-shirts, keyrings, tote bags and various other goodies.

 

Where we are at and where we are headed.

Growing organically has always been important to us. Growing microgreens is just the beginning. We plan to develop Els Ullastres in the direction of providing a wide variety of heirloom, organic produce, initially to restaurants, and later to a wider market.

  • Planet Earth is at a critical point. Pesticides and unsustainable farming practices are destroying insect life and pollinators such as bees, that, quite simply, are essential to our survival.
  • We have shown that it is possible to grow produce worthy of michelin star restaurants without the use of a single chemical. We plan to continue to demonstrate this with many varieties of vegetables, producing a model that can be used anywhere. We are already inspiring those around us, and have begun working with local Mallorquins, who are interested in growing with us.
  • As we develop, so too will our website. We plan (as soon as time allows) to incorporate a blog, with more detailed information about our evolution. In the meantime, please visit us at: www.elsullastresmallorca.com and our instagram https://instagram.com/elsullastresmallorca/

What our future holds

To continue to grow organically, slowly introducing more produce, we have many learning curves ahead. Our stony land needs extensive rehabilitation over a period of years. We will need to continue to explore natural and non invasive methods of pest and disease control. We need to find cost effective ways of achieving this, and then we need to share these with our community, and attempt to slowly persuade others that growing naturally is sustainable.

For this, we need time. We need our microgreens business to continue to succeed. From our profits, we will begin to transform our beautiful piece of land into a productive, organic, farm

Please share our project

We all appreciate all donations, however small. 

And just as helpful as donations, is helping us to spread the word. So if you can share this on facebook, twitter or any other social media, we will very much appreciate the help! and don't forget that Indiegogo also has tools to help you share our page. 

Thank you very much for your time.

And just as helpful as donations, is helping us to spread the word. So if you can share this on facebook, twitter or any other social media, we will very much appreciate the help! and don't forget that Indiegogo also has tools to help you share our page. 
Thank you very much for your time.

story:
Three years ago, I quit my job and emptied my savings accounts to open Riverdel because I'm passionate about animals...and cheese!  Opening the first store has been great.  Our amazing team works so hard at bringing delicious vegan food to our neighborhood, and now we're taking the opportunity to serve an even wider community by opening up a second location at the brand new Essex Market in Manhattan!

The location of our new shop is beautiful, we can't wait for you to see it!  The market is already built out but we still need to buy inventory and kitchen appliances which are very costly.  While the store in Brooklyn keeps running, your funding will also help us to hire and train new staff, and promote some of our current staff members who are ready to grow with us and take on more responsibility.  This is exciting!

Together we can save the world!

The world is a tough place, and it's even tougher for farm animals who are often neglected and abused.  Any amount you can spare will help Riverdel bring even more delicious vegan food to the world without harming animals.  We'd love for you to be a part of our journey, and please spread the news!

story:
Become a part of the “1st GENERATIONS CLUB”

http://generationsnj.com/

We are inviting our friends and family to help us get over the last hurdle before being able to open GENERATIONS, comfort food & catering.  When we started this adventure, we didn’t anticipate doing a FULL demo and renovation to the ENTIRE space, (including the basement). Along with updating the decaying refrigeration systems and coming up to code for fire and safety needs, the opening budget was depleted sooner than expected. But, we only get a chance to do this thing right ONCE. We know in our hearts that this is the only and the best way for us to open our business.

So, now faced with a shortfall to our initial opening budget, we discussed various possible financing alternatives to ensure that we would have the necessary funds for OPENING DAY! In the end, and after weighing the pros and cons, we decided to create the “ 1st GENERATIONS CLUB “ This is a club of individuals, who like us, are enthusiastic about remembering and recognizing the past, all the while planning for a bright and successful future.

As part of this exclusive club, you will not only be helping GENERATIONS start
off on the best foot possible, but you will also have access to some really cool
CLUB PERKS, as well. Click on the perks for full information

These perks will ONLY be available during this 15 day limited promotional period offer.

And there just might be a secret perk in it for all of you, who join the club

Thank You so much for consideration in helping get our dream afloat

John, Evans, Phil & Mark

http://generationsnj.com/

story:
Short Summary

I have been working with individuals and teams for over 19 years to bring strengths-based living to their reality.  Whether college students, young families, managers or teams the  empowerment found in coaching people's strengths keeps making a difference!

Now I want to bring this to more people, families and teams more formally!  Maybe even you!  I'm launching a training and teaching business called Stately Pine.  I will hold workshops for families, coach managers and teams working with vulnerable populations and do one-on-one work with individuals.  My goal for 2018 is to reach 100 families, 3 teams serving over 150 families, and as many individuals as we can reach!

 

What  I Need & What You Get

To do this I need $12,500 in start up funds.  This launch will provide the training and tools I need to become recertified as Strengths Coach through Gallup and buy the tools needed to manage the business.  

After the $12,500 is raised, all funds will go toward scholarships to allow families living in the crisis of poverty to experience the power of knowing their strengths and raising children in a whole new environment!  A gift of $75 will sponsor one family's scholarship!

You will get the satisfaction of knowing you have made a life-long impact on an individual and their families!

 

What are my strengths?

I have taken Gallup's StrengthsFinder four times in 19 years.  It always rings true.  My top five are: Activator, Ideation, Woo, Positivity, Command.  And THIS is the primary reason why I am finally doing this.  I need to live out of my strengths, not in the briars of who others think I should be.  This is what I want for you.  This is what I want for families.  This is what I want for our communities - the truth that living out of your strengths brings hope and joy!

 

Risks & Challenges

I have a voice in my head that says, "Who are you to think you can pull this off?"  It is voices just like this that keep great ideas from flourishing.  I don't have plans to quit my very rewarding day job, but rather I plan to make space for this life-giving adventure - my true vocational call.

The only risk I have is not even trying.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't in a position to give today, please share this with someone you know!  Also, stay connected to my website and watch for opportunities for you and yours to live out your strengths!

www.statelypine.com

story:
Heartfelt Cycle Studio - Crowdfunding

 

Heartfelt Cycle Studio is the first Queer-Owned indoor cycling studio in Columbus, Ohio. Our focus is being on intentionally inclusive and community-centered. We began as a single-location yoga studio in Feb 2020 (just 44 days before having to close to the pandemic). Despite all limitations of our first year in business, our community thrived and we became the top-rated and most-reviewed yoga studio on Google in Columbus, Ohio. This new venture is our way of expanding the community and showing that this need for representation, diversity, inclusion, and equity is needed in the cycle community as well. Our biggest challenge has been having funding for the initial bike purchase order, and facing a different level of scrutiny from banks and lendors as a young LGBTQ+ entrepreneur with a social enterprise business model. In our events over last summer, we raised 10k collectively that was donated directly to individuals and organizations of underrepresented and marginalized identities. None of that money flowed back into the studio, but we knew one day the community would come back around to help us too. And here we are, expanding the heartfelt community. We're also the only studio in town that owns two separate dedicated spaces where one is for yoga and one is for cycle. Follow along with our progress on instagram, @heartfeltcyclestudio. Grateful to have you all along for the ride!

 

Video created by reelhootproductions.com (Lesbian, Woman-of-Color, Asian-American)

story:
EMPOWERING WOMEN AROUND THE WORLD

The Story

Helene Swanson, one of Katrina’s Dream four co-founders, is engaged as a spiritual duty in a yearlong pilgrimage across the United States walking through all 15 states rallying support in those states that have not yet ratified the Equal Rights Amendment (ERA).  

Helene started her journey on International Women's Day Bridgewalk, at the Golden Gate Bridge in San Francisco, CA on Saturday, March 8, 2014.  She sleeps roadside, at the occasional Good Samaritan’s home, and in churches along her route.  

During her pilgrimage, Helene meets with state and federal legislators to garner their support for ERA ratification in those states. She lobbies federal legislators to co-sponsor joint resolutions calling for the removal of the deadline imposed on the ERA where community leaders and organizations across the country have joined her in person and via teleconferencing during the meeting(s). Helene also helps to coalition build.  Here is an interview by local NBC Anchor Felicia Lawrence

Helene is currently in New Orleans, Louisiana having made her way across Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Oklahoma, Missouri, Illinois, and Arkansas, seven of the 15 non-ratifying states.   She is currently working with local folks and setting meetings up calling for Louisiana to ratify this most important component of the Civil Rights Movement.  

This coming March 2015 she will make a trip to New York City to attend the upcoming United Nations 59th Commission on the Status of Women and Beijing 20+ to enlist the support of folks from around the world to urge the United States to make women equal under the law. 

Then Swanson will return to New Orleans to resume her pilgrimage across the USA for the ERA.  Adjusting her schedule accordingly Helene expects to arrive in Washington, D.C. on August 26th, 2015, where she will meet with this nation’s leaders to demand the passage of the federal Equal Rights Amendment.

Helene believes that sexism and racism is intricately entwined and here in the USA gender inequality is one of the many hidden faces of racism clearly demonstrated by the fact that white women receive 75 cents to their male counterparts dollar, black women 67 cents and brown women 57 cents respectively, and that a Federal Equal Rights Amendment will put an end to discrimination against women and people of color.  Please see The Pew Research Center for more facts on the Gender Pay Gap.

The Equal Rights Amendment states:

"Equality of rights under the law shall not be denied or abridged by the United States or any state on account of sex."

It is a simple statement that would define the meaning of "We the people" to include the majority of the population--that is women. We do not have a statement in our Constitution, which guarantees women the same rights and responsibilities that all men have by virtue of them being born male. The only guaranteed right that women have under our Constitution is the right to vote--which they had to fight for almost 80 years.  In short it would balance the gender biases which also affect those of the LBGTQ community.

Helene, an Episcopalian and aspirant for the priesthood of the Church of North India, co-founded Katrina’s Dream in memory of her late mother-in-law, the Rev. Katrina Martha Van Alstyne Welles Swanson. Katrina was one of the "Philadelphia Eleven "- eleven women who were "irregularly" ordained to the priesthood in 1974, becoming the U.S. Episcopal Church’s first female priests. When the Equal Rights Amendment failed to be ratified by the required 38 states, Katrina began to recite the Pledge of Allegiance “with Liberty and Justice for SOME!” When questioned “Why ‘some”? She would reply, “Because the ERA was voted down, retired women are more likely to live in poverty than men.”

Katrina’s Dream’s Letter of Endorsement was included in Congresswoman Tammy Baldwin’s Resolution HJ 47- the “Three State Strategy” that resurrected the ERA in 2009.

The Need

Katrina’s Dream is asking for your support to help cover the costs of Helene Swanson attending to the United Nations 59th Commission on the Status of Women.  The conference draws about 5,000 attendees and this is a wonderful opportunity to share the progress being made with our brothers and sisters around the nation and across the globe of the colossal human rights movement growing here in the United States to empower women.

The Impact

The Equal Rights Amendment is a US Constitutional Amendment that will empower women, provide Constitutional Pay Equity and reduce violence against women, re-affirm the rights of men, and provide Supreme Court Justices with an amendment to rely upon in ruling on issues that affect our brother and sisters in the LBGTQ Community. 

The Ask

ITEM

COST

 

 

Registration Fees

$155

Literature

$500

Travel Expenses

$500

Lodging (12+ days)

$1000

Food (16 days @$25 a day)

$400

 

 

TOTAL COSTS

$2555

Please add your contribution, your few dollars, your many dollars, to make this phase of Katrina’s Dream ministry more than a dream, indeed a reality. 

For those uncomfortable making donations online please send your check to:  

Katrina's Dream

68 Baldwin Street,  #2

Charlestown, MA  02129

And please remember Helene Swanson in your prayers.  

Take It One Step Further

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. So we are asking that you please:

1.  Forward this email to your friends asking them to support and pray for Helene on her quest for Women’s Rights.

2.  Go to our website and learn about the ministry of Katrina’s Dream

3.  Follow us on Twitter https://twitter.com/Katrinas_Dream 

4.  Like us on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/www.KatrinasDream.org. 

Together we can move our great nation forward in achieving equality for women here in the United States and empowering our sisters around the world.

Katrina’s Dream is a registered 501 (c) 3 whose mission is the full inclusion of women in both the Church and in Society.
